loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es: La joven Nuris tiene 25 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada para mejorar su negocio cada día, casada y con dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como conductor en el mercado oriental, junto han construido su casa de concreto pero le falta el repello, poner piso ya que es de tierra y quisiera poder hacer estas mejoras pronto para dar un mejor servicios a sus clientes ya que llega todo tipo de cliente por que su negocio es una pequeña pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos como también frutas y verduras. Inicio este negocio con dinero que ahorro de su trabajo por que se fue a trabajar a España en servicios domestico para poder ganar y terminar de hacer su casa como traer dinero, fueron días difíciles por que estaba sin su familia, y trabajando mucho pero se siente contenta por haber logrado el objetivo ya que aquí en nuestro país hay mucho desempleo y como domestica es poco lo que se gana y se trabaja demasiado, que por mucha necesidad lo hacemos. Con este préstamo quiere comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, aceite, jabón, lácteos, carne, pollo, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, pan, productos enlatados como: sardinas, atún, chorizo entre otros para aumentar las ventas y poder ir ahorrando para poner el piso. Gracias a estos préstamos puede aumentar su inventario el cual esta muy contenta por los beneficios.
texts.en:
Nuris is 25 years old and is a very hard-working woman who puts forth a lot of effort to improve her business day by day. She is married with two children; her husband is a driver in the eastern market and together they have been able to build a good, concrete home but they have not yet plastered the walls nor put in a floor. They would like to make these improvements soon to provide a better environment for the customers of their small store which they run out of their home. They sell a variety of products including fruit and vegetables. They started the business with money she saved from her prior work; she went to work in Spain as a housekeeper to earn more money to finish her home but it was a difficult time for her since she was away from her family and she worked long hours. Nonetheless, she is happy that she accomplished her goal because in our country there is a lot of unemployment and housekeepers don't earn much especially given how long they work but people do it because they have to. With this loan she will buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, soap, dairy products, beef, chicken, sodas, juices, snacks, bread, and canned goods like sardines, tuna, chorizo, etc. in order to increase her sales and keep saving for her home. Thanks to these loans, she is able to increase her inventory; she is very grateful for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, dairy products, beef, chicken in order to increase sales and provide better service to her customers

loans.name: Laurence

texts.fr: H. Laurence est née le 10 août 1971 et réside à Vodjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à AHOSSI Edmond, un agent commercial, Laurence est mère de deux enfants et a un autre enfant à sa charge.  Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Laurence vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Laurence a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Pour contribuer aux charges familiales, Laurence vend divers articles (galettes d'arachides, fournitures scolaires, conserves, etc.) et des produits cosmétiques à son quartier. Laurence s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Laurence exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans.  Laurence est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Laurence sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de renforcer ses activités et de se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses charges.
texts.en:
Laurence H. was born on 10 August 1971 and lives in Vodjè in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Edmond Ahossi, a commercial agent, Laurence is the mother of two children, and has one other child in her care. All of the children are in school. Laurence lives together with her children and husband. The couple provide for the family together. Laurence ended her studies in secondary school. To contribute to meeting the family's expenses, Laurence sells various items (peanut cookies, school supplies, canned goods, etc.) and cosmetics in her district. Laurence gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has run this business for 4 years, and is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having already obtained four loans, all of which she repaid properly. Laurence is seeking a fifth loan with ALIDÉ in order to strengthen her business and generate a larger income by raising her sales.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy body lotions, school supplies, and canned goods

loans.name: Medina

texts.en: Medina runs a small grocery store located in a busy market area in Kakamega, Kenya. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to increase her stock. She has been in business for 3 years, and previously sold cereals. Medina is married with three children, and eventually would like to be a wholesaler of goods in the market. Some of the challenges that Medina faces are fluctuating prices for staple goods and competition in her market area.

loans.use: increasing stock in her small grocery shop

loans.name: Asomidin

texts.ru: Хусаинов Асомидин проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Асомидин имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где сажает пшеницу и арбуз. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Asomidin H. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Asomidin has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He leases a plot of land, where he grows wheat and watermelons. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
The group consists of 14 members located in Prey Toteung village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mach N. is 39 years old and she is the village bank president who has selected by the members.  The members will use the loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Mach N. and her husband, Mr. Run Khon, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field where they cultivate rice for a living. They face a problem because they do not have enough money to support the farm crops. Thus, Mrs. Mach N. is asking  for a loan to purchase a motor for a water pump. This couple has four children; two are seamstresses in a garment factory while two others are students in the local school and also work on their parents' farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for a water pump

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying local brew for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria P., 52, is making sure that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs. Married to Mariano P., they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while doing direct selling of popular brands of clothing and cosmetics.

Victoria has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 25,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying advance orders of clothing and cosmetics in her direct selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a comfortable and well off future for her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders of clothing and cosmetics for her direct selling line

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly C. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Merly owns and operates a specialized retail store.  Her main source of income comes from selling  school bags and pack bags in the local community.  She also sells t-shirts and polo shirts.  Merly has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merly joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  

Merly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to expand her business.  This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to educate her children. 

---------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: In the photo are Mrs. VA. A. and her husband. This couple earns a living by cultivating a potato crop. They harvest and sell the crops to a private company when they come to maturity. They have six children who are now married and have already started new homes. VA. A. says that this is the annual business she has always done with great success. The coming rainfall season allows for farming but VA. A. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, VA. A. is applying for a loA. to buy fertilizer and crop seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married to an engineer.  They have four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her old father.

She sells local gin at her home in Kisaasi and sells to all categories of peoples but on a retail basis. Besides this bar business, she owns a salon in Kisaasi and wants to use this loan to buy more jerry cans of local gin. She has been in this business for two years. Her customers are the neighboring community.  Her business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to buy a plot of land.

Gladys resides in and owns a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  She joined MCDT because they loan to women who are in groups with no securities. Her monthly expenses includes food, utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. 

Le groupe est composé de six femmes qui sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 02 enfants. Elles sont solidairement unies et sont issues du même quartier. 

Madame Coumba M., troisième à partir sur la gauche de la photo, et en médaillon, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché central de Louga. le soir, à son retour du marché, elle vend des beignets dans le quartier. 

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de légumes afin de mieux développer son activité. Elle voudrait également maintenir sa vente de beignets.

Son objectif est de contribuer financièrement à la prise ne charge de la famille. Par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU was established on December 14, 2008.  It is part of the Banc Villageois of Nguidile and is composed of six women who are all married and mothers of at least two children.  All from the same district, the women are united in solidarity.  Ms. Coumba M. is the group's leader (third from the left in the photo and appearing in the inserted portrait).  She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  Coumba sells vegetables at the Louga central market.  In the evenings, upon returning from the market, she sells beignets.  Her loan will enable her to buy more vegetables in order to develop her business further.  She would also like to keep up her sales of beignets.  Her goal is to provide financial help for covering family expenses, for example, in terms of food and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 27 years old, married and has a three year old child.  He has been offering motorbike transport for two years.  He is able to raise the family with the income from his business.

He is a member of a group in Faulu Kenya.  In the group, he saves his money on a weekly basis.  The members also share business ideas.

Michael has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 KES.  This will be his first loan from Faulu Kenya and he will use the money to purchase a motorbike.  In the future, he hopes to buy a car for a taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. San Juan, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and E-load/gasoline retailer businesses. Her husband Eddie C., who is 35 years old, works as a pastor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 2 children who are 6 and 8 years old. 

Rema joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rema has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use to purchase a pig, so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children, and as additional capital for her existing businesses. Rema C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase a pig to raise and more inventory for her store

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong T. P. is 43 years old with two working-aged children. She is an experienced farmer, growing rice and raising chickens for eggs. Currently, she is taking care of a rice paddy of 1,400 square meters. She started her business many years ago and has a stable income from it. She joined the credit program with the hope to expand her business effectively. Now, she wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) to buy more chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Delmida

texts.en: Delmida O. is from the city of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 52 years old. Delmida is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Delmida operates a pedicab transport service. Delmida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Delmida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delmida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Delmida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli L. is from the town of Banga. He is 43 years old, married and has 2 children aged 8 and 6. Noli owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Noli also helps his wife sell dried fish in their town. His wife wanted to have an extra source of income for the family, so they invested in selling dried fish.

Noli joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noli has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and dried fish. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and dried fish

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh T. N. is 40 years old with two children who are in high school. She is a farmer and has grown rice, corn and vegetables for many years. In addition, she raises five pigs for meat. She can have very considerable income from her farm. Since joining SEDA's program in 2004, she has been in a good repayment situation. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 dong (VND) to improve her pigpen.

loans.use: To improve a pigpen

loans.name: Yousouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youssouf Koné  est un homme marié de 35 ans et père de 5 enfants, qui vit dans une famille polygame dans le village de Soromana,  sous-préfecture de Fakola dans la préfecture de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la République Mali.
Youssouf n’ayant pas fréquenté l’école s’est très vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus. Il finit par opter pour l’achat vente de bétails, car les autres activités  ne lui ont pas réussies.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide d’adhérer au programme  crédit de l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt. 
Monsieur Koné a six ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Il est très sollicité et apprécié à Fakola,  Kolondièba et en Côte d’Ivoire.
Il achète les bœufs dans la commune de Fakola et environnants et effectue sa vente en  république de Côte Ivoire, à  Nièna et Koumantou au Mali dans les marchés à bétails. La vente se fait au comptant souvent à crédit, à une clientèle constituée de bouchers, d’éleveurs et bien d’autres catégories sociales.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 200.000FCFA par mois. Le bénéfice  sera investi dans les frais scolaire, santé, condiments  et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssouf Kiné is a 35-year-old married man, father of five children, who lives in a polygamous family in the village of Soromana, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, part of the Kolondieba prefecture in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.

As Youssouf did not attend school he took an early interest in revenue-generating activities. He finally opted to buy and sell cattle, as his other activities were not successful.

While searching for additional financial resources, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI’s credit loan program, where he is beginning his first loan cycle.

Mr. Koné has six years’ experience in this line of business. He is well appreciated and sought after in Fakola, Kolondieba, and in Ivory Coast. He buys cattle in Fakola and the surrounding area and sells them in Ivory Coast, and at cattle markets in Niema and Koumantou in Mali.

Sales are made in cash and often on credit, to a customer base of butchers, ranchers and from many other social categories. He hopes to attain monthly earnings of 200,000 FCFA. The profits will be invested in schooling fees, healthcare, food condiments and food.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Digna Viviana

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Viviana tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 11 – 5  y 2 años de edad, los mayores están en la escuela. Su marido es profesor de un colegio de la ciudad.

Tiene un negocio de imprenta y papelería, también realiza trabajos en computadoras, en su negocio vende desde útiles escolares, libros y otros materiales que los estudiantes utilizan para su aprendizaje, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 6h30 hasta las 21h00, le ayudan su mamá y su hermano. Además de esto ella y su esposo realizan trabajos de mantenimiento de computadoras en la localidad. 

Este crédito es para comprar mas productos de imprenta y papelería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y está muy contenta en el Banco Comunal ya que gracias a los créditos ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio. Su sueño es prosperar en su negocio por el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte canton, the 'Mujeres Organizadas' (Organized Women) community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for the delicious sweets and desserts which its residents make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Viviana is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have three children aged 11, 5 and 2.  The older children are in school.  Her husband is a school teacher in the town.

Viviana has a printing and stationery business.  She also does work on computers.  In her business she sells school supplies, books and other things that students use in their studies.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 6.30am to 9.00pm.  Her mom and her brother help her out.  As well as this, she and her husband service computers locally.

This loan will be used to buy more printing and stationery products.  Viviana has been in her community bank from the very beginning and she is very happy because, thanks to the loans they provide, she has managed to get ahead in her business.  Her dream is to prosper in her business for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy printing and stationery items such as sheets of paper, school supplies, books, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
In 11 years of membership in ASHI, Teresa D. has developed comradeship with other members of ASHI in their barangays (small districts). The institution helps her to improve not only her living conditions but also the social aspects of her life. This is very useful to her and to her project which is a funeral home.

Even at 59, her industry never fades. When her husband died, she became the one who managed the business and most of her time is spent on her business and on her children. Moreover, she has done her best to improve her business in order to sustain their basic needs.

Through her hardship, courage and industry, her three children have already finished their studies and currently they have stable jobs. 

Though her children have their own jobs, she never stops dreaming about their future. She wants her business to improve so she can help other people in the community by providing employment to them. She has also planned to help their relatives so that they will become successful someday.

For her next loan, she is applying for PHP 35,000 which will be utilized as additional capital for her business (funeral home). She wants more capital because there are times when she has customers who can’t afford to buy a coffin in cash. As she is very considerate, she lets her customers pay for the items in installments and that is why she really needs rolling capital.

She is now more dignified because there are institutions like ASHI and its field partner KIVA which believe and trust in her.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her funeral services business

loans.name: 02- Quảng Xá 2- Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
"Phương N. Thị (6) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Phương is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02- Quảng xá 2-Đông Vệ (08.06.02-Đông Vệ).


Phương is widowed and has one adult-aged child. To making a living, Phương owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. Phương has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phương is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a loan of 4.248.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. Thị Dung (07) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


2.  Lê Thị Loan (08) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Vũ Thị Dầu (09) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


4.  N. Thị Tài (10) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Lê Thị Kim (11) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Bersabe

texts.es:
Doña María D. 63 años D. edad, vive con su esposo Daniel, tiene casa propia ubicada en San Miguel, departamento D. San Miguel, se dedica a vender especias (condimentos), como achiote, pimienta, cominos en el mercado municipal D. San Francisco Gotera en Morazán.
Ella quiere diversificar su negocio y solicita un préstamo para que le ayuD. a comprar verduras y frutas aprovechado que para estas fiestas estos productos tienen mayor demanda,
Su objetivo es innovar en el mercado, atraer a nuevos clientes para el consumo D. lo que se ofrece mejorando así el negocio, creciendo como comerciante y desarrollándose en una nueva actividad que espera le traiga buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 63, lives with her husband, Daniel.  She owns her house located in San Miguel, San Miguel department.  She sells spices (condiments) like achiote, pepper and cumin in San Francisco Gotera’s Municipal Market in Morazán.

She wants to diversify her business and is asking for a loan that will help her buy vegetables and fruit taking advantage of these festive times when these products are in higher demand.

Her objective is to innovate in the market, to attract new customers to buy what she offers thus improving the business and growing as a merchant and developing in a new activity which she hopes will bring good profits.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence owns a vegetable stall at the market. She is 30 years old and married to a taxi driver motorcyclist. She has three children who are between four and eight years old. 

With the requested loan , she would like to buy more vegetables such as tomatoes, eggplant and green beans to sell. With the profits from this business, she will buy a motorcycle for transportation. She hopes to increase the vegetable sales in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, es una mujer luchadora de, 48 años, que vive junto a su esposo Antonio, ambos han logrado darles una buena educación a sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Su esfuerzo y dedicación, hicieron que su familia sea su mayor orgullo; la agricultura, su principal actividad económica desde hace 20 años, hizo posible que pagará los estudios superiores de sus hijos, quienes ya independiente la visitan constantemente. Sus principales cultivos, son: gladiolo, arveja y papa, los que constantemente los cuida y fertiliza; pues sabe que de eso depende que los productos sean vendidos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma y el de la capital; por el cual asegura buenas ganancias. Ahora ha sembrado semillas de gladiolo de las cuales espera que pronto brote estas flores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde es responsable y honesta con el desarrollo de su banco. Yolanda, tiene sembrado arveja y flor de gladiolo, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, para que su próxima cosecha sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard-working, 48 year-old woman who lives with her husband Antonio.  Together they have managed to provide their three children with a good education.  Only one of their children still lives with them in their own home which is located in the village of Patay.  Through their hard work and commitment, their family has become their biggest source of pride.  The couple's main business activity for the past 20 years has been farming, through which they have been able to pay for their children's higher education.  Their children are now independent and they visit their mother constantly.

Yolanda's main crops are gladioli, peas and potatoes and she is constantly tending to them and fertilizing them as she knows that her crops depend on this level of care if they are to sell in the wholesale markets in Tarma and the capital.  This is a way of ensuring good profits.  Yolanda has recently sown gladioli seeds and she hopes that the flowers will come up soon.

Yolanda belongs to the "Picaflores de Patay" (Patay Hummingbirds) community bank and this is her fifth loan from MFP.  She is a responsible and upright member of her community bank.  Yolanda has sown peas and gladioli and she plans to use her loan money to buy several sacks of organic manure so that she has a really successful harvest.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Khut's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three borrowers, all of whom live in the province of Kompong Tom. The group's leader, Khut M., age 45, is married and has five children, one of whom is employed as a garment factory worker. Khut M. makes a living by selling baskets. She and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell at their home. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 1980. Khut M. will be using her loan to buy more raw materials in order to make baskets to offer for sale.

The other two borrowers include Mr. S., who will be using his loan to buy baskets to offer for sale, and Mrs. N., who will use her loan to purchase wood materials in order to to mend her old house.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials in order to make baskets to offer for sale

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew K. leases Solio solar chargers to ten clients in his rural community. On the first night after receiving his loan, one of our trainers received a phone call at three in the morning. It was Andrew who was very excited that his Solio was still powering light eight hours after he had started using it. Since receiving his loan Andrew has been given a new name in his community. He is now called ‘Bwana Stima”  (Mr. Electricity).

His three children now use the light that Solio provides to study at night instead of their old kerosene lamp. He has also been able to increase profits in his other business, where he buys and sells charcoal. He has achieved this by investing profits and energy savings from Solio into the charcoal business.  He now intends to open a charcoal store in his town. When asked about Solio, his response is ‘Long live Kadet for introducing us to pocket ‘Stima’.

loans.use: A solar powered kit

loans.name: Desederia

texts.en:
Desederia is a 49-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in the island of Cebu. Desederia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Desederia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her fourth loan, Desederia is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Desederia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario vive en el barrio San Antonio desde hace 16 años, tiene cuatro hijos, su esposa se dedica también a la repostería, tiene un puesto fijo en la zona del Plan 3000. El sr. Mario Se dedica a la repostería y panadería desde hace 15 años al lado de su esposa y sus hijos. El crédito que están solicitando es para comprar insumos, azúcar, harina, manteca,  para la repostería y reparación de un horno ya que el cuenta con tres hornos de panadería luego comercializar  sus productos en carretillas. El Sr. Mario  es una persona trabajadora al igual que su esposa juntos están haciendo todos los esfuerzos para salir adelante y ofrecerles un futuro para sus hijos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario has lived in the San Antonio neighborhood for 16 years.  He has four children.  His wife is also in pastry making and has a fixed stand in the Plan 3000 zone.  

Mario has been a baker and pastry maker alongside his wife and children for the last 15 years.  He will use the requested loan to buy ingredients: sugar, flour and lard for the pastries and to repair an oven.  He has three bakery ovens and he sells his products in carts.

Mario is a hard working person just like his wife.  Together they make every effort to get ahead and offer their children a better future.  He is grateful to the institution for the support it’s given him.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients.

loans.name: Benson Salaton

texts.en:
Benson, 27 years old, has practised wheat farming in Naivasha town for the last seven years.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid  his previous loan of Kshs 30,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Benson hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Recho is a resident and farmer in Litein Town, South Rift, Kenya. She has been specializing in dairy farming. She is helped on her farm by two farmhands. She sells her produce to the local market. Recho solely relies on farming for her family upkeep.

Recho has made her first loan request with Juhudi to help her diversify her farming business by venturing into the poultry business. She says she wants her farm to hold up to 1,000 birds and is optimistic her income will improve enough to educate her children.

Recho notes that there is a generally poor market for their products, especially the agricultural ones.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
Julia de 38 años, es soltera, tiene casa propia  que cuenta con agua y luz, ubicada en el pueblo jovén (lugar con viviendas y se encuentra en plena expansión) San Martín, el cual pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica ha la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Julia desde hace  unos 3 años a colocado en su domicilio una tienda con productos de primera necesidad (aceite,leche, arroz, azúcar, etc.), la cual cuenta en su zona con su propia clientela y  también otra forma detener más ingresos económicos es porque brinda el servicio de costura a sus vecinos, todas sus actividades lo realiza con la intensión de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Por eso a pedido un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más insumos para su tienda y más tela para coser todos los pedidos que le hacen, ya que por su buen gusto y calidad de costura se a incrementado su clientela y de paso le ayuda también a vender más en su tienda de abarrotes que tiene.  Permitiéndole a Julia pueda pagar su crédito, solventar sus gastos diarios y en un futuro poder adquirir con trabajado y empeño tener una tienda de abarrotes grande y bien surtida como un taller de alta costura.
texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old and single.  She has her own house, which has water and electricity.  It is located in Pueblo Jovén (a place with homes that are expanding), San Martín in the Lambayeque department.  This area is dedicated to farming, cattle and tourism.

Three years ago Julia established a store with basic needs items (oil, milk, rice, sugar, etc.) in her home.  She has her own customers in her zone.  She also has another way of getting more income because she provides sewing services to her neighbors.  She does all of her business activities with the intention of getting ahead and improving her quality of life.

That is the reason she has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more supplies for her store and more fabric for sewing all of the orders that she has.  Due to her good taste and the quality of her sewing she has been getting more customers.  This also helps her to sell more in her grocery store.

This allows Julia to be able to pay her loan and pay for her daily expenses.  In the future she will be able to have, with work and effort, a large grocery store that is well stocked and a high style seamstress shop.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store and fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 34 years old and from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province.  She is married with four school-aged children. Lorena owns and operates an agricultural business venture raising livestock.  The main source of income comes from buying and raising pigs for sale.  She also buys and sells fish in the public market. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lorena joined Kiva partner Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  She has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 17000 PHP, which was used to to purchase young livestock to raise and sell.  Lorena requests a new 20000 PHP loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her sixth loan from HSPFI.  Lorena plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI):

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old and is married with four adult children. She runs a restaurant where she sells prepared food such as meatballs, soup, and other dishes to the community. Myrna has been in this business for 20 years.

Myrna is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy meat and vegetables to prepare dishes to sell in her restaurant. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand and continue to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables to prepare food

loans.name: Mar De Cristal Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Mar de Cristal", está ubicado en el estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por su zona arqueológica y su bonita laguna a un costado del pueblo, el grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. María es la presidenta del grupo, ella cuenta con un molino negocio que inicio hace 2 años, en el cual muele el maiz para las tortillas, el cacao, chiles de diferentes especies, semillas de calabaza, ingredientes que se utilizan en la elaboracion del mole. Ella tiene 50 años de edad, estudio hasta el 6o año de  de primaria, es casada, tiene en total 2 hijos una mujer y un varon, sus clientes la prefieren porque las trata bien ademas de que les cobra lo justo por cada vez que muelen sus productos con ella. Al momento de solicitar su préstamo se siente agusto por que va a tener  mayores ingresos. La señora María quiere este préstamo para comprar una refaccion para su molino y darle mantenimiento ya que este servicio es caro y quiere cuidar la calidad y el buen funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, con las ganancias espera pagar la inscripcion de su hijo que ingresara a la secundaria y ahorrar para la educación y alimentación de sus hijos..
texts.en: This group is called "Mar de Cristal" (Crystal Sea).  It is located in the state of Morelos in Mexico.  This community is known for its archaeological zone and its pretty lagoon to one side of the town.  The group is comprised of 10 members.  María is the president of the group.  She relies on a mill business that she started 2 years ago, which grinds the maiz for tortillas, cocoa, Chiles of different types, pumpkin seeds, and ingredients that are utilized in making mole (a classic Mexican dish).  She is 50 years of age.  She attended school up to 6th grade.  She is married with 2 children; a young woman and a young man.  Her clients like her because she treats them well and charges a fair price each time that they grind their products with her.  At the moment that she requested the loan she feels happier because she is going to have greater income.  Señora María wants this loan to repair her mill and maintain it, snce this service is expensive and she wants to take care of the quality and good operation of her tool of work.  With the profits expects to pay the tuition of her son who is entering secondary school and to save for the education and feeding of her children.

loans.use: to repair and maintain their mill.

loans.name: Candida Norberta

texts.en:
Candida is a 70-year-old married mother of six children who has sold clothes door-to-door for the past 17 years. She makes frequent trips to Managua to re-stock her inventory and meet client demands.  

Candida is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety and higher quality shirts, pants, skirts, suits, towels, and linens. She would like to continue to work hard for the next several years to support her family as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, suits, towels, and linens

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children: one boy and two girls. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

Mariam has operated a food stall, selling from a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators in her locality. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of rice, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of rice, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Irene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Iroda

texts.ru:
Ирода добросовестная и честная женщина. Она разведена и любящая мать 4 детей.   В 2005 году она начала купля продажей мелочевки и постепенно она начала продавать одежду.  Сегодняшний день она имеет свою лавку, и её бизнес идет успешно. Ирода мечтает о том, что когда-то она расширит свой бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль, что позволят ей, чтобы её дети учились в престижную школу и университетах. Она очень хочет, чтобы её дети выросли образованными и добросовестными. Ирода хотела бы получит займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки школьных униформ. Она надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать её. Спасибо! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Iroda is an honest and conscientious woman. She is divorced and a loving mother of 4 children. In 2005 she has started a trinket store and slowly expanded into sale of clothing. Currently she has her own store at the local market and her business is flourishing. Iroda dreams about expanding her business in order to maximize the income it can bring. This will allow her to send her children to an elite school and to university. She really wants to raise her kids into well educated and conscientious adults. Iroda would like to borrow 1000 USA dollars to purchase school uniforms for sale in her store for the starting school season. She hopes that KIVA lenders will be able to support her loan and she thanks all of them in advance.

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Juan tiene 59 años de edad,  el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio es comerciante minorista, el socio lleva productos secos a la ciudad de Arequipa, el socio también apoya a su conyugue con el restaurante familiar que ellos tienen y apoya atendiendo alas mezas y en lo que pueda dar la mano. El socio en esta ocasión requiere le préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos al por mayor. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos para llevar a vender a la ciudad de Arequipa, tales como maíz de diferentes variedades, habas, menestras,  cereales y otros.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Unidos” (Always United) which is located in the Virgen Asunta Market in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 59 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Juan carries dry goods to the city of Arequipa. He also helps his partner in the family restaurant that they own, waiting on tables and giving a hand when it is needed. On this occasion, he needs a loan to invest in the purchase of dry goods in bulk. The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of these dried products so that he can sell them in the city of Arequipa. These products include corn of different varieties, beans, dried vegetables, grain, and other items.

Juan is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods such as corn of different varieties, beans, dried vegetables, grain, and other items.

loans.name: Fabiola Maria

texts.es:
Fabiola tiene 55 años vive con su esposo en Ibarra, tiene 4 hijos los cuales tienen 38, 36, 29 y 28 años de edad. fabiola se describe como una persona amable con todas las personas y risueña deacuerdo a la persona con quien esté.

Empezó a trabajar con su esposo hace 30 años en la elaboración de pan de dulce y sal. Trabaja con FODEMI desde el año 2009 y el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de 15 quintales de harina y dos bloques de manteca lo cual le ayudaría a producir más pan y mejorar sus ventas.

Su sueño es mejorar la tecnología de sus hornos y todas sus herramientas de la panadería y también ayudar a sus hijos para que sean emprendedores y puedan tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 55 years old and lives with her husband in Ibarra.  She has four children who are 38, 36, 29 and 28 years old.  Fabiola describes herself as somebody who is kind to everybody and smiles at whoever she is with.

Fabiola started working with her husband 30 years ago making sweet and savory bread.  She has been working with FODEMI since 2009 and the loan that she is currently requesting is for buying fifteen 100lb bags of flour and two blocks of butter which will help her to produce more bread and improve her sales.

Fabiola's dream is to improve the technology of her ovens and all the equipment in her bakery.  She also wants to help her children become entrepreneurs and own their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy fifteen 100lb bags of flour and two blocks of butter

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and bills.

For the past five years, he has operated a business selling spare parts to his neighbours and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of competition from other spare part vendors in the area. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With his KES 80,000 loan Omar wants to purchase more spare parts to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
This is Randy, 24, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. He is married to Allen, a housewife and mother of their child. Randy, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Randy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Randy earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Randy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he hopes to support his child's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.es:
María, actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar productos no perecederos como: enlatados, pastas, arroz, frijoles, aceite, detergentes y jabón, esta compra le ayudara a surtir el inventario. Este es un tercer prestamo para ella, los cuales le han servido para crecer en el negocio, el inventario que ahora maneja es mucho más grande al que inicio.
Su familia se mantiene, no ha aumentado, pero su condicion ha mejorado, ya que con este apoyo ha superado la situacion para ellos.
texts.en:
María is currently seeking a loan to invest in buying non-perishable merchandise such as canned goods, pasta, rice, beans, oil, soap and detergents. Purchasing these will help increase her inventory. This is María's third loan. The loans have helped her to expand her business, and the inventory which she now manages is much larger than what she first started with.

María's family has not grown, but their quality of life has improved. With the support she has received, María has been able overcome their previous situation.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as canned products, pasta, rice, beans, oil, detergents and soap

loans.name: Abibu

texts.en: Abibu, 26 years old, lives in a rented house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in salt for five years. In his area, the salt trade is a common business located around the lake and the locals find it lucrative. Abibu's hardship is rain; when it rains, the miners have limited access to the lake for salt mining. Abibu dreams of constructing a house for his family. He is requesting this loan to buy salt for resale.

loans.use: To buy salt to resell

loans.name: Sisimukha Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisimukha SHG Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ameleta

texts.en:
Ameleta is 40-years-old and married with 6 children.

Ameleta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a electronic inventory business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Ameleta has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the electronic selling business for 7 years and also earns an income from photocopying.

Ameleta aspires to save enough money so she could afford to continue her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Kivikiyi Group

texts.en:
Evans takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and have additional maize profits to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Evans had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Thomas was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Evans will educate his children and save for medication for his child in the future.

Evans is the facilitator of the Kivikiyi group.The photograph shows Evans with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer. Evans and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Kivikiyi group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evans and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Brenda Magaly

texts.es:
Brenda, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, orgullosa y contenta nos cuenta que con el primer credito otorgado atravez de Kiva, ella logro surtir mas su tienda logro mejores ingresos para su negocio.A pesar de la dificultad que tiene por la inseguridad en su vivienda ya que la estructura es humilde ha salido adelante y podido superarse poco a poco pero ve la necesidad de invertir mas en su pulperia. 

Es por tal motivo que solicita un segundo credito para comprar granos basicos, pan , galletas, jugos y gaseosas ya que al vender mas productos y ofreciendo variedad lo ingresos mejorar y su negocio prospero. Pues su meta es ampliar su pulperia y mejorar su humilde vivienda casa.
texts.en:
Brenda is a proud and happy resident of the city of Granada. She tells us that with her first loan through Kiva she managed to better stock her store and achieve better revenues for her business. Despite the difficulty she has with the precariousness of her home, as it is a humble structure, she has gotten ahead and been able to advance little by little. However, she sees a need to invest more in her corner store. 

It's for that reason that she's requesting a second loan to buy basic grains, crackers, juices, and sodas, as selling a more products of greater variety 
increases her revenue and makes her business prosper. So then, her goal is to grow her corner store and improve her humble home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cookies, juices and sodas.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Efraín de 49 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle un mejor provenir. Blanca y su esposo son el sostén de sus hijos. Blanca desde muy niña trabajó en las tierras de sus padres y hoy es toda una conocedora del labor que se realiza en el campo, es campesina y cuenta con un terreno donde tiene cultivado plantas de cacao, y otras plantas nativas de la zona selvática. Viene trabajando 25 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y del apoyo de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de Santa Rosa; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es hacer el mantenimiento de cacao como: desyerbar, fertilizar sus cultivos; para que siga obteniendo mejores cosechas. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP y está contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo financiero. En su banco comunal se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.  Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar abono para hacer el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y con el resto contratará peones para desyerbar los desmontes.
texts.en:
Blanca is from the town of Santa Rosa.  She is 46 years old and a hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 49-year-old Efraín, and their three beloved children who she would like to provide with a better future.  Blanca and her husband provide for their children.

Since she was very young, Blanca worked on her parents' land.  Now she is really knowledgeable about agricultural work.  She is a farmer and has a plot of land where she grows cacao plants and other native rain-forest plants.  She has been working for 25 years and, at harvest time, she has the support of her children and laborers who help her to pick her fruit more quickly.  What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting her fruit as this is when she feels that the months of hard work are providing their reward, in the quality of her fruit.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products from the farm to the warehouse centers which are located in the town of Santa Rosa.  This is where they offer her the best price for her produce.  Right now, Blanca's main priority is caring for her cacao by weeding and fertilizing her crops so that she can enjoy better harvests.

This will be Blanca's eighth loan from MFP and she is happy to know that she will, once again, have financial support.  She pledges to continue making her repayments punctually through her community bank.  Blanca will use her 1,000 soles to buy manure with which to maintain her crops.  She will use the rest to hire laborers to weed her clearings.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire laborers

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has two children aged six and twelve.  She is an optimistic woman.  She has been selling cereals such as maize, beans, black beans etc. for the last six years.  Her business is in a busy market.  Her business challenge is the high cost of cereals. 

She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cereals to add to her stock.  Regina hopes and plan to have diversified her business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 25 years. She operates a store where she sells mangoes, kale, cabbages and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the loan to purchase more potatoes and cabbages. Carol's business goal is to venture into running a retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages and potatoes.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 24-year-old woman from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have no or little access to credit. Angelina is married with two kids. Her husband is in a Roma traveling band and is rarely at home.

Angelina is currently opening a small café in the Roma quarter, where she will predominately be selling pre-packaged foods and pork sandwiches. She has a great attitude and is excited about the financial lift this will bring to her family. In Bulgaria, parents are expected to purchase their children’s textbooks, which for many is not economically possible. Next year, however, her hope is that this will change for her children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en: Aladdin is an IDP from occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993 and opened his business in 2001. He is married and has a child. His first loan he planned to take from Normicro Baku branch, he wants to use to buy new equipment for the business.

loans.use: To buy some new equipment to serve clients with better quality

loans.name: Roger M.

texts.en:
Roger A. lives on Obispo del Llano Street in Alto Chuijini on the west side of La Paz. He is 34 years old and is self-employed in setting up computers and installing software on them for sale to customers in their homes. He now lives in a room in his parents' house and he is asking for this loan to build two more rooms to live in, improving his family's quality of life. His job and our study show he will be able to repay this loan with no problems.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Roger A. vive en la calle Obispo del Llano de la zona Alto Chuijini ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 34 años y trabaja independientemente, armando computadoras e instalando programas en las mismas, que luego vende a clientes a domicilio. Actualmente vive en una habitación en la casa de sus padres y el crédito que solicita está destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra fina, las que ocupará a su culminación y le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Su trabajo y el estudio económico realizado al señor Roger A., demuestran que puede cubrir el préstamo sin problema alguno.

loans.use: To build two rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wants to purchase a car for her husband, who is a taxi driver.

loans.name: Immaculée

texts.fr:
Mrs. Immaculée D. is 24 years old, married and the mother of one child. She runs a business selling charcoal in order to contribute to the household expenses. It is a flourishing business but one that needs much financial input. Very energetic and ambitious, she wants to increase her revenue and have more income. To do this she is asking for a loan of $800, which will enable her to go herself to the production sites and buy supplies at lower cost. Achieving this project will contribute greatly to improving her family’s living conditions.

Madame D. Immaculée est âgée de 24 ans ; mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de charbon de bois afin de contribuer aux charges du foyer. C’est un commerce florissant mais qui nécessite plus de moyens financiers. Très active et ambitieuse, elle voulait augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et accroître ses revenus. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui lui permettra d’aller elle-même sur les lieux de fabrication et s’approvisionner à moindre coût. La réalisation de ce projet contribuera beaucoup à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Eucharia

texts.en: A. Eucharia is an experienced businesswoman. She has a shop were she sells provisions, drinks and foodstuff. This is a trade she learned from her mother. She has been in this business since 1994 and has been a LAPO member for 2 years. She wants to expand her business and order more provisions, drinks and foodstuff.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan for $400. She is 38 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Benin City.

loans.use: To buy more provision, drinks and foodstuff

loans.name: Tezgul

texts.en: Tezgul is a 46-year-old woman who owns livestock for breeding in the southern village of the Saatli region. She is married and has 5 children. She has more than 10 years experience in animal breeding. She loves her business, because she is certain that she can always sell her products. The reason for her confidence is because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Azerbaijani people eat meat almost every day. As she and her husband are unemployed, calf sales is the only financial source for her family. Tezgul works very hard to keep her family in good conditions, however, it is very hard when you have a big family and the prices for products increase almost every day. To improve her economic condition, she needs more funds to expand her business. So she decided to apply for a 1200 USD loan to purchase four calves for an estimated cost 300 USD each.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is a 28 year-old single father with a one-year-old daughter named Ximena. Ever since he received the news of her birth, Ximena has become the reason for David’s motivation and his gradual progress. He would like to become a professional in the future in order to give his young daughter a good example. Currently he works selling snacks at retail, an activity which allows him to live comfortably, with the hope of seeing his business grow in the future to become one of the largest and most important in his city. His goal is to join his business with one that sells clothes, transforming his store into a commercial center (mall) for snacks and clothes. For this reason he is seeking a loan that will allow him to accomplish his objectives. David waits patiently for your generous assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

David tiene 28 años de edad, él es padre soltero, tiene una hijita de nombre Ximena de un añito de edad y desde que tuvo la noticia de su llegada se ha convertido en la razón de su empeño y progreso paulatino; él desea convertirse más adelante en un profesional a fin de brindale el mejor ejemplo a su pequeña.Actualmente se dedica la venta de abarrotes al por menor, actividad que le permite vivir tranquilamente, a fin de ver en el futuro su negocio convertido en uno de los más grandes e importantes de su ciudad.Tiene un propósito que es unir su negocio (bodega) con el de la venta de prendas de vestir transformando su local en un centro comercial de abarrotes y ropas, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos. David espera desinteresadamente la ayuda de tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Implementation of his small grocery store

loans.name: Cerfila

texts.en:
Cerfila V. is a 67-year-old mother and wife who makes a living selling refreshments. Twenty years ago she had a convenience store that didn’t have much success, so decided to close it and go into this line of work.

Her work selling refreshments makes great deal of profit because demand for her goods is strong. Now that she has had success in this line of work, she would like to expand her product line to include a greater variety of drinks and possibly snacks as well. With this loan she will first invest in new kinds of drinks, and afterwards explore the possibility of adding small snacks.

loans.use: To buy general refreshments such as soda, juice, beer, wine and water.

loans.name: Evense Francisco

texts.es:
Evenses is 29 years old and lives with his wife and small child in the community of San Ignacio, a municipality of Ticuantepe. He is employed as a manager of a warehouse for an agricultural company, where he already has various years work experience. As a result of his work, he was able to save and purchase two plots of land, where he grows pineapple and “pitahaya” (dragon fruit), since in the community in which he lives, these are the products that are most produced due to the climate. For five years, he has been taking his products to Managua to sell, where they have been well received. Besides, he has a good number of regular customers who always buy from him. With all of this work, this father is in charge of all of the family expenses and his greatest wish is to provide his wife and child with a better quality of life, as well as a home which provides adequate conditions. It is this way that Evenses wishes to continue to produce his products which obtain good profits. Right now, Evenses is requesting a loan to purchase organic inputs which are needed for pineapple cultivation since this fruit has the most demand in the markets of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Evenses tiene 29 años de edad, habita con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en la comunidad de San Ignacio, municipio de Ticuantepe. El señor se desempeña de responsable de bodega de una empresa agrícola, en la cual ya lleva varios años de estar trabajando, fruto de su trabajo es como el señor llegó a ahorrar y comprar 2 manzanas de tierra, en las cuales tiene sembrado piña y pitahaya, ya que en la comunidad donde habita son los productos que mas se produce debido al ambiente climático, lleva 5 años de estar sacando sus productos a comercializar a Managua, los cuales han tenido mucha aceptación, cuenta además con un buen numero de clientes fijos que siempre le compran. Con toda esta actividad, este padre de familia se hace cargo de todos los gastos de su familia, ya su mayor deseo es brindarle a su esposa e hijo mejores condiciones de vida así como una vivienda que preste todas las condiciones adecuadas. Es así que el señor desea seguir produciendo sus productos con los cuales obtiene buenas utilidades. En estos momentos, el señor solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos orgánicos que esta necesitando para el cultivo de piña, ya que es el que mayormente se cotiza en los mercados de Managua, debido a que tiene una gran demanda.

loans.use: Purchase urea and chemical fertilizers for the cultivation of pineapple.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence E. sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She is married with 5 children and is 33 years old. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 45 year old entrepreneur. She lives with her husband and four children, who are all in school. Emily is the proprietor of a cereal business which she started in 2006 and her husband works with the Kenya Airport Authority. She purchases grains, especially dry maize and beans, in bulk during harvesting season when the prices are low and then sells them to her customers when prices improve. She also supplies her goods to schools and colleges.

Emily requires $600.00 to further help her expand her business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her business selling grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes and underwear for her business

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dédé D. was born on 16 April 1954 in Kéta in GHANA. Married to a hotelier, she has 2 children. She has a job which has impassioned her for 16 years. This consists of buying poultry and fruit in the villages near Lomé and re-selling them at the markets in Lomé.

She would like to increase her capital to make larger purchases (40 hens) in order to minimize her costs, which is why she is asking for this first loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

p>Le 16 avril 1954 madame D. Dédé naissait à Kéta au GHANA. Mariée à un hôtelier, elle a 02 enfants. Elle exerce un métier qui la passionne depuis 16ans. Cela consiste en l’achat des volailles et des fruits dans les villages environnants de la ville de Lomé qu’elle revend dans les marchés de Lomé.

Elle voudrait augmenter sont capital pour faire des achats plus importants (40 poules) afin de minimiser ses charges c’est pourquoi elle demande ce premier crédit.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Angeles Group

texts.en:
The members of the Angeles trust bank live in the lovely village of Santa Clara, about 1½ hour away from Sololá. The group was formed 7 years ago, and they requested 6 loans already.

The loans gave them the opportunity T. start a small business and be more independent and self sufficient.
