It is interesting T. see how they have found a way T. expand their businesses by travelling outside of their own village T. other markets T. sell their products. By travelling T. different markets in surrounding villages and towns they have expanded the number of clientele. They travel T. Sololá, Nahualá, San Pedro, San Pablo and some of the women travel even as far as Quetzaltenango which is three hours away.

Most of the women are working very hard and own two businesses. The group leader Simona S. says: many of us have a plot of land where they grow fruits and vegetables and raise some animals too. So do I. We sell our fruits in the markets ourselves. During the evenings we work on the beautiful regional embroideries. And some of us have a food store where they sell the bread they bake themselves. One of the women even has a little business making canastas: the baskets that all of the women use T. bring their products T. the market Working with the trust bank has given them the opportunity T. improve their living standards. This is because now they can have access T. clean water and electricity. The women share a lot of their ideas in how T. run their business at the weekly meetings. This way they help each other.

During their childhood many of these women could not attend school, and illness and hygiene were crucial problems. However, nowadays their kids have better opportunities and are doing well in school. If we support these women and their respective families together we are helping them, their communities and Guatemala T. develop.

loans.use: purchase food for animals, fertilisers. purchase utilities for embroidery

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Sakina J. is 34 and married. She has 3 boys and 1 girl, ages 19, 15, 8 and 3. She started her business two years ago Ð a shop where she sells clothes and toiletries. With these items, her monthly profit is about $171. Sometimes she is able to also stock drinks and phone vouchers which will increase her monthly profit to about $257. She works daily from 7am until 8pm.

Previously Sakina has borrowed and successfully paid pack two loans from Tujijenge, which were used to expand her business. This third loan she hopes to receive will also be used to increase the number and variety of supplies in her shop.

Sakina will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members sell clothes and charcoal. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing and toiletries.

loans.name: Mrs. Noy Leang Y Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank consists of 16 members and is located in the Traeuy Troeng Village of Kandal Province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Noy L. Y is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a cow breeder who raises two cows. Her husband, Mr. Toun Sophorn, is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. With the revenue, he can purchase veR. little because he owns a small piece of land. Mrs. Noy L. Y is 32 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Although Mrs. Noy L. Y's family members have different businesses, they still cannot afford to take care of their family veR. well. Therefore, Mrs. Noy L. Y has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: José Angel

texts.es: José Angel L. es casado, de 65 años de edad, con 15 años de trabajo en la alcaldia de juigalpa, se desempeña como operario de areas verdes,  su esposa trabaja en la Escuela Leyden de Juigalpa como conserje, está solicitando su primer crédito para pagar la mano de obra de la construccion de su casa; ya tiene listo el terreno. Este es un proyecto ejecutado por el Instituto de la Vivienda en conjunto con la Alcaldía. Tiene 2 hijos que ya están casados, y quienes le apoyan económicamente en el sustento de la familia.  Espera con este crédito poder alcanzar sus sueños, como es tener una vivienda digna para él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose Angel L. is 65 years old and he is married. He has been working for 15 years at the municipality of Juigalpa, fixing the parks, his wife works as super at School Leyden de Juigalpa. He is requesting this first loan to pay for the construction of his house; he already has the land. This is a project provided by the Housing Institute and City Hall. Jose Angel has two children who are already married and help him financially. He hopes with this loan to fulfill his dream and have a decent house for him and his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House building

loans.name: Nikupokigwa M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Nikupokigwa K. from Mbeya, widowed with two children between the ages of 7 and 10. Nikupokigwa has been running a local restaurant business known as “mama lishe” since 2005. This involves buying items such as rice, maize flour, salt, beans etc, and making food to sell to the people around the area. Working at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and assisted by her mother, Nikupokigwa currently earns about a $50 weekly profit.

She is requesting a loan of $425 in order to purchase more items in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Nikupokigwa thanks you for your support!

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase more items in bulk.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Greetings from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Mayasa S. M., who lives in Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children who are between the ages of 24 and 28. Mayasa has been running a restaurant since 2004. She works at this business for 14 hours a day, six days a week and has four employees. Mayasa currently earns about $100 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $425 to purchase food containers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mayasa thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, which is why they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To buy food containers.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene una sola hija de nombre Soledad que es la engreída del hogar. Los padres de Trinidad en su juventud sembraban numerosas hectáreas de papa, ella se levantaba a las 4:00am para ayudar a su madre a preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo, a eso de las 9:00am se tenía que alistar las viandas para luego cargar en los asnos y transportarlos hasta las chacras. Esa es la rutina que hasta ahora tiene Trinidad, ya que su esposo se dedica también al cultivo de la tierra, sembrando por cada temporada de 4 a 5 hectáreas de semilla de papa. Por cada saco llega a vender entre 70 a 80 soles, mientras que la papa de consumo varia su precio de acuerdo el mercado y eso no les conviene, ella y su esposo consideran que sembrar  semilla  de papa, es mas rentable y ya tienen clientes fijos de otras ciudades que les hacen pedidos cada mes. Es la tercera vez que viene trabajando un crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo siempre ha tratado de pagar en las fechas programadas. El dinero solicitado le servio para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus campos de papa.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 28 and lives with her husband and their daughter, Soledad, who is the household attention-seeker. When Trinidad was a child, her parents cultivated several hectares of potatoes. She would get up at 4:00AM and help her mother prepare breakfast and lunch until 9:00, when she would to pack the food onto the donkeys and bring it out to the fields. Trinidad still has the same routine today, as her husband also earns his living working the land. Every season he cultivates 4 or 5 hectares of potato seeds. Each sack of seeds sells for between 70 and 80 soles. The price of potatoes, on the other hand, varies with the market, which does not suit their needs. Growing the seeds is more profitable for Trinidad and her husband; they already have regular clients in other cities who order from them monthly. This will be Trinidad’s third loan with MFP, and she has always tried to make payments on time. She plans to use her loan to purchase a variety of fertilizers for her potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Giann Carlos

texts.es:
El microempresario Giann Carlos Siú tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica desde hace 2 años a atender una pulpería que es de su propiedad y  con la cual obtiene los ingresos para sustentar sus necesidades y a la vez ayudar económicamente a su mama quien ya es una adulta mayor.

El señor Siú ofrece una variedad de productos tales como granos básicos  (arroz, frijoles, azúcar etc) productos carnicos (carne de res, carne  de pollo)  jabón, aceite entre otros. Sin embargo al igual que otros microempresarios necesita financiamiento para poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos y tener un poco mas de utilidad que le permita mejorar su nivel de vida. Esta solicitando comprar  lo siguiente:


1 Docena de  vasos con café presto grande le cuesta US$ 3 dólares cada vaso con café, 2 cajas de leche la lechera a US$ 45 dólares cada caja, 3 cajas de sopa maruchan a US$ 10 dólares cada caja, 2 cajones de huevos de gallina a US$ 37 dólares cada cajón, 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 60 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar  a US$ 30 dólares cada quintal y 3 bolsones de papel higiénico a US$ 30 dólares cada bolsón.
texts.en:
Giann Carlos Siú, a small businessperson, is 24 and single. He has been the proprietor of a small store for 2 years, which gives him the income for his necessities as well as helping his mother out economically. Señor Siú offers a variety of products such as basic grains (rice, beans, sugar, etc.), meat products (beef, chicken), soap, and oil among other things. Just like other small businesspersons, he needs financing to buy larger quantities of products, useful for improving his quality of life. He is requesting a loan to purchase the following: 1 dz. large cups of instant coffee, US$3 per cup; 2 cases of Milkmaid milk, US$45 per case; 3 cases of Maruchan soup, US$10 per case; 2 crates of chicken eggs, US$37 per crate; 200 Kg. American rice, US$60 per 100 Kg.; 200 Kg. sugar, US$30 per 100 Kg.; and 3 bags of hygienic tissue, US$30 per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy instant coffee, milk, soup, eggs, rice, and toilet tissue

loans.name: Radjabmo

texts.en:
Radjabmo is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.  Two years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business. 

She is engaged in this business together with her husband.  Slowly, the number of cows has increased and, with that, her clients started asking for more and more.  With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and, for this reason, she is requesting a loan. 

Be an important part of the growth of Radjabmo’s business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Chérubins Plus Group

texts.en:
Modeste M. produces and sells soap made from palm oil. He makes about US$ 20 in profit per week. He started doing business by selling prepaid cell phone minutes in 2005 with a working capital of US$ 200. From 2005 to 2007, he diversified his business by adding women’s clothing. He started selling in Mbuji-Mayi which is in central DRCongo.

Modest's business prospered, increasing his working capital to US$ 1500. In 2007, thieves broke into his shop and took of all his goods and the working capital. He closed the business and moved to Kinshasa.

From 2008 to the present he has sold cell phone minutes and soap made from palm oil with a capital of US$ 150. His vision is to open a small factory to produce soap to meet people’s need in his area.

Modeste is 53 years old, married and has seven children between the ages of 12 and 30. Six of them are students and one is independent.

loans.use: To increase working capital to purchase tools and equipment to produce soaps

loans.name: Lamidi

texts.en: Lamidi is 40 years old and married with three children.  He sells motor tires and rims.  Lamidi is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor tires and rims to sell.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more motor tires and rims to sell.

loans.name: Cuestion De Fe Group

texts.es:
En la zona Los Andes,  de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Cuestión de Fe” formado por trece socias.
Un grupo muy simpático que  con la ayuda de  su asesora de créditos, trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer con mucho entusiasmo de mejorar en sus negocios.
La mayoría de ellas son casadas y niños de distintas edades nos cuentan  que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares crecen cada vez mas y los ingresos que tienen ya no son suficientes para cubrir necesidades mínimas 
Este grupo tiene diversas actividades; Flora por ejemplo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de yogurt, otras venden estuches para celulares, videos, material escolar, cosméticos. Desean mayor crédito para la adquisición de productos al por mayor,  para ampliar sus ventas, tienen la seguridad que mejoraran sus ganancias y su situación económica para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
In the Los Andes area in the city of El Alto, there exists a center by the same name. It is to this center that “Cuestión de Fe,” an association of thirteen members, belongs. With the help of their loan advisor, this kind group of women work enthusiastically with Pro-Mujer to improve their businesses. The majority of the women are married with children of various ages. The daily household costs increase everyday and the incomes that they earn are insufficient to cover their basic needs.

The group produces a variety of products. Flora, for example, makes and sells yogurt. Others sell cellphone cases, videos, school supplies and makeup. They are hoping for more credit so that they can purchase wholesale products and increase their sales. The members of the group are confident that they can improve their incomes and their economic situation for the benefit of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale products

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila M. is 33 years old and married to Larry M.. They have been blessed with two children: Lharson, 11 years old & presently in grade school and Maricris, 5 years old, who is currently in kindergarten. The family is happily living in the village of Centro 3 in Angadanan, Isabela. The couple are very supportive of each other and always give each other a helping hand, especially in times of life difficulties.

Leila has been managing a direct-selling business for almost six years. She has been a franchise dealer of Natasha, MSE and AVON cosmetic products. She has been able to build her clientele because, she believes, she is approachable to everyone. At times, she has not been able to pre-order some of her customers’ order requests due to a lack of funds. For this reason, she would like to take a loan in the amount of PHP7,000. She will use the loan to purchase more products to sell to her customers. Her monthly net income from the business is around PHP5,000, which is used for the children’s education. She hopes that her business will prosper in order to give her family a better life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetic products for her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua Y. is divorced and has 5 dependents. Ekua received no formal education. Since 1995 Ekua has smoked and sold fish in small quantities in Terterim. Ekua uses her small income to support the children in paying their school fees. To buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Мирфузайлов  Жахонгир – молодой  мужчина  1981  года  рождения,  женат,  детей  пок  не  имеет.  Недавно  его  родители  решили  отделить  его  домохозяйство  и  предложили  ему  заняться  мелким  бизнесом.  С  этой  целью  он  арендовал  магазинчик,  где  торгует  запасными  частями  для  автомашин.  Свой  товар  он  привозит  из  города  Истаравшана,  где  расположен  оптовый  рынок.  Для  расширения  своего  товарооборота  он  решил  обратиться  в  нашу  организацию.  На  полученный  займ  он  закупил  товар  по  оптовой  цене  и  раздал  его  мелким  торговцам.
texts.en:
Born in 1981, Jahongir M. is married and does not yet have children. Recently, his parents decided to separate his household and suggested that he should start a small business. With this goal in mind, Jahongir leased a small store, where he sells spare parts for automobiles. He brings his merchandise from the city of Istaravshan, the location of the wholesale market. He reached out to our organization in order to increase his goods turnover. Jahongir plans to use the loan to buy auto parts at wholesale cost and resell them retail.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда Кодирова 1981 года рождения. Она замужем имеет2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Закончив школу  родители не смогл устроить в университет. Через год вышла замуж и сидела дома. Муж работал в то время водителем, потом он поменял работу, сейчас он мастерит помещения и проводит ремонт. Она решила заняться бизнесом мелочей.  Она хотела расширить немного свой бизнес и заняла у матери. Так начала со временем торговать обувью. Зимой покупала не большую партию  теплых тапочек и весной и летом  шлепки и сланцы.  Узнав у соседей о кредите она решила расширить свой товарооборот.  Посоветовавшись с мужем ей понравились  условия после получения кредита от КИВА купила летнюю обувь.
texts.en:
Umeda K. was born in 1981. She is married and has 2 children. She has a secondary education. When she finished school, her parents were unable to send her to a university. She got married a year later and stayed home. Umeda’s husband worked as a driver at that time and then switched jobs. Now he does home remodeling and repairs. Umeda decided to start selling small items. She wanted to expand her business a bit and borrowed from her mother. With time, she started selling shoes. She bought a small stock of warm slippers in the winter and a stock of flip flops and slippers in the spring and summer. Having found out about financing from her neighbors, Umeda decided to increase her goods turnover. She talked it over with her husband and liked the lending terms. After receiving the credit from Kiva, she bought summer shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer shoes

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat is business oriented and sells shoes. She has been in this business for the past 9 years. Kudirat is 49 years old and married with 4 children. Kudirat lives in Lagos and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Kudirat hopes to obtain a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is thirty-eight years old. She is a wife and the mother of a child. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, etc. She also sells frozen beef, chicken, fish and palm oil as a subsidiary.

She wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, etc. in bulk to expand her business. She believes in her capacity to finance her child’s education and to better provide her with life opportunities when she improves her income. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es:
ALCANCÍA COMUNAL “CRISTO REY D. NICOLÁS D. PIÉROLA”


Esta alcancía comunal participa en EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD hace un año y ocho meses, va en su sexto ciclo D. préstamo, lo denominaron así porque los doce integrantes depositan su fe católica en Cristo y la gran parte D. ellos viven en el asentamiento humano Nicolás D. Piérola - Chosica. El negocio D. ellos es la repostería, manualidades, tejidos, venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, productos D. belleza.
Todo el grupo se reúne mensualmente en la casa D. uno D. los integrantes para efectivizar sus pagos y es la presidenta quien se encarga D. supervisar que esto se cumpla, en este caso la señora Ana V. M. ocupa este cargo, desD. hace doce años se dedica a criar animales D. corral en su casa como son: cuyes, gallinas, pavos, patos; además elabora tortas, prepara comida y bufetes para distintos eventos, ella tiene pedidos con asiduidad. Con ello genera ingresos que contribuye en los gastos familiares, arreglar su vivienda, darles una vida sosegada a sus hijos, no depender solo del dinero D. su esposo.
Ana compró tintes vegetales para tortas, moldes D. repostería y menajes con el primer crédito que recibió, pues era lo que necesitaba para la elaboración D. una torta D. quinceaños. 
Con el préstamo reciente comprará una olla nueva, adornos acrílicos para tortas; así no tendrá la necesidad D. seguir alquilando estos implementos. Lo que ella necesita es comprar una refrigeradora ya que es una herramienta esencial en su negocio lo hará más adelante con las ganancias que obtenga D. sus ventas.
texts.en:
Communal Bank "Cristo Rey Nicolas D. Pierola"

This Communal Bank has been involved with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD for one year and eight months. The members are participating in their sixth loan cycle. Their group is so named because they are of the Catholic faith and live in the settlement of Nicolás D. Piérola - Chosica. Their businesses incluD. bakeries, handicrafts, textiles, food sales, clothing, and beauty products.

The entire group meets once a month at the home of one its members in order to collect their payments. The president is in charge of their meetings and makes sure that everything has been completed. Sra. Ana V. M. currently holds this position. She has been raising farm animals from her home for the past 12 years. She breeds guinea pigs, chickens, turkeys, and ducks. She also makes cakes, prepared meals, and buffets for various events. Sra. Ana receives orders regularly, so she is able to generate income to pay for her family expenses and make home repairs. She can proviD. a normal life for her children and not have to be solely dependent on her husband’s income.

Sra. Ana used her first loan to buy vegetable dyes for cakes, pastry molds and kitchenware. These supplies were needed to make quinceaños (15th birthday) cakes. She will use her current loan to buy a new pot and acrylic cake decorations so that she does not have to rent these items. What she needs to buy is a refrigerator because it is a necessity for her business that will help her generate more profits from her future sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es socia del Bancomunal un Nuevo Día, es conviviente, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos de 32, 30, 22, 19, 18, 16 y 12 años. Los tres mayores son independientes, dos hijos estudian y los dos menores están en la escuela. 
Desde hace 10 años Raquel tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos y también vende otros productos por pedidos. Ella empezó poco a poco con pedidos de sus amistades y durante los años su clientela ha crecido. Desde que comenzó en Finca su negocio y su vida han mejorado. 
Raquel Nayda necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para comprar su mercadería como ropa.
Raquel Nayda sueña con poner una tienda de ropa.

loans.use: comprar su mercadería como ropa

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah owns a piggery farm where she rears pigs to sell. Sarah is 37 years old and she is married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more piglets to rear and sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Rubenita

texts.en:
Rubenita A. is from Suarez, Iligan City. She is 43, married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rubenita owns & operates  a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Rubenita has had her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rubenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubenita is requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Busto, tiene la edad de 32 años,  habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción, Junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene dos hijos, actualmente estudiante, el mayor en tiempos libres le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, desde hace diez años se dedica a los trabajos de campo ya que sus abuelos le apoyaron para que cultive pitahayas ya que es rica en fresco y accesible de precio, la mayor dificultad que se el presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo, agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su segundo préstamo ,ya que lo va a invertir en fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha y poder pagar en tiempo y forma su préstamo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Busto is 32 and lives in the San Juan de la Concepcion neighborhood with her husband who works and helps her with household expenses. They have 2 children in school. The older one helps her in the fields in his free time. For the past 10 years she has worked in the cultivation of dragon fruit with the support of her grandparents. Dragon fruit (from cactus) are good eaten raw and are affordable. The biggest problems are the infestations that affect the crop. Thanks to Afodenic for the approval of her second loan, she is now able to invest in fertilizer and the supplies necessary for a good crop and to be able to repay her loan on schedule..

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the cultivation of dragon fruit

loans.name: Kulazia's Group

texts.en:
Kulazia is forty eight years old and is the leader of this group. She is a leading specialist in a social fund. Her husband works as a driver for a company. Kulazia and her husband have raised three children. The eldest and the middle sons, 28 and 26 respectively, have taken after their father and work as drivers. The little daughter, 24, is a saleswoman. She is also getting distant education at university. In modern times it has become quite disadvantageous to restrict oneself to have only one occupation. Kulazia is fortunate as fifteen years ago her little brother gave her eldest son a milk cow as a present. Kulazia started to look after the cow even though she was working at that time. Her little brother, having experience in raising livestock, showed them how to look after the cow since neither Kulazia nor her husband has ever looked after cattle before. Even now, her little brother still helps Kulazia look after the cattle. The fact is that, during these years, Kulazia has managed to increase their total cattle population. From time to time she would sell some of her cattle to make repairs to her house and to buy some convenience goods. At this time, Kulazia hopes that she will be able to obtain this loan to buy one more milk cow to sell more milk and increase their cow population. One of her projects for the near future is to start building a big house. The following people are Kulazia’s partners: Anarkul, 46, works in a social fund. She needs a loan to buy a calf. According to her, cattle are a good asset to help her children get on their feet. Bubusaira, 60, is a widow and is the mother of three children. She needs a loan to buy a calf. Azamat, 29, is married and has a two-year-old son. He works as a taxi-driver and needs a loan to purchase tires. Surakan, 47, is a widow. She works and raises cattle. She needs a loan to buy a calf. Kulchoro, 41, trades in various goods. He needs a loan to purchase office supplies to expand his assortment. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow to sell more milk and increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
X. Nguyễn Thị (10102130026) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, X. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale. X. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,876,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. X. is now requesting a new loan of 5,014,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

X. Nguyễn Thị (10102130026) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, X. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ nuôi cá để bán. X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2004, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. X. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. X. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Vicenta Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.
La señora Vicenta tiene una tienda de abarrotes y trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 años atrás. En su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de mercadería.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en la compra de abarrotes como: fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes propia, ya que ahora se hace cargo del negocio de su madre.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las charlas que dan las promotoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vincenta is a partner in the Community Bank of “August 30th”. She lives in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the area of Puno. She is 42 years old and has high school studies completed. She is a single mother and has one child. Mrs. Vincenta has a store that sells groceries and she works with the Manueal Ramos Movement for the last 11 years. Her first loan in her Community Bank was for S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles which allowed her to buy the groceries. She is requesting a loan of S/1000.00 nuevos soles which she will invest in the purchase of groceries such as: noodles, rice, sugar etc. Her hope for the future is to have a grocery store of her own, since right now she is in charge of her mother’s store. What she likes the most about her Community Bank are the savings and the lectures that the bank promoters offer.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles etc.

loans.name: Renelita

texts.en:
Renelita D. is from the village of Banonong. She is 39 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Renelita owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing passenger transportation services such as a motor cab to local community members. Renelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Renelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Renelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for LTO registration and franchise renewal of the transportation unit used primarily in the business. This loan will be the fourth loan which she has taken out  from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For LTO registration and franchise renewal

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Mrs. Norma A. is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old and married with two children. To make living, she operates a sari-sari (general) store but it does not serve as their main source of income because her husband also provides support. She has been engaged in this business for almost four years and upon starting it, she only sold banana cue (a fried-banana dish). Her sari-sari store earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month.

Norma joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to access financial support and to improve her living situation. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her sari-sari store and to buy additional inventory. She wants to save for their future and to live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Rosana, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos hijos; Manuel (13) y María (11) en un populoso distrito de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la fabricación de muebles tapizados; de muy joven aprendió este oficio de una prima que tenía un taller, empezó ayudándole y observando las técnicas hasta que pudo instalar su propio taller en su vivienda e independizarse.
En la actualidad elabora sillones tapizados de muy buena calidad, este trabajo lo hace con la ayuda de 5 personas, ella es la encargada de coser las telas y sus ayudantes de arman los muebles. Rosana considera que esta es una actividad muy rentable, ya que le genera buenas ganancias económicas, pues cuenta con clientes fijos que le hacen grandes pedidos debido a la calidad y comodidad de sus muebles.
Aunque el negocio es cansado, le gusta, porque puede trabajar en la comodidad de su casa. Para el futuro tiene planeado contratar más personal, ya que a veces faltan manos para cumplir con todos los pedidos.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, pues desea seguir siendo parte de su grupo. Rosana tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de más tela para el tapizado de sus muebles.
texts.en:
Rosana, 35, lives in her own house with her two children, Manuel (13) and María (11), in a densly populated neighborhood of Lima. For the last 6 years she has manufactured upholstered furniture. She learned this skill at a very young age from a cousin who had a workshop. She started off helping her and observing the techniques until she was able to set up her own workshop in her home and become independent. Currently she makes high-quality, upholstered armchairs. She has five helpers; she cuts and sews the fabric, her helpers build the furniture. Rosana feels that this is a very profitable business because it generates good profits; she has regular customers that place large orders with her thanks to the quality and comfort of her furniture. Although it is tiring work, she likes it because she can work in the comfort of her home. For the future, she plans to hire more staff because she sometimes doesn't have enough personnel to complete all the orders. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion because she wants to continue to form part of her group. Rosana plans to use the money to buy more fabric to upholster her furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to upholster her furniture.

loans.name: Determine Women Group

texts.en: Klubo N. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Determine Women. She is 38 years old and married with four children aged 7 to 19 years old, with educational levels of kindergarten through 10th grade. Klubo is a high school graduate. In the photo, she is the one holding the sign. Klubo's business is the sale of cold water, both wholesale and retail. She buys sacks (plastic bags) of water from mineral water companies, then cools the bags in a cold storage container and sells to retailers in the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She has been running her business for three years and hopes to establish a real estate business in the future. Klubo will use this loan to purchase additional sacks of water for resale. She dreams of giving her children a better education so that they can have a good future. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of water to sell

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Mirlanda is the coordinator of her group 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her children.

Mirlanda is excited to be taking her fourth loan  with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small general store by investing in a freezer as well as oil, sugar, rice and vegetables to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her children's well-being by purchasing them food and clothes as well as school supplies and a computer to learn on. Additionally, she would like to improve her home and move her business to an area with more traffic. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: A freezer, rice, sugar , cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Buth

texts.en:
Mrs. Buth R. is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Phnom Penh city. Buth R. is married to Heng Hun, age 28. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have given birth to four children: all of them are dependent on their income. In addition, Buth R.’s husband takes time to work in construction. 

In view of the coming farming season, Buth R. wants to grow a great amount of crops in order to sell them when they have matured. As she lacks money to make that possible, Buth R. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Buth R. will use these funds to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to plant. (Buth R.’s husband is in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter G. N. is a 39 year old, hardworking single man. He has been running his own bakery for three years.  He bakes breads and cakes which he sells to the local residents.  Peter has one employee. His business is located in Uthiru, in the western part of the capital city, Nairobi.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter's business has really grown because he can access loans.  He hopes to continue to grow his business and improve his living standards in the future. Peter has requested a loan of kes 60,000 from to buy an electronic oven, renovate his premises and to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy an electronic oven, renovate the business premises and to buy more ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanut

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov K. and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Ny (pictured together), have been married since 2001 and have three sons. Two of them attend school and another one is still young.

Mr. Pov K. a 'Tuk Tuk' motorcycle taxi driver. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia and back. Mrs. Sopheap Ny is a tailor and also runs grocery store. 

Unhappily, Pov’s motorbike is old and does not work properly. It has upset his business and he spends a lot of money for repair costs very often. Facing this, Pov is requesting his second loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one and buy grocery items for his wife’s stock. Then Pov will not be having to make frequent repairs anymore.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one and buy grocery items for his wife’s stock

loans.name: Daniela Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Daniela es una mujer esforzada, trabajadora, con cinco hijos a quienes ha apoyado, junto con su esposo, el trabaja de albañil, no es un trabajo fijo, trabaja por cuenta propia. Desde hace varios años logro poner una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos. El cual ha sido su medio de entradas para ayudar a pagar los gastos  básicos.

Inicio con ayuda de su esposo con los ahorros de su trabajo, pensando también en que abecés no tiene trabajo y de esta manera se solventaría con su familia, en los gastos.

A través de los financiamientos ha logrado un crecimiento en su inventario y ha podido equilibrarse ya que abecés las ventas están bajas aunque no se deja de vender con este préstamo desea comprar granos básicos, golosinas, lácteos y cosmético para mejorar las ventas y la captación de clientes.
texts.en:
Daniela is a hard working woman, who has five children to support along with her husband. She works as a bricklayer, independently. She also owns a little grocery store where she sells a variety of products, and that has been her main source of income to cover basic expenses of her family. She started the business with the help of her husband, and hopes to one day support her family entirely by doing that. Because of the loans she got, she has been able to increase the amount of merchandise offered at her store and keep her inventory diverse with grains, pastries, dairy products as well as cosmetics, and attract more clients to her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food Products for Reselling

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor S. is from the town of Surallah. She is 53 years old and married with six children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $43 a month from these activities.

Eleanor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eleanor is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm supplies. This will be her 6th loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jamson

texts.en:
On Bufunda Street, Ibanda town, exists a hardworking and determined B. Jamson who has been running a produce business for a period of thirty years where he sell foodstuffs and animals. As a matter of fact, determination and hard work have brought him this far along in his businesses selling bananas and goats.

This loan will help Jamson to do more research on better quality of products he trades in like rice, maize, beans and sorghum and to further restock his business in order to match his customers’ demand. With an improved business he will be able to earn more revenue and be able to develop his family in the future as he struggles to educate his eleven children to make them better people.

loans.use: To restock and expand his business by buying more goats and bananas to sell

loans.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE KHADIM est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier.

le Groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. Les membres qui le composent se sont unis solidairement et développent une même esprit de groupe, un esprit de partage et de fraternité. 

Madame Seynabou D., assise à gauche de la photo emmitouflée d'une écharpe noire et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans; elle est mariée et mère de o5 enfants dont 03 filles. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes au marché central de Louga. Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en légumes. 

Son objectif est d'avoir une autonomie financière. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE KHADIM was established on December 14, 2008.  It is composed of eight women who are all from the same district.  The group is part of the Banc Villageois of Nguidile.  The members composing it are united in solidarity and are developing a spirit of teamwork,  sharing, and sisterhood.  Ms. Seynabou D., who is seated at the left in the photo and snug in her black scarf (also see inserted portrait), is the group's leader.  She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children, including three daughters. Seynabou has a small business selling vegetables at the Louga central market.  Her loan will allow her to bolster her supplies of vegetables.  Her goal is to have some financial autonomy.  She is helping to support the family, for example, in terms of food and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 46 year old married lady with four children.  She has been practicing dairy farming for twenty years.  She is a member of the Biwanyeji group in Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, she has been able to buy more cows.  She can also afford to pay school fees for her two children who are still in school.  She is requesting a 40, 000 KES loan  to buy a dairy cow and animal feed.  She believes that the loan will help her increase milk production and hence a better income.  She hopes to buy more cows in ten years.  Mary describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Rinberti

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Rinberti; el socio tiene 27 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio es natural de Puno,  El socio se  dedica al comercio, él y su conyugue tiene una tienda de abarrotes y mayormente venden golosinas y stickers. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar e implementar su negocio.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. He lives in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. His name is Rinberti, and he is 27 years old. He has a live-in partner and 2 children. He is originally from Puno. His work is in retail: he and his spouse have a general store, where their best-selling products are snacks and stickers. Rinberti is requesting the loan to expand and improve his business. The borrower values and appreciates the loan offered to him, and accordingly, he is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding and improving his business

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy M. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries for an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  M. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Turesian Ole

texts.en:
Turesian Ole N. is 49 years old. He is married to Meteu Nkawatei and he is the father of four children. Turesian is a wheat farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is a KADET LTD registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend buying pesticide and fertilizer for his already growing wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan by reinvesting in the farm and planting a bigger piece of land with wheat.

Turesian's dream is to practice large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for his already growing wheat

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria de 30 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución. Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de bisutería. 

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bisutería, vende la bisutería a sus amigos y vecinos para tener dinero y en ocasiones de dedica a trabajar como veterinaria para tener mas ingresos. Trabaja desde las muy temprano sola pero uno de los problemas que tiene en la zona donde vive es la delincuencia y casi no puede recorre las calles para vender. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, pinturas y bloques y así darle una mejor fachada a su casa y que sus clientes compren la bisutería. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener su propia oficina para ser veterinaria autorizada.
texts.en:
Gloria is 30 years old and lives in a periurban area called Duran, which is characterized by its disappearing ecosystem. She has a small business selling costume jewelry.

Gloria makes and sells costume jewelry to her friends and neighbors to have money. Sometimes, she also works as a veterinarian to have more income. She works alone starting very early in the morning but one of the problems in the area where she lives is delinquency, so she can hardly go out to the streets to sell.

With the loan, she wants to purchase construction materials such as cement, paint, and blocks so that she can give her house a better look and so that her customers will buy her jewelry. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and have her own office to be an official veterinarian.

loans.use: Cement, blocks

loans.name: Juana Mabel

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, una ciudad bastante comercial y que ha venido experimentando un crecimiento acelerado durante los últimos años. Es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la preparación y venta de pasteles y tortas. Ella brinda su servicio para personas que celebren ocasiones especiales como cumpleaños, aniversarios, etc. Debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando en esta actividad se ha vuelto conocida en el rubro y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sostener la economía familiar.

Juana desea adquirir algunos insumos para ampliar su producción de pasteles y percibir mayor número de ganancias ya que se acerca la época del año en que se programan las fiestas de promoción de los colegios, para lo cual siempre le solicitan pedidos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Juana es una mujer tranquila y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y empezar a distribuir sus papeles a mayor escala.
texts.en:
Juana, 56, is single and has a son.  She lives in the city of Chiclayo, a quite commercial city that has been undergoing accelerated growth over the last few years.  It is the capital of Lambayeque region.

For the last ten years she has been making cakes and pastries to sell.  She provides her service to people who are celebrating special occasions like birthdays, anniversaries, etc. Thanks to the time she’s been in business she has become very well known in the field and she currently has a base of regular customers.  Income from this activity provides family support.

Juana wants to acquire some ingredients to expand her cake production thus earning more profits because the time of year when graduation parties in schools is fast approaching and orders will be placed with her.  She is, therefore, asking for her first, 500 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Juana is a mature, quite hard working woman.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to start selling her cakes in a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her cake and pastry making business.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro se dedica al servicio de transporte en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, el señor nos cuenta que tuvo que viajar desde La Paz su ciudad natal en busca de mejores oportunidades el y su familia tuvieron que acostumbrarse al nuevo cL. al nuevo ambiente, y con mucho sacrificio se establecieron, ahora el señor Ramiro trabaja como trasnportista de un radio taxi pero a veces su vehiculo sufre desperfectos razon por la cual solicito un credito para que le permita comprar los repuestos necesarios para reparar su vehiculo y tenerlo en mejores condiciones asi podra generar mas ingresos y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El señor Ramiro comenta que despues de terminar este credito solicitara un nuevo credito para empezar con la construccion de su casita.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramiro provides transportation services in the city of Santa Cruz. He says that he moved away from La Paz, the city of his birth, in search of better opportunities for himself and his family. Ramiro had to get accustomed to a new climate and a new environment, but after much sacrifice he was able to get settled.

He currently works as a radio taxi driver, but sometimes his vehicle malfunctions. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy the necessary parts to repair his vehicle. By keeping it in better condition, Ramiro will be able to generate more income and provide his family with a better quality of life. After he finishes repaying this loan, Ramiro says he will request another loan so that he can begin the construction of his house.

loans.use: Purchase parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a Karina, ella tiene 25 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos, además por que los intereses son bajos.

Ella se dedica a la comercio vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo.  También vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días por las tardes, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella visita a sus clientes les enseña la revista para que ellos vean que es lo que desean comprar, luego ella realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar más de su mercadería en especial ropa que es lo que mas vende. Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The members of the cooperative bank San Esteban meet every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto.  This locality is known for its traditional culture, and also for being just a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

We find Karina here, who is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  This is her sixth cycle with the cooperative bank and she likes it because the loans are quick and don’t require as much paperwork.  In addition, the interest rates are low.

She dedicates herself to commerce, selling clothing and shoes by catalog.  She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).  She works every day in the afternoon, selling door-to-door, visiting customers to show them the catalog so they can choose what they’d like to purchase.  Later, she places the orders and delivers the products herself.  She delivers on credit, and collects payment every fifteen days.

This new loan is to purchase more merchandise, especially clothing, which is what sells best.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario Y. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 55 years old, married and has two children aged 16 and 14. To make a living, Mario owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Mario does his best to provide his family's needs. He also prioritizes his children's education.

Mario joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mario is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and pig food. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig food

loans.name: Siezd

texts.en:
Siezd H. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His four children attend a local school. 

Siezd owns and operates two businesses:  bakery production and a car trading. He started his car trading business in 2005 and has found success,  which enabled  him to start his second business in 2009. He operates his bakery production business with the help of his brother from his workplace, where his brother's wife makes a variety of breads and pastries. 

After years of operation, he has gained much experience as a businessman. Siezd is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more replacement and spare parts for his car selling business.

loans.use: To purchase replacement/spare parts

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua N. sells cooked rice. She also sells bagged gari, groundnuts and sugar at Abura. She is divorced and has three children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients to cook for sale to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop. Efua has displayed the bagged items on the table for sale.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Nadi

texts.en:
Nadi is a 29 years old man from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip, Nadi is married and a father of two sons and two daughters. Nadi had health complications recently and he needed to do different types of tests to diagnose the breathing problems he had.

Nadi is a decent employee in the municipality and he couldn't pay off the cost of the tests all at once therefore he took the loan from FATEN and paid it as it's easier for him to pay monthly smaller amounts of money for FATEN.

Nadi appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch

loans.use: Pay off personal medical expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Tserenchimeg

texts.en:
Tserenchimeg is 33 years old, lives with her 2 children and her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a one-bedroom studio apartment. Her two children, 5 and 13, attend kindergarten and local secondary school. Tserenchimeg has worked in a laundry service, named “Pegma”, as a hostess since 2005. Her husband Uranbaatar, 35, has operated a tire repair shop for the last three years. Tserenchimeg purchased a second-hand car by her savings. 

This is her second loan through Credit Mongol and she is one of our reliable customers. Tserenchimeg says "I am planning to open my own laundry service in the future.” Tserenchimeg is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to fix her apartment.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to fix her apartment

loans.name: One Word Unit Group

texts.en:
Osman D. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Osman was born in Yoni village about 28 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has one child. For eight years now, Osman has been selling used clothes. 

This is the first loan that Osman and members of his group have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Osman will use his share of the loan (500,000 leones) to expand his business by buying a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Nhy

texts.en: Mrs.Nhy, born in 1959, owns a general store in her local village where she sells groceries to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Oeun, is a farmer who owns a four-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell and for his family to eat. He has a lot of free time so Mrs. Nhy is asking for a loan to buy a cow to start a new cow-breeding business. This couple has two children, one of whom is a construction worker, and the other is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: El señor Bernardo F. S. es un hombre muy emprendedor desde hace años lo pensionaron de su trabajo por motivos de salud, por lo que cuenta que no es suficiente el dinero que percibe por mes para sostener los gastos de la casa. Para esto el empezó su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde 5 años, donde le ha ido muy bien económicamente para cubrir sus gastos. Este crédito será su quinto crédito donde ha demostrado tener una muy buena cultura de pago. Como su negocio ha estado creciendo el necesita comprar mas mercancía de temporada.
texts.en:
Mr. Bernardo F. S. is an enterprising man who was retired from his job years ago due to health issues.  He comments that the monthly income he receives is insufficient to cover household expenses.  Because of this he started his own business selling used clothes five years ago where he’s done well economically to meet expenses.

This will be his 5th loan; he has demonstrated very good repayment habits.  Because the business has been growing he needs to buy more seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seasonal items to stock the business.

loans.name: Radio San Gabriel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RADIO SAN GABRIEL” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por once integrantes y tiene como presidenta de la mesa directiva a la señora  Paulina. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Paulina, indica que es la primera ves que forma parte de una asociación comunal  y que integro la asociación por invitación de la promoción que se hizo en su zona.

Nos cuenta Doña Paulina que el negocio que ella tiene es de tejido de mantas; es por esta razón que el prestamo que sacará es para la compra de Lanas. Posteriormente culminada sus productos los venderá en las ferias.esta forma de trabajo le ayudará a apoyar la economía de su familia , ya que ella esta casada y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Radio San Gabriel” communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Focus Center.  It has 11 members and Paulina is President of the governing board.  The members’ businesses are varied.  Among them are: commerce, production and services.

Paulina tells us that this is the first time she’s been part of a communal association and that she joined invited by the promotion that took place in her area.

She relates that the business she has consists in weaving blankets.  Because of this, the loan she’ll take out is to buy wool.  Once her items are complete she will sell them at the markets and the work will thus help her family’s economy since she’s married and has a son.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of fish for resale

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa B. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her sons, age 14 and 18, both go to a local secondary school. Her husband, Batbileg, manages a wood-trading business between the center of the province and the countryside area. 

Ariunaa operates a dairy-product trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000. She collects dairy products from herders and sells them in the center of the province. She is one of the more experienced businesswomen in her town. 

Her husband and Ariunaa deposited their earnings for several years and were able to build a house last year. 

She is hardworking lady who says, "I have been able to expand my business by receiving a loan from your bank frequently and I am happy for that. Also our family had a chance to have our own house last year. Since then we began to have a much more comfortable lifestyle." 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products from herders.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old, single, and has one adult child. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services such as pillowcase and bedsheet repair to local community members. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. Alma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be Alma's sixth loan  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Alma has a food shop that sells pizza pies. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like flour, eggs, meat, sausages & food seasonings. Alma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like flour, eggs, meat, sausages & food seasonings

loans.name: Maria Romelia

texts.es: Romelia tiene su tienda en la aldea xesuj vende todos los días, golosinas, maíz, afrecho, gaseosas etc. A parte de eso tiene gallinas, de eso ella obtiene ganancias solicita el crédito para comprar golosinas, afrecho maíz etc. Su sueño es tener otra tienda mas o agrandar su negocio ya que le beneficia porque es local propio.
texts.en: Romelia has her store in the village of Xexuj.  She’s open every day.  She sells snacks, corn, bran, soft drinks, etc.  In addition, she raises chickens.  From all this she earns profits.  She is asking for the loan to buy snacks, bran, corn, etc.  Her dream is to have another store or to enlarge her business since this would benefit her in that she owns the locale.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ludi Elem

texts.es:
La señora Ludí Elem es casada con el señor Fidel y con quien procreo do hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: elisana meradi de cuatro años de edad y el más pequeño es Franklin Michel de un año de edad.

   Ella se dedica  a  compra y venta de ropas, para damas, caballero y niños, así también en la compra de zapatos, en donde lleva dos años y ocho meses  en lo que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello está teniendo  un buen resultado dentro de su hogar y familia.
