   Lo que lo inspiro ha esta actividad fue su familia ya que también quiere apoya a su esposo con los ingresos  de la casa y darle lo mejor a su pequeña familia.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda tener mejor ingresos y con el préstamo apoyarse para que mejor sea su mercancía.
texts.en:
Ludí Elem is married to Fidel and they have two children who are still their responsibility.  They are: Elisana Meradi, 4, and Franklin Michel, 1.

She buys and sells clothes for women, men and children.  She also buys shoes.  She’s been in business two years and eight months and comments that she does well since she’s having good results with it within her family and home.

Her family inspired her to go into this activity because she wants to help her husband with income for the home and provide the best for her little family.

What she most wants to get from this small activity is improved income and to use the loan to help improve her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and clothes to resell later.

loans.name: Jimmy Jose

texts.es: Jimmy José tiene 37 años, su actividad es una pulpería. El señor Jimmy inició su negocio hace dos años, su esposa lo motivó a que dieran inicio a un pequeño negocio para obtener otros ingresos ya que él trabaja en una empresa y con parte del salario de su  empleo dio comienzo al negocio, su mayor desafío es mantenerse en competencia con los otros negocios, el también es panadero y sabe hacer todo tipo de repostería y estas las pone a la venta en su negocio y también encargos que le realizan sus clientes. el financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, jugos, fósforos y sal.
texts.en: Jimmy José is 37 and runs a local store. Mr. Jimmy started his business two years ago. His wife motivated him to start a small business in order to make a second income; he works for a company and used part of this salary to start his business. His greatest challenge is to stay competitive with the other businesses. He is also a baker and knows how to make all types of pastries. He sells these in his store and also delivers to customers. The loan that he is now requesting is for the purchase of rice, beans, oil, candy, pop, juice, matches and salt.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, candy, pop, juice, matches and salt.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy, 36, is married and blessed with two children, aged twelve and three. He is a tailor and has been in the business for five years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. and he has borrowed 10,000 KES to purchase stock for his business. The anticipated profits will be used to pay fees for his children and to improve the stock of his business.

His dreams are to improve his business as well as the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing threads and materials for his business.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is from the village of Erge, in the mountainous Adjara republic in Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, Leila; his retired father;  3 sons (18, 17, and 15 years old); and a 13 year-old daughter. 

Nugzar and Leila lead the family's agricultural activities. In particular, they grow tangerines and various fruits and vegetables on 0.3 hectares of  land owned by the family.  Harvested products are sold to local greengrocery retailers. Nugzar and Leila work hard daily to get a good harvest. 

Nugzar requested credit to purchase fertilizer for tangerines and vegetables. After fertilizing the land, the family will get quality produce and sell it for a good price.  The income received will be used for purchasing household goods, in order to improve the living conditions of the children and other family members.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for tangerines and vegetables

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un joven de 18 años de edad, vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y la agricultura. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. Cimarrón se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias.

Desde hace varios meses que Marco ha querido iniciar con un negocio de siembra de banano, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad que le heredaron sus padres para tal fin pero le faltan lo principal para que su negocio surja, él espera vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad. Dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Marco está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de de semillas de banano. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Marco es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Marco is a young man of 18 years. He lives with his family in a community called Cimarron de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the Cartago province. This is a small rural community of approximately two thousand inhabitants. Its people work in milk production and agriculture. The terrain is irregular and much of it is tropical, humid woods. Cimarron is located approximately an hour and a half by bus from Turrialba, the closest shopping center. Of course, at various times throughout the year the road becomes impassable due to the rain.

Marco has wanted to start a banana plantation for several months, since he now has property which he inherited from his parents for this purpose. However, he does not have the capital to start up his business. He hopes to sell his produce to his community. He says that he finds this project very interesting.

Marco is now requesting a micro loan of ¢500 000 (five hundred thousand Colones) for the purchase of banana seeds. With this, he hopes to raise up his business and greatly improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Marco is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas for Cimarrón, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be Marco's first loan and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and economically, as well as participating actively in his community's credit organization.

loans.use: to plant banana trees

loans.name: Selso

texts.es: El Sr. Selso de 36 años actualmente separado y con un hija de 16 años se dedica a la venta de pancitas y anticuchos por la zona donde vive ya aproximadamente 02 años, además tiene otros ingresos como tractorista,  el crédito solicitado es para incrementar su negocio con la venta de caldo de gallina y así poder tener mejor ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida, su gran meta del Sr. Selso es el de poner su propio restaurante y el sueño de construir su casa, además está muy agradecido por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Selso, 36 years of age and currently separated, works with his 16 year old daughter in the sale of pancitas (tripe) and anticuchos (small pieces of grilled skewered meat) in the area where they have lived for approximately 2 years.  Moreover, he has other income as a tractor driver.  The loan requested is for the purpose of increasing his business with the sale of chicken soup and thus, be able to have a better income and quality of life.  Selso's big goal is to start his own restaurant and his dream is to build his home.  In addition, he is very grateful for the opportunity he's been offered.

loans.use: to increase his business

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is 50 years old and is a food seller who earns 6.5 USD each day. Her husband hunts frogs to sell and earns 3 USD daily. The couple has seven children, three of whom are studying and four who are working and each earning 4 USD daily. Each month, Lay must spend 80 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 15 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses.

Lay is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a motorbike so that her son can commute to work. She does not want to change her career as she makes a good profit. Lay will support her children to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so her son can travel to work

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia describes herself as a simple and responsible parent. She is a 56-year-old widow who has been blessed with four children, who are now grown. She owns and manages a retail store within the village of Villa Cruz San Mateo.  Three of her are married while the youngest is still single and working.

Delia aimed to sell more grocery items to earn a higher income, but she does not have enough capital.  That's why she is asking for additional capital of P30,000 to buy additional stocks of groceries such as soft drinks, biscuit, eggs, canned goods, instant noodles, vegetables, meat and ingredients needed in her retail shop business. She believes that through the loan she requests, she will be able to improve the business and increase her income to sustain her needs and education of her grandchild. In the future, she is hoping to save a larger amount so that she can remain secure as she ages.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, eggs, canned goods, instant noodles, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Souadou

texts.fr:
Souadou abite au sud du sénégal,elle est agée de 35 ans.Elle s'est mariée à l'age de 25 ans sans enfant,jusque à nos jours.Elle achete des legumes à dakar.
Pendant 15 ans,elle fait le commerce pour soutenir sa maman et assurer ses visites medicale car elle pense 
toujours a avoir des enfants dans sa vie
Souadou avec son commerce,elle a acheté un terrain à Brin dont elle veut construir dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Souadou lives in the south of Senegal and is 35 years old. She got married when she was 25 years old and has no children to date. She buys vegetables in Dakar. For the past fifteen years she has been trading in order to support her mother and pay for her own medical appointments, since she is still thinking of having children during her life.

Thanks to her business Souadou has bought a piece of land in Brin and wants to build on it in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables: cabbages, potatoes, gombos, aubergines,etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 42 years old. He is married to Margaret and they have three children aged from 3 to 15 years old. Patrick has successfully operated a barber shop in Kakamega for the last eight years. He makes a monthly income of KES 11,800 and it is through this income that he has diversified to other business such as car battery charging and video shows.

Patrick is taking a first loan of KES 20,000, which he will use to buy new shaving machines and shaving shampoos. As part of his business diversification, he will also buy a car battery charger. Patrick is ambitious since he hopes to one day open a cereal business shop to supplement his monthly income. He hopes to be a successful businessman in Kakamega.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines and shaving shampoos

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de huevos y gallina. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este medio de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de huevos, en el tiempo de verano los productos suben de precio por lo que necesita esta inversión para complacer a sus clientes. Ella es una persona muy responsable y además es una madre abnegada tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo que los ha mantenido con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en: María Del Carmen sells eggs and hens.  She has had this business for more than 16 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs. Prices for products increase in the summer, so she needs this loan to satisfy her customers.  She is very responsible person and a self-sacrificing mother with 2 children whom she has supported with her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase eggs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 66 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, noodles, etc. In the future Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mwembula Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mwembula SHG Group in Western Kenya! 

Ruth takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ruth had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Ruth was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Ruth will educate her children and save for the future.

Ruth is the facilitator of the Mwembula SHG group. The photograph shows Ruth with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mwembula SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ruth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Annabelle has a shop that sells floor wax, detergents, soaps & diapers. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy detergents, soaps & baby diapers.
Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soaps & baby diapers

loans.name: Edith Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Edith, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 10 y 2 años de edad, los tres mayores  estudian dos en colegio y uno en escuela. El marido es carpintero.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja los últimos tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella aprovecha las ofertas que hay ya que estas le dejan mejores ganancias por que luego vende a precio normal, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos. Tiene tres  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jaime Roldos meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton, this place is known for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Here, the majority of inhabitants are very hard-working and work in tasks of the sea.

In this place lives Edith, she is 33 years old and is in a common law marriage with four children.  The children are 14, 12, 10 and 2 years old.  The three eldest are in high school and one is in school.  The husband is a carpenter.

She is a housewife and to have her own resources she sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies accessories).  She sells door to door the last three days of the week.  She sells her products on credit and collects every eight days.  She takes advantage of the special offers and then makes a bigger profit by selling these products at normal price later on.  The best selling items are the perfumes and cosmetics.  She has been selling these products for three years and it has been going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and miscellaneous items.  This is the fourth cycle at the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Tujinama Group

texts.fr:
Véronique est une commerçante âgée de 50ans qui habite à Masenga dans la province de Gitega. Elle vend du charbon et la bière de sorgho  depuis 6 ans. Elle a commence cette activité alors qu’elle faisait l’agriculture. Elle fait ses études jusqu’en 4e année primaire. Elle est mariée à Salvator. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter  des bananes pour la préparation de la bière à vendre afin de satisfaire les besoins de la famille. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire«Tujinama».
texts.en:
Véronique is a 50-year-old shopkeeper who lives in Masenga in the province of Gitega. She has been selling coal and sorghum beer for six years. She started this business when she was a farmer. She studied up until the fourth level of primary school. She is married to Salvator.

The Kiva loan that she gets will allow her to increase her capital to buy bananas to prepare beer to sell in order to satisfy the needs of her family.

She is a member of the community group Tujinama.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy bananas for the preparation of beer to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 29-year-old single man.  He has no children yet. He operates a Nissan van in which he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of maintenance. He will use the loan to pay for the repair cost of his Nissan. His business goal is to be the best service provider within five years.

loans.use: To pay for his vehicle repair expenses.

loans.name: Gbehigbenan Nouvo 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBEHIGBENAN NOUVO 2 est composé de neuf personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Chimène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Chimène est âgée de 28 ans et est célibataire. Chimène a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Chimène vit seule. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Chimène vend des tissus et du riz par la technique de distribution depuis une dizaine d'année. Chimène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de roulement pour rehausser son activité, Chimène ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GBEHIGBENAN NOUVO 2, sollicitent pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et du riz.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Leticia started her own small business of selling shoes and jewelery. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns a variable salary and sometimes it was not enough to cover all the family expenses and for that reason she decided to start her business to support her husband with the family maintenance. When she started her business, she only offered her products among her family and friends. Later she was including her neighbors and everybody who wanted her products. The highest season sale is coming and she wants to be prepare to take all the orders of her clients. This is the reason why she requires a loan by $250 USD to buy shoes and jewelry, she is going to pay back in a term of 3-6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Hace ocho años que Leticia inició su propio negocio de venta de zapatos y joyería, ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es albañil y trabaja en la obra de construcción, pero como sus ingresos son variables en ocasiones resultaban insuficientes para costear todos los gastos de la familia, esa fue la razón por la que decidió iniciar su negocio para apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de la familia. Cuando inició su negocio solamente ofrecía sus productos entre sus familiares y amistades y con el paso del tiempo fue extendiéndose con sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta por iniciar la temporada de ventas altas y es por eso que quiere estar preparada para atender a sus clientes, para ello que requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 USD para comprar zapatos y joyas, para pagar en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Terlan

texts.en: Terlan M. lives and owns a small metal shop in Aghsu city. He is married with two children. Terlan, along with his brother Farhad, were trained in the family trade of ironworks by their father. He has run his own shop for the past eight years making knives, saws, shovels, and other metal items. Terlan wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wants the money to invest in the maintenance and repair of her cafeteria. Another portion of the money will go to invest in an industrial stove, which will allow her to prepare better meals, quicker and easier.

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Mrs Chab P. is a widow of 35 years old. She is a grocer and her income reaches 6 dollars per day. She has 3 children and she has to take care of them alone. She needs a motorcycle to ensure her family transportation. In the future, she wants to expand her grocery by increasing her range of products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his mobile phone repair business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha M. is married and has 5 children. She lives in Kariobangi South, an area characterized by informal settlements located within the Eastern part of Nairobi. Here, she sells vegetables and cereals to help provide for her family. She is a born-again Christian and a very committed member of her local church located within her neighborhood. She is the chairlady of the women’ fellowship in her local church where, besides giving spiritual nourishment, they empower women in the church economically. Her husband is involved in casual jobs from which he gets little wages. 

In order to supplement the family income, Tabitha started her business by selling vegetables in small quantities way back in 1997. Previously, she would knit cardigans and sell them at Ksh 500 and this is how she was able to make savings to start off her vegetable and cereal business. With time, she made considerable progress and moved from selling the vegetables from the ground where she arranged them, to constructing a kiosk, from where she now sells her products. Apart from the vegetables that she sold, Tabitha also introduced a range of cereals. However, due to the limited capital she has, she only manages to buy in measures of quarter sacks, and these only last for about two days, after which she has to buy additional stock. 

Tabitha now wants to take her business a notch higher and therefore wants to purchase the cereals in full sacks. This will increase her profit and will enable her to retain her customers who sometimes come to buy cereals but  find them out of stock. She is requesting for a loan of USD 400, which will be given in kind, to purchase the stock of cereals, including beans, peas and rice. The loan repayment period will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchased assorted cereals including  beans, peas and rice

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: D. Mahbuba is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She has traded at a clothing market for almost 4 years. The goods she sells are mainly female and male clothes as well as shoes. She would like to use her next loan to buy a winter season assortment of goods.

loans.use: Trade of female and male clothes

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalia is a very powerful woman, conditioned by her work. Rosalia is a farmer and is faithful to her Andean roots. She raises animals and grows potatoes, corn, and tubers. She shares in this work with her husband. The production and sale of their goods provides support for their household. In order to obtain their daily sustenance and the necessities of life, the two arise early each day and complete the tasks of the country life.

There are many plans that the family proposed in order to better their lives. One of these is to increase the number of animals that they own in order to bring new blood into the herd and to sell the milk. The loan that is requested will be well invested.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalía, es una mujer con muchas fuerzas encausadas a un trabajo digno, ella es agricultora y es fiel a sus raíces andinas. Se dedica a la crianza de animales y al cultivo de papa, maíz y olluco; con la cosecha y la venta de sus animales puede sonstener su hogar y se siente feliz porque el trabajo que realiza lo hace en compañía de su querido esposo.Se levantan muy temprano para dedicarse a sus actividades del campo a fin de obtener su sustento diario y necesario para vivir. Son muchos planes que como familia unida se han propuesto entre ellos esta el de incrementar la cantidad de animales que poseen para mejorar su raza con el objetivo de comercializar su leche.La cantidad de dinero que solicitan será bien invertido.

loans.use: Purchase of additional animals.

loans.name: Elva

texts.en:
Elva A. makes ropes, speacializing in clothes lines, in the city of Mariano R. Alonso. This has been her business and her main source of income for eleven years. She sells her rope not only to businesses in her hometown, but to other stores large cities throughout Paraguay. Hardware stores and general stores in the cities of Ciudad del Este, Villarrica, Coronel Oviedo, Caaguazú, and Encarnación all sell ropes made by Elva A..

She began the business with a small amount of capital, and through her great business sense and exceptional product, her company has grown. It provides a good income for Elva, her husband and two children. It has also provided her two children the opportunity to attend school.

In order to satisfy her faithful customers, Elva is asking for a loan in order to buy the rope material. She hopes that news of his business will continue to travel throughout Paraguay and that she will continue to see and increase in business and profits.

loans.use: To buy material to make ropes and cords.

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en: Ulker A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city of Azerbaijan. She has been settled with her family in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan, since 1993. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She is engaged in clothing sales in Beylagan city bazaar. She has ten years of experience at this business. Ulker applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $200 to purchase socks, underwear, etc. and increase the variety of her goods.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods in her store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is the mother of a young daughter. She sells palm nuts, okra, and cornmeal at a street-side stand in the market at Kronum.

She is seeking a loan in order to begin selling cassava at her stand and to increase her inventory of maize (for cornmeal). With the profits from the expected increase in sales, she hopes to pay for her daughter’s school fees.

Ama is a member of the trust group God’s Love. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To add cassava and additional maize to her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Wool and Materials

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mrs. In S., 53, is a mother of four children who lives in a part of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a stand that recharges home batteries for the people in her community. There are many houses in her community that still have no any electricity, so the people in that area use a home battery to generate electricity. When the batteries run out, they have to come over to Mrs. In S. to ask for recharging.

With this business activity, In S. and her husband can typically earn at least $4 each day in revenue. They have now requested for a loan to purchase a machine to use for recharging batteries. With the new machine, she and her husband can recharge more batteries each day.

loans.use: To puchase a machine that recharges batteries

loans.name: Association Adjola Group

texts.fr:
The Association DITORGUIE Agoè (l’association DITORGUIE Agoè) was formed in 2007 by three dynamic women who found it necessary to regroup. These members are involved in diverse commercial activities that range from selling pots, basic goods, and shoes. They are all married and have families. This is the group's first loan, which will allow them to buy 28 pairs of shoes, 22 pots, and 12 bottled drinks, which are local to the region.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Créée en 2007 par un groupe de trois femmes dynamiques, l’association DITORGUIE Agoè a pour objectif la satisfaction des besoins des membres qu’elle regroupe. Ses membres exercent divers types d’activités commerciales telles que la vente de marmites, la vente des produits de premières nécessités et la vente de chaussures. Elles sont tous des femmes mariées et sont des mères de famille. Le premier crédit que cette association sollicite actuellement lui permettra de faire les achats de 28 paires de chaussures, de 22 marmites et 12 bouteilles de boisson locale.

loans.use: buy basic goods

loans.name: Shaal

texts.en:
Shaal P. is 37. He is married and has 9 children. The family has lived in Shewa district of the Ningarhar province, which is an agricultural area, for a long time. Five of his children are studying in a public school but besides their schooling, they help their father with the farming part time .

Shaal P. has spent 12 years in farming. Prior to that, he worked as a shopkeeper in his village but the business did not support his family as much as they needed. So P. changed his business and now he is growing different kinds of vegetables on his land.

Shaal is a hard-working man. He wants to buy some livestock, too, because he thinks that he has a lot of grasslands in his village, and he can pick up good profit from them. He says that if he sells milk and yogurt, he will be able to solve all his financial problems. Through that he will provide all stationery or other necessary things for his children, also he will able to take care of his family’s health situation. But Shaal says that all these things depend to his income. Because his current daily income is just about 400 Afghanis ($8), it’s too difficult to make ends meet. Shaal decided to buy some livestock and increase his income through having it, but he doesn’t have much capital on hand for this purpose. So he has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghanis (US$ 650) from AFSG.

Shaal P. cares deeply about his children’s future, and he dreams of seeing them educated in the future. He says, "I can accept all problems for this goal, but I will never let them leave off studying." Also, he already thanks lenders for their great help.

loans.use: To buy some livestock

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina I. sells thread, linen, etc. She is a seamstress by profession since 2000, working at Abura. Amina has received vocational schooling.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is responsible for helping her husband meet the financial needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy fabric, linen and other sewing materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, linen, and other sewing materials

loans.name: Thi Tam's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Tâm, sinh năm 1957 (Ms 23010147), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Hiện nay gia đình cô có 1000 con gà đẻ trứng. Song song với nuôi gà, gia đình cô còn có nghề làm đậu phụ cung cấp cho người dân trong làng, đồng thời cô nuôi một con bò và lợn. Trứng gà đẻ và đậu phụ làm ra chính là nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình cô đem lại thu nhập bình quân theo ngày khoảng 150.000 vnđ đến 200.000 vnđ. D. đó cô có thể nuôi 3 con ăn học và trả vốn hàng tuần. Cùng vay vốn với cô còn có các thành viên:
Trần Thị Liên, sinh năm 1959 (Ms 23010143), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.
Bùi Thị Huệ, sinh năm 1956 (Ms 23010144), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi(mua cá giống về thả ao)
Nguyễn Thị Sáng, sinh năm 1978(Ms 23010145), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư mua bò.
Ngô Thị Lừng, sinh năm 1962(Ms 23010151), mức vay: 2.436.000 vnđ để mở rộng cửa hàng bán đồ ăn sẵn(Thịt chin, giò, trả)
Đỗ Thị Ái Ân, sinh năm 1983 (Ms 23010148), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ bán hàng khô(Gia vị, măng,...)
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Tam (ID Number 23010147), born in 1957, would like to borrow 4,452,000VND to invest in raising chickens. Currently, her family has 1000 chickens giving eggs everyday. Besides that, her family also makes tofu to sell to the villagers, as well as rears pigs and a cow.Chicken eggs and the tofu sold have become the main source of income for her family, bringing about a daily income of 150,000VND to 200,000VND (about 9USD to 12USD). Thus, Mrs. Tam is able to send her three children to school and repay the loan weekly. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. T. Thi Lien (ID Number 23010143), born in 1959, borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in her business.
  • Mrs. B. Thi Hue (UD Number 23010144), born in 1956 , borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in raising livestock (purchasing breeding fish to raise in pond)
  • Mrs. N. Thi Sang (ID Number 23010145), born in 1978, borrows 4,028,000VND to purchase cows.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Lung (ID Number 23010151), born in 1962, borrows 2,436,000VND to expand her food store (selling cooked meat, pork-pie, grilled chopped meat, etc.)
  • Mrs. Đo Thi Ai An (ID Number 23010148), born in 1983, borrows 3,604,000VND to sell dried food stuff (eg. spices, bamboo shoots etc.)
  • The total amount requested is 1,375USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
La actividad económica a la que se dedica el señor Rigoberto C. es a la agricultura sembrando maíz en su finca ubicada en la ciudad de León especialmente en el municipio de Nagarote.

Es de necesidad destacar que hoy en día Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su actividad económica porque le ha brindado créditos para la siembra del maíz. Hoy en día una vez mas ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de invertir en su cosecha de maíz para luego comercializarlo en su municipio y así mantener a su amada familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo por ser el único sustento del hogar.
texts.en:
Rigoberto C. makes a living cultivating corn on his farm located in the Nagarote area of the city of León. It's necessary to emphasize that Kiva partner Ceprodel has been a pillar in his work because it has provided him loans to plant his crops. Once again he's turning to Ceprodel with the goal of investing in harvesting his corn to later sell in his city so he can provide for his beloved family which is in such need of his support since he is their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in harvesting his corn

loans.name: Melithe N.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 53-year-old Melithe M. from Mbeya, married with eight children between the ages of 12 and 34 and also responsible for supporting one dependent whose parents died of HIV. Melithe has been running a vitenge (sarong-like women’s garments) business since 2005, buying them wholesale and then retailing them. Working at the business for five to eight hours per day six days per week and assisted by her husband. Melithe currently earns about $200 each month from her business.

She is now requesting a loan of $425 in order to buy more vitenge and wool in bulk, and in the future plans to expand and add another business. Melithe thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and wool in bulk.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing E. is 26 years old and married with a child. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells drinks, foodstuffs and provisions. She hopes to own a supermarket in future. She needs a loan of N30, 000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia I., 38, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in a flea market business. She sells to the general public and tourists 6 days per week. She has previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Itagia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase industrial machines, rollers, Samoan handbags, Kava bowls

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip A. is 38 years old. He is married with two kids, both in the junior high school. He is a retailer of ply wood, ceiling bottoms, nails, and sells under a shed in his local area. He buys his supplies in bulk from Asamankese in the Eastern Region, about 300kms away from where he lives with his family. Philip says he sells to the carpenters and the wood workers in his community. He is handicapped by low working capital since building material prices have gone up. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy a chainsaw machine. He believes this will enable him to make good income for his business. He needs to save enough money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy plywood, nail, etc.

loans.name: Bernardino Alonso

texts.es:
Bernardino, tiene 49 años  está casado con  la señora Maria López y juntos tienen dos hijos de los cuales ambos son dependientes de sus padres. El se dedica al cambio de monedas como por ejemplo (dólar, real, peso argentino, euro, etc.)
Bernardino se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de seis años, el comenta que tiene su puesto fijo en el centro de la ciudad frete mismo al banco nacional de fomento, el  cuenta con el respaldo  legal del directorio del banco nacional de fomento es decir una resolución para poder trabajar legalmente sin ningún tipo de inconveniente.
Bernardino, con sus ganancias de su trabajo aporta a los ingresos de la casa,  junto con su señora  hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.
Bernardino, comenta que tiene bastantes clientes. Es por ello que él desea adquirir mayor cantidad  de capital  para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes y así también obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Bernardino is 49 years old. He is married with Maria López and together they have two children, both of whom are dependent on their parents. He is a money changer, changing currencies such as dollar, real, peso argentino, euro, etc.) Bernardino has been in this business for more than six years. He says that he has a permanent locale downtown in front of the Banco Nacional de Fomento. He can count on the legal support of the management of the Banco Nacional de Fomento: he is able to work legally without encountering problems. Bernardino uses the income from his work to contribute to the household and together with his wife they pay the family's expenses. Bernardino says that he has plenty of customers. Because of this, he wants to acquire a greater amount of capital to satisfy his existing customers' demands and gain new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua D. is 60 years old. She is widowed and has four children, two boys and two girls. She says all her children are mature and live independently. However, she lives with one of her children in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Akua is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Akua wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in business for barely a year and hopes to improve her living standard and give her grandchildren the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
También  trabaja como chofer de taxi en su pueblo.
 
Vive en la comunidad Chahuira Pampa, de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a sus hijos y esposa  quien le colabora en los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro y segundo vía KIVA la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Severo breeds cattle, whose milk he sells to Planta Industrializadota de Leche (PIL) Andina.

He also works as a taxi driver in his town.

He lives in the community Chahuira Pampa in the province of Omasuyos in the department of La Paz, which is located three hours from the city of La Paz.

He lives with his children and his wife, who works with him in doing the household chores and caring for the livestock.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow and increase milk production and, in turn, his income.

This is his second loan with IMPRO and his second with Kiva. The completed evaluation qualifies him to recieve the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow in order to increase his volume of milk production.

loans.name: Aufata

texts.en: Aufata Sipini, 47, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 3 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US $165).  SPBD loans are Aufata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies such as wheel barrow, spade, knives and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en:
L. Ngô Thị is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has two school-age children. L. owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,100,000 VND a month.

In 2000, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous L. was used to purchase breeding livestock. L. is now requesting a L. of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to build a shelter for her livestock. This L. will be her ninth L. from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. No. 812000421.

loans.use: To build a shelter for pigs

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from B. Jean Claude. This entrepreneur does his business in Gasabo district where he sells shoes. He has 6 years of experience in this business and has hired two employees to help him. Mr.B. earns $230 as monthly profit in his business and his wife produces a monthly income of $230. He starts his daily business at 6:00 am and finishes at 6:00 pm.

Mr. B. is a 27-year-old married man and he and his wife have four children, age 12, 10, 8 and 6 years old. He lives in Jali sector, Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. He is seeking his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company. With this loan he will buy two containers of shoes and he will reinvest his profit in the business.

loans.use: To buy two containers of shoes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and two children, a boy and a girl. Both are currently in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town called in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a teacher.

Rose trades in vegetables and spices. She sells onions, pepper, tomatoes, and other spices on a table top at the market square. She buys her goods in Kumasi and treks to other markets to sell. Rose has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.en:
Miroslava is a widow; she has two grown daughters. Miroslava sells women's underwear at one of markets in Ivano-Frankovsk. She started this business 10 years ago, after she became unemployed because of a downsizing at the factory she used to work at. During this time she was able to develop her business well. Today Miroslava has got two business locations. A large assortment and low prices help Miroslava to win new and retain old clients. This business is her only source of income.

Miroslava would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase 100 sets of women's underwear to increase her assortment. Miroslava needs to fix her apartment to have decent living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sets of underwear

loans.name: Grace Nduta

texts.en:
Grace N. is a 51-year-old lady who is married to Elijah Muigai N.. Together they have been blessed with five children, with four of the children still attending school.

Grace has been in the grocery business for the last two years and this business has been sustaining both her and her family. Since her business is situated in the open air market at Githurai, she is able to sell quite an amount of her stock each day and the money from those sales enable her to get fresh stock for the next day.  She gets her supplies directly from the farmers and she sells to others in wholesale and retail. Sometimes she does this business in other markets within Githurai and nearby towns like Thika. 

Grace was introduced to KADET through her church and she has been able to access and repay three loans without delay. This is her fourth loan, which she hopes will enable her buy and own a plot which she can build her own house and others for rental purposes. 

In future, she hopes to get enough land to start dairy and poultry farming to increase her income. Her current income is about 9,300 Kenyan shillings ($120 U.S.) per month.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a fruit and vegetable stand, and to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 40 year old married man and father of 3 children. He has owned a butcher shop since 2007 and has 15 years of experience in this field. Today, Khaled is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a new machine for his shop in order to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: To buy a new machine.

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es:
La señora María Irene S. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. 
Ella tiene ya más de 3 años dedicándose a la venta de artículos de papelería el cual es el ingreso de su familia, pero al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía ya que viene el regreso a clase y quiere tener suficiente variedad. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir. 
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo y así comprar la mercancía, para tener más ingreso a la familia y al negocio con el cual pagara esté crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María Irene S. already has four previous loans with FVP which were paid on time.

She has more than 3 years experience selling stationery in order to support her family. However, she lacks a wide variety of merchandise and wants to obtain more inventory in time for the new school year. She does not have the money at the moment to invest.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can bring in more income for her family. The additional revenue will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amor De Dios Group

texts.es: En el centro focal Cascada ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, hace más de cuatro años, se formo la asociación “Amor de Dios”, a la fecha esta integrada por doce personas. Las integrantes de este grupo tienen negocios independientes, por ejemplo, venta de dulces y galletas, venta de comida,venta de verduras, otras se dedican a la costura y también a la reparación de zapatos. Esta asociación necesita comprar  mayor cantidad de productos para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
In the Cascada community center, located in the city of El Alto, the group "Amor de Dios" was formed more than four years ago. To date, the group has 12 members who have independent businesses like selling sweets and cookies, food, and vegetables; others are seamstresses and shoe repairers. This group needs to buy goods in larger quantities to generate more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying goods

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Javier de Jesús P. T., tiene  54 años de edad, es casado y junto a su esposa tiene tres hijos mayores de edad. El señor Javier es dueño de un negocio de venta de medicamentos, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante. Don Javier dio inicio a su negocio hace 8 años, el dio inicio debido a que el tenia problemas pero un amigo lo ayudo para que pudiera establecer un negocio y mantenerse ocupado. Por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo .El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de medicamentos ampliar su zona de atención, y además vender en algunos buses en donde recurren bastantes clientes que viajan y aquí Javier encuentra la manera de ofrecer sus productos. El  sueño de Javier es mantenerse en el mercado, debido a que la competencia es bastante grande, además que desea invertir más para de esta manera y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sr. Javier de Jesús P. T. is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. He sells medicines as a traveling merchant and has been in business for 8 years. He had problems getting started, but a friend helped him establish his business and remain busy. Don Javier is a very responsible man who enjoys his work.

His loan will be used to purchase more medicines so that he can expand his sales territory. He plans to to offer his products to customers who travel into his community by bus. Javier dreams of maintaining his share of the market because the competition is fairly large. He hopes to invest more into his business so that he can generate additional earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more medicine

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero de Agosto” de distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en el centro poblado de Tasupa, ella estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, la señora también se ayuda con sus chacras.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros,  las reuniones y las charlas
texts.en:
Mrs. Catalina is a member of the "Primero de Agosto" (First of August) communal bank in the Zepita distict, in the province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, is married, and has 4 children. She lives in the Tasupa village. She completed primary school. Mrs. Catalina has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her original loan was for 300.00 Nuevos Soles, which allowed her to increase the capital of her sheep buying and selling business. Now she needs a new loan of 500.00 Nuevos soles, which will allow her to purchase sheep for fattening. Mrs. Catalina also helps with her small farm. Her greatest desire is to continue working. She likes savings, meetings and chats.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Restie

texts.en:
Restie C. sells dried fish in Corella, Bohol. He use a multicab to transport and sell his dried fish.

Restie is married to Michelle and they have only one child. He wants to make his business grow and help sustain his family.

Restie would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use it to buy more dried fish and to maintain the vehicle he uses for his business.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath T. is a villager in Angk Roneab village in Takeo. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for earning a living. Aside from this, she is also a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and food for them. She hopes to increase her income and improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Sun, helps her with her business. Mrs. Sambath T. has one child who is a laborer. Her husband is shown at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more piglets or breeding and food for them.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Z. is a 47-year-old single mother of one child. She lives in Mshomoroni in Mombasa and owns a retail shop in the same area. She sells an assortment of cereals and household products and has been in business for two years.

Mary joined KADET recently after getting information from a friend and is now borrowing her first loan. She plans to increase the stock of maize, beans and peas in her shop in order to meet the demand of her customers. 

Mary hopes that she will be able to buy a piece of land soon and put up a permanent residential house and business premise.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase cereals.

loans.name: Olguita

texts.es:
Olguita A. es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 43 años y es madre de 5 hijos( 2 mayores de edad). 
Olguita junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de pescado, para lo cual cuentan con un bote, con el que salen a pescar en el rìo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que le permitió invertir en la compra de alimentos, que le servirìan en los dìas de pesca por el rìo.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà una red de pescar. La meta de Olguita es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien implementda y progresar junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Olguita A. is an enterprising woman who lives in the district of Yarina Cocha in the region of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and is the mother of 5 children (2 of whom are of age). Olguita, along with her husband, dedicates herself to selling fish, so they have a boat with which they go out to fish in the river. She has been a part of the community bank "Madres Corajes" ["Courageous Mothers"] for a year. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which enabled her to invest in buying food that served them during the days they fished on the river. Currently, she needs a loan of 300 PEN with which she will buy a fishing net. Olguita's goal is to have a well-supplied grocery store and to progress with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fishing net

loans.name: Gretel Sal

texts.en:
Gretel Sal E. is from the village of Daang Lungsod. She is 39 years-old and unmarried. Gretel Sal owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products such as snacks and vegetables in the local community. Gretel Sal has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Gretel Sal joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gretel Sal has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Gretel Sal is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Gretel Sal from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Sakin

texts.en: Miss Sakin E. is 51 years old. She lives in Preak Svay Village of the Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land, which she uses to cultivate rice to support her family. She leads her family of five. One of her family members sells desserts, while the other four are farmers as well. Miss Sakin E. has a problem in her rice field because her field has infertile soil, and she does not have money to purchase fertilizer. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer in order to increase her rice yield this year.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito tiene la edad de 42 años, el tiene 2 hijos  y ambos está a su cargo.  Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Porque él tiene que buscar la forma de cómo llevar dinero suficiente a su hogar para sus 2 hijos, fue así que empezó por cuenta propia y compro 2 terneros para venderlos a un precio accesible así fue que con el paso del tiempo logro obtener este medio vida . Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que es la compra de ganado. El deseo de José es obtener otro negocio como es una  distribuidora.
texts.en:
José Benito, 42, has two children under his care. He has been a cattleman for over 15 years. Because he has to find ways to earn money to support his household and his two children, he started on his own initiative and bought two calves to sell at a reasonable price. This is how, as time went by, he fashioned a way of life for himself. He calls upon Fundación León 2000, whose sister organizations offer help, and asks for funding to buy cattle. José's desire is to acquire another business, perhaps a distributorship.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Geraldino

texts.en: Geraldino is sixty-three years old and lives in his own house with his wife, who helps him with his business. The couple has two children together.  Geraldino opened his business more than seven years ago because he saw that the area needed a corner store. Since then, his business has been very successful because of his comprehensive product offerings and the good service he provides. Geraldino works hard every day to do the best he can for his family, and, in addition to running the corner store, he buys and sells cattle with his son's help in order to augment his income. He is seeking this loan to purchase more merchandise for his store so he can meet his clients' needs.

loans.use: Purchase merchendise for sale in his corner store

loans.name: Celia Carlota

texts.es: Doña Celia de 47 años de edad, casada y tiene 7 hijos, 4 de ellos estan en edad escolar, Doña Celia tiene 7 años de tener una tortilleria, aparte de esto ella tiene terrenos con plantacion de café, ella solicita crédito para la compra de plantillas de café para llenar por completo el terreno de café, comprar abono y maíz. Sueña con exportar su café.
texts.en:
Celia is 47 years old. She is married with seven children; four of whom are school-aged. Celia has had a tortilla bakery for seven years. She also has some land where she raises coffee. She is requesting this loan in order to buy fertilizer and corn. She hopes to someday be able to export her coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Burkhon

texts.en: Burkhon M. is married with five children. His wife is a teacher at a well-known religious middle school. Burkhon has a business of selling women's clothing and towels. He starts his work day in the early hours of the morning by receiving vendors, verifying orders and checking the quality of the products. He is very demanding when it comes to the merchandise he will sell as he does not want his clients to receive defective or unsuitable products. During the day Burkhon receives several orders and attends to his business. His children help their father in their spare time. He wants to instill in them a work ethic from a young age. Burkhon also helps them with their homework as he knows that the most important thing in this stage of their life is an education. This man loves his family and wishes all the best for them; he is a responsible father and a dedicated husband. Burkhon wants to keep succeeding in his business by expanding his stock. He wants to stock a greater variety of products so that his clients do not have to go to other businesses to buy what he does not have in stock. That is the reason that he applied to IMON for a loan of 4800 Somoni. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say P., 37, has earned her living as a sewing laborer in industry since she was single. With much experience she is able to earn a salary of over $100 per month to solve the living problems of her family.

Always, Say P. depends on the revenue that comes from her husband’s job as a building worker. This couple is blessed to have three school-aged kids, who are dependent on their cash. The current proceeds of Say P. and her husband are not enough to meet the entire family’s expenses.

Say P. wants to invest in a new business and she is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle with a connected trailer as equipment to sell sugar cane juice.

Say P., her husband, and their son are pictured, and they hope the loan will provide them with additional profit.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle with a trailer connected.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Palmapampa, donde tienen su casa propia.

Para él la vida es un regalo, ya que le brinda muchas oportunidades y ahora es agricultor exitoso, a pesar de los problemas ocasionados por el terrorismo en esa zona. Él sacó fuerzas para darle buen rumbo a su familia, es por ello que ahora se dedica por entero al cultivo de cacao, con el que le está yendo muy bien y se siente contento con el trabajo que está realizando. 
Regularmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero por lo general, en temporadas de cosecha, tiene a cargo algunos peones para que le puedan agilizar la extracción de su producto.
Para el futuro anhela extender su chacra, con el propósito de que produzca en grandes volúmenes y mejor calidad.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece la confianza que le está otorgando su grupo comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el mantenimiento continuo de sus plantaciones de cacao, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad  de su producto agrícola.
texts.en:
Hernan is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho, located in the town of Palmapampa, where they have their own home. To him, life is a gift, as it has offered him many opportunities. He is now a successful farmer, despite the problems caused by terrorism in the area. He finds strength in providing for his family, which is why he is now devoted entirely to the cultivation of cocoa. The cocoa is is selling very well and he is happy with the results. He regularly gets help from his family, although during the harvest seasons, he usually hires some men so they can expedite the process. In the future, he hopes to expand his farm, with the aim of producing better quality and larger volumes. This is his first loan with MFP and he is committed to fully comply with the payments. He appreciates the trust granted to him and the communal group. The money requested will be used for the ongoing maintenance of the cocoa plantations, in order to improve the quality of the product.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of the plantations

loans.name: Mrs. Sinou Hou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up this village bank loan and they are all living in Spean Daek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sinou H. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sinou H. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land on which she grows rice and vegetables to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it is a long way from the irrigation system. So, to improve production, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

Mrs. Sinou H.’s husband, Mr. Oran Orat, is a fisherman and they have a child who is helping her with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector San José del caserío Hornitos, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población agrupada en pequeños caseríos que distan mucho uno del otro. El distrito pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Suele dedicarse a la comercialización de verduras desde hace mas de dos años, el compra verduras a los agricultores de la zona y las vende en la ciudad de Piura. Cuando la verdura escasea, se dedica al comercio de leña: el extrae leña del zapote, un arbol que crece en el distrito de Olmos, para venderla a los procesadores de yeso que utilizan la leña de este arbol para quemar el mineral antes de refinarlo.

Esta actividad siempre le genera ingresos, ya que en Mórrope se exrae yeso durante todo el año. José extrae su producto en base a diversos pedidos los cuales han venido aumentando en los ultimos meses, por este motivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas leña.

José es un padre que siempre vela por el bienestar se su familia, su mayor anhelo es verlos progresar poco a poco, hace poco construyó su casa propia y eso lo llena de orgullo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de cancelar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the San José sector of the village of Hornitos, a rural area in the district of Mórrope. The district is known for having the majority of its population clustered in small villages that are distant from one another. It is situated in Lambayeque Province and located an hour and fifteen minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

José has been selling vegetables for more than two years. He buys his products from local farmers and sells them in the city of Piura. When vegetables are scarce, he sells firewood. The wood is extracted from sapodilla trees that grow in Olmos district and sold to gypsum processors for use in refining.

This business always generates income since gypsum mining takes place in Mórrope throughout the entire year. José purchases his product based on his orders which have been increasing in recent months. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can invest in the purchase of more firewood.

José is a father who always looks out for the welfare of his family. His greatest wish is to see them gradually make progress. He recently built a house and is now full of pride. José previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated that he is prompt and responsible when submitting his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia S. is from the village of San Jose. She is 44 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Emilia owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month. In 2006, Emilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her twelfth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Estarlita

texts.en:
Estarlita S. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Estarlita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Estarlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Estarlita has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Estarlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estarlita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Estarlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aminata Djiby

texts.fr:
Aminata Djiby D. est âgée de 22 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOYINGUEL depuis le 16 octobre 2007. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à plus de 5 fois.

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Avec son crédit elle va acheter une paire de bœufs et l'engraisser pendant au moins 5 mois avant de la revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone. 

Elle participe financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Aminata Djiby D. is 22-years old. She is married and the mother of two children in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BOYINGUEL since October 16, 2007. She has had good experiences with credit loans, having used them on more than five occasions. She fattens cattle, and plans to use her loan to buy a pair of oxen, fatten them for at least five months, and resell them at the local weekly markets. She is contributing to the improvement of her family’s living conditions while increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase different kinds of sanitary products etc. for resale

loans.name: Shirley Eneida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Shirley;  ella tiene 21 años de edad y es conviviente y  tiene 1 Hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de empleada, ella trabaja limpiando en un hotel, lleva trabajando en este hotel desde hace 1 año y le esta yendo muy bien. Ella hace la limpieza de todo el pequeño hotel, La socia ahora quiere invertir en viajar a desahuadero a traer ropa para vender de forma ambulatoriamente a sus amigas y gente conocida, ella llevara este negocio de manera paralela al que tiene. La socia  solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Shirley belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" ("We Go Together") community bank and lives in the community of Arcopata, district of Santiago, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 21 years old, lives with her partner and has one son. She has made a living working cleaning a hotel for the past year, and it has gone very well.
