She does the cleaning for all of the small hotel. She now wants to invest in traveling to Desahuadero to bring back clothes she can sell to her friends and acquaintances. She will carry out this business along with her current job. She is requesting the loan to purchase the clothing. She is grateful to those who help her reach her dreams through these means and promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S. is widowed and lives with her three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country.

S. sells soy sauce and vegetables for a gross income of USD 20 per day. She is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more soy sauce and dried vegetables to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more soy sauce and dried vegetables to resell

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 32-year old married man from Lebanon. He has 3 young children. He has almost ten years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2003 cultivating all types of vegetables and potatoes. He also uses plastic tents to grow his products. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work and seeds for the coming season. In the coming years, he hopes to continue the expansion of his business because his work is vital for his family.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work and seeds for the coming season

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, Maria tiene un pequeño cafetín en un local comercial, vende hamburguesas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria, Maria también vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria y solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de perfumes.
Maria sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is in a common law marriage and has three children. She has a small food stand in a commercial location where she sells hamburgers and drinks. Maria manages her business every day as a street vendor. She also sells cosmetics through catalogs and offers these products to her friends and relatives.

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary) and requests a loan of 1500 PEN in order to buy perfumes. She dreams of improving her business and seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes

loans.name: Shirin's Group

texts.en: Shirin M. is the leader of the group. She is 48 and divorced. She has two daughters: The elder one is an operator, while the younger is an accountant. The family has their own shop called “For You” and Shirin’s brother helps to run the business. Last year, her mother presented her with a cow, which was further fattened and resold. Out of the profits, she managed to open the shop. The loan purpose is to purchase a milk cow in order to sell dairy products in the shop. Shirin cherishes a dream to arrange her daughters’ weddings. Oksana U. 25, is divorced. She is bringing up two children alone: The daughter is a school girl, while the son is a toddler. The mother earns her livelihood by working as the operator in the “Abdysh-Ata” company. Three years ago, her mother-in-law presented her with a cow, and since that time, she has been breeding cattle. Out of the profits, she could afford to obtain furniture and household appliances. The loan purpose is to buy four animals for fattening until next year, then out of the resale profits, she is planning to purchase new furniture. In the future, her aim is to obtain a flat in Kant city. Roza C., 45, is married. She is the treasurer of the group. Her spouse is a cattle-farm worker. The couple has four children: The eldest daughter raises money by working as a saleswoman in a shop, another two are students and the youngest one is a schoolboy. Roza has work as a saleswoman in the shop “Exclusive.” Besides that, the family is engaged in cattle breeding. Earnings made it possible to give a university education to the children. The loan purpose is to purchase three calves. In the future, Roza wants to make shop repairs. Abdyrashid D., 25, is divorced. He has a profession of being the investigator in the District Department of Inner Affairs. On his salary, he has managed to purchase a crusher and a saw. The loan purpose is to obtain two calves for their further fattening. In the future, Abdyrashid is planning to purchase an automobile and also to remarry. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Patricia Lorena

texts.es:
Patricia Lorena S. G. tiene 22 años. Vive en Union Libre  vive con los hijos y el compañero, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Patricia Lorena pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Patricia Lorena se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita  el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es hacer una casa, seguir en la agricultura.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Patricia Lorena S. G. is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with her companion and her children in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. She has two children.

Patricia Lorena is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Patricia Lorena is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. She purchases her supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in her community. Patricia Lorena is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of her family. Her dreams include building a house and continuing with her farming activities.

Patricia Lorena enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo lives in the village of San Pedrillo in the district of Tambogrande, a tropical region in which the majority of the population manages small fruit plantations and raises animals. Maximo owns his home and shares it with his wife and their two children. They maintain a stable and happy home.

The family owns approximately one and three-quarters hectares of land on which they grow mangos and limes. They manage to harvest ten baskets of limes off the property each week, which they sell to local fruit companies. In addition, they have one milk cow and a small herd of sheep which they raise for their meat and sell in the local market. 

Maximo plans to use this loan to purchase additional feed for his animals and fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. He expects that these purchases will increase the family’s productivity. It is his dream that his children become professionals and receive a good education. For this reason, he works hard every day in order to improve his family’s income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for his animals and fertilizer and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 40 years old. She is married to a taxi driver. They have two children who are between the ages of ten and sixteen. 

Vestine sells vegetables and she has been in business for twenty years. She would like to get a loan to buy more vegetables to sell, and with the profit she plans to build a house. She would very much like to do well and become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Berta Isabel

texts.es: Berta Isabel O. de 50 años de edad, posee su propio negocio en el cual se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tostadas de yuca, chicharrón y plátanos, los cuales son un tipo de golosina artesanal muy típica de esta región. Ella vive junto a su familia la cual es muy grande y esta conformada por su hijo, nuera, dos nietos, dos sobrinos y su madre, Berta trabaja para poder sostenerse a su madre y para sus gastos personales. Berta comercializa su producto de forma ambulante por diferentes lugares del departamento de San Salvador, mismo departamento en el cual reside. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: yuca, plátanos y chicharrones para elaborar las golosinas y de esta forma brindarle a sus clientes más productos.
texts.en: Berta Isabel O. is 50 years old. She has her own business making and selling prepared foods made from yucca, pork rinds, and bananas. They are traditional snack foods that are very common in the region. She lives together with her very large family. Her family is made up of her son and his wife, their two children, two nephews and her mother. Berta works in order to support herself and her mother, providing for personal expenses. Berta sells her products in various locales in the region of San Salvador, the same neighborhood where she lives. She requests a loan in order to purchase ingredients in wholesale, such as: yucca, bananas, and pork rinds. She will be able to make greater quantities of her products and be able to sell more to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es: José Ricardo D. M. de 24 años de edad, reside en El Calvario, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, el es un joven muy responsable, quien le ayuda a su madre con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos dos viven juntos, por lo que se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante. José posee un salón de belleza en su casa de habitación, él posee cinco años de experiencia, tiempo en el que ha ido obteniendo clientes fieles gracias a su excelente trabajo y servicio brindando. José solicita un préstamo ya que cuenta con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos profesionales para el cuidado del cabello, así mismo cremas para cuerpo y rostro y otros tipos de tratamiento para el cuidado de la imagen de las personas. José sueña con poseer un negocio aún más surtido en donde posea la capacidad para atender más clientes.
texts.en:
José Ricardo D. M., age 24, lives in El Calvario in the Usulután department.  He is a very responsible young man who helps his mother with the household expenses.  They live together and mutually support each other in order to get ahead.

José has a beauty salon at his house, and he has five years of experience.  During that time he has acquired loyal customers thanks to his excellent work and the service he provides.

José is requesting a loan because his wishes to improve his business conditions.  He will buy a greater quantity of professional  hair care products.  He will also buy body and face creams and other types of treatments for taking care of a person’s appearance.

José dreams of having a business that is even better stocked where he has the capacity to take care of more customers.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Lodilen

texts.en:
Lodilen B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 33 years old. Lodilen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lodilen owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Lodilen has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lodilen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lodilen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lodilen is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & use as working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lodilen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Juan Irene

texts.es: Juan Irene tiene 43 años, su actividad es la venta y destace de cerdo. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este medio de vida, dio inicio a este negocio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja a nuestro país, además que él era trabajador del campo y los trabajos de ese rubro cada día se vuelven más escasos. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de cerdos y vacas, el sale a buscar estos productos a las diferentes zonas de comarca. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una pulpería grande en su casa de habitación, y algún día dejarle algo bueno a sus hijos con lo cual puedan mantenerse.
texts.en:
Juan Irene is 43 years old.  His business is butchering and selling pigs, and he has been in this business for more than 10 years.  He started his business as he was faced with the lack of work that afflicts our country.  He was an agricultural worker and jobs in this field are becoming increasingly scarce.

Juan Irene would like to invest this loan in buying pigs and cows.  He goes to find these products in different areas of the region.  His dream has always been to have a large grocery store in his home and to be able, some day, to leave something good to his children with which they will be able to support themselves.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 49, has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and employs four casual laborers. He also runs a laundry business in Murang'a town in central Kenya. He is the divorced father of three children who are all adults. 

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes. The proceeds from this project will enable him to improve his family's livelihood. He plans to expand his businesses in future and, if possible, to export his products to other markets.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is 40 years old from Migori town. She is married to Elisha and they have two children who are in school. She has a business of selling delicacies locally known as "Kaimati" (sweet dumplings). People like them for breakfast and they take them with tea. 

Agnes is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy baking flour and cooking oil to add to her stock. She earns a monthly income of about $250. She is hopeful that the loan will boost her business. Her dream is to be able to open a big hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking flour and oil.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating wood lamination and food vending businesses. Her husband Lemuel, who is 39 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 5 and 12 years old. Teofila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teofila has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her second  loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy raw materials for wood lamination so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and expansion of business. Teofila is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for wood lamination

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio, de 40 años natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es un hombre muy trabajador, convive con Valentina de 45 años y fruto de su relación tienen 02 hijos, Ronald de 18 años y Roel de 16 años de edad;  juntos viven en su propia casa, distrito de Quimbiri. Lucio es  el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a remover la tierra y hoy es todo un conocedor de la ardua labor en el agro; es campesino y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno cultivado con café, cacao y hojas de coca. Viene removiendo la tierra hace 21 años en sus propias parcelas, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y  peones quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta los puntos de secado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su comunidad Quimbiri Alto hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en los distritos de Quimbiri y San Francisco; lugares donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará maderas para renovar la fachada de su vivienda y así cambiar la madera desgastada por madera nueva. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es cultivar café por tener mayor demanda en los mercados extranjeros. Este es su primer crédito de Lucio con MFP, esta dispuesto cumplir con sus respectivos pagos ya que desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. A la vez se siente muy agradecido con la institución por  asignarle el préstamo. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará tablones para renovar la madera desgastada por nuevas y así mejorar la fachada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucio, age 40, is a native of the city of Quimbiri. This hardworking gentleman is in a common law marriage with Valentina, age 45, and they have two children, Ronald (age 18) and Roel (age 16). They live in their own home in the District of Quimbiri. Lucio is the breadwinner of the family. As a young boy, his parents taught him how to plow the soil and now he knows about the hard work that is required for farming. He has four hectares of land on which he grows coffee, cacao, and coca leaves. Lucio has been cultivating his own land for 21 years and receives assistance from his children during harvest time. He also hires workers who are in charge of picking and drying the crops. What he enjoys most about his job is harvesting his crops because he feels that producing quality output is his reward for months of hard work. He considers the most difficult part to be transporting his products from the community of Quimbiri Alto to the collection centers in the Districts of Quimbiri and San Francisco. These places offer the best prices for his products. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood to remodel the façade of his house by replacing the planks that have deteriorated with new ones. Now his highest priority is to cultivate coffee since there is greater demand from foreign markets.

This is Lucio’s first loan with MFP and he is willing to complete his payments so that he can access subsequent loans. He is grateful that the institution has approved this loan. With the 2500 PEN he requested, Lucio will purchase wooden planks to replace the ones that have deteriorated and improve the façade of his house.

loans.use: To purchase wooden planks to remodel the façade of his house.

loans.name: Tarapaca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TARAPACA” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Mercedes.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos:tienda, venta de comida, taxi, trabajo de construcción, tejidos de mantas, venta de verduras, costura.

La señora Mercedes, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que participa hace una año en Pro Mujer. Ella cuenta que se integro a la institución por la invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que ha iniciado por iniciativa propia. Es por esta razón que el crédito que sacará es para la compra artículos para su tienda (sardinas, panes, fideos, etc.). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con las señoras.
texts.en:
The “TARAPACA” communal association is made up of eight women and is a part of Pro Mujer (Professional Woman) in the Senkata office.  Mercedes is the president and the women are involved in a number of businesses including running a store, selling food, driving a taxi, construction, making blankets, vegetable sales and sewing.

Mercedes says that she has been with Pro Mujer for one year and joined after being invited by a friend.  Now she has a neighborhood store that she started on her own.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise (sardines, bread, noodles, etc).  This type of work allows her to earn an income and support her family.  She is married and has two children.  She says that she likes to share with her fellow Pro Mujer members.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Angelina Maivasse

texts.pt:
Angelina Maivasse B. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique solteira mãe de 1 filho de 8 anos idade,  vai a Escola. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem de seu filho.

Nunca sai da sua cidade natal, tem um negocio proprio de venda de frangos ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu Quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construcao (cimentos, chapas, barrotes e outros) para continuidade da sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para ampliar a sua banca e concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Angelina Maivasse B. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in the south of Mozambique. She is a single mother of an 8-year-old son who attends school. She completed 10th grade but didn't continue attending school due to her financial circumstances. 

She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone besides her son. She's never left her native city, and she has had her own business selling chickens for over ten years. She does not have employees and has monthly earnings of 4,000 meticais. She uses these for household expenses, while managing to save a portion in her bank account. 

She has never taken loans from other banks, and learned of Hluvuku through her neighbor who is a client of this institution. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku. The amount of the loan is 20,000 meticais, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials (cement, sheet metal, beams, and other items) to continue her construction project. She is committed to repaying on time in order to obtain other loans in the future. She plans to request new loans to expand her sales stand.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sheet metal, beams, and other items).

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with 3 children. She is 49 years old and has had a sari-sari business for 3 years. Alicia sells items like oil, dried fish, and sugar to the people in her community. She usually earns 12,000 PHP per month from her business.

Alicia is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods.  In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods

loans.name: Asgalali

texts.en:
Asgalali is 48 years old, married and has three children, all of whom help on his farm when not studying in school. He works hard to improve his family's living conditions but faces hardships in the winter when his fields are largely dormant. He learned farming from his parents and is applying for this loan to improve his farm by buying fertilizer and other materials. He believes this will help him improve his crop and earn a larger income.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and farm equipment.

loans.name: Liezle

texts.en: Liezle is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Liezle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Liezle is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Liezle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ana Viviana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 27 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 12, 8 y 4 años de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Está  en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios,  es la fiscal de pagos del banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a personas como ella para sacar adelante sus negocios y su vida.

Es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  También se dedica a la elaboración y venta de harina de pescado. Trabaja todos los  días de la semana en ambas actividades, nos cuenta que ella se desplaza a Manta para comprar la parte del pescado que no se utilizan para fabricar el atún, para luego trasladarlos hasta su casa y procesarlos para hacer la harina de pescado, la misma que luego entrega a comerciantes que la exportan al extranjero. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a ultilizar en sus dos negosios, una parte para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y otra parte para comprar pescado para elaborar la harina.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan un buen porvenir.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Rosario Community Bank meets every 15 days in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized nationally and worldwide. In this town, the majority of the residents make buttons out of tagua nuts and handicrafts, as well as participate in general commerce.

Here we meet Ana. She is 27 years old, a single mother with three children who are 12, eight, and four years old. The older ones go to school and the youngest is in preschool. She live in her parents' home. She has been with the community bank since it started. She is in charge of making payments to the bank, and she likes the organization for the help that it gives people like her to succeed in their businesses and in life.

She is a very good mother who never lets her children lack anything. She sells Yanbal products (beauty, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She also makes and sells fish flour ***. She works every day of the week doing both businesses. She tells us that she travels to Manta to purchase the part of the fish that they don't use for making tuna, and then she takes it back home and processes it to make fish flour, which she delivers to merchants to export. She has been doing this for eight years, and it has gone well.

She will use this loan for both her businesses. One part for buying perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry, and the other part for buying fish to turn into flour.

Her dream is that her children will have a good future.

***Fish flour (harina de pescado) is a high-energy feed for a variety of farm animals. It is rich in proteins and amino acids.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and fish

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 38 años, casada con Julián de 40 años con quien tiene 4 hijos quienes viven en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Edith recuerda que se inició en las labores agrícolas, aún desde muy niña estando en la chacra de sus  padres, comenzó la  mayor parte de su tiempo sembrando y cosechando los productos como cacao y café, es donde ella vio una oportunidad de que el producto de cacao tenía una  gran demanda, es por ello que empezó a realizar sus propias plantaciones luego a independizarse de sus padres, no sin antes les agradece eternamente por las lecciones de aprendizaje que la inculcaron. En el presente produce en grandes volúmenes, por ende le otorga buena rentabilidad, para ello trata de cuidar su fuente principal ante cualquier plaga que se le aparezca, y normalmente recibe la ayuda  de su pareja, pero en temporadas de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones para que le puedan facilitar la extracción de su producto de manera eficiente y eficaz. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y de esta manera podrá garantizarse para poder realizar prestamos venideros. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles ella invertirá en la poda de su cacao. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y de esta manera podrá garantizarse para poder realizar prestamos venideros. Ella esta feliz por el mejor desempeño en su banco comunal ya que todos son solidarios. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles ella invertirá en la poda de sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Edith is 38 years old and married to 40 year-old Julián.  The couple have four children and live in Puerto Mayo community, in Pichari district.  Edith remembers that she started out farming when she was still a girl, on her parents' farm.  She spent most of her time sowing and harvesting products such as cacao and coffee.  Edith saw an opportunity.  She saw that cacao was in great demand and so started setting out her own plantations.  She then started farming independently from her parents after having thanked them profusely for the training that they had given her.

Edith currently produces cacao in large volumes which provides her with a good profitability.  For this reason, she tries to protect her main source of income from any pests that appear and she normally receives help from her partner.  However, during harvest season, she needs help from laborers who make it easier for her to pick her produce efficiently and effectively. 

This is Edith's second loan from MFP.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments so that she can ensure she is able to take out further loans in the future.  She will invest her 1,000 Peruvian soles in having her cacao plants pruned.  Edith is happy to be a member of her community bank because all the members are very supportive of each other.

loans.use: to hire laborers to prune and weed her cacao plants

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is 29 years old and lives in San Gabriel in northern Ecuador. He is divorced and lives with his mother. He has a 4-year-old son with his former spouse. Edison is a calm, peaceful, responsible and enterprising person with dreams of further growth. He will invest this loan in the purchase of tires and maintenance for the bus he owns. His business is bus transportation. 

Edison began working as a bus driver and purchased his own bus eight years ago. He works with the help of an assistant who collects payments from passengers and Edison drives. This is his first loan and he believes it will be a great help for his service. He wants it to be more efficient so that his clients will be satisfied. He hopes it will improve his economic position and give his family an improved quality of life. 

Edison’s dream is to have another bus, increase his income and give the best he can to his son so that he can study and be a good professional in the future. He believes this is possible through the economic support from his loan and that his path is “always illuminated by the hand of God.”

loans.use: to purchase tires and maintain his bus

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 25 years old, married and blessed with three children ages five, three and one year old.  She keeps livestock and has been in the business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD.  This is her second loan and she hopes to use the amount to purchase one dairy cow. 

The anticipated profits will be used to improve the welfare of her family and to improve the farm.  She hopes to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married and who has eight children. He has been a farmer for the past eight years, having learned rice farming from his parents. 

He will use the Kiva loan to help pay for labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and finally in harvesting activities. 

With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will increase his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 27 años y vive en unión libre; ella trabaja 10 horas diarias de lunes a viernes en una Maquiladora. Ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar un empleo que le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos y con lo que el ganaba no les alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, su esposo también trabaja 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora; hace tres años la Sra. Flor adquirió una vivienda de interés social misma que es la que ellos están habitando, en épocas calor esta casa es muy caliente y en épocas de frio se siento mucho la humedad que hasta se penetra en sus ropas y en lluvias se trasmina el agua por las paredes, ella necesita ser apoyada para impermeabilizar su vivienda y así poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 27 years old, and lives in a civil union.  She works ten hours a day from Monday through Friday in a factory.  She saw the need to look for work to allow her to help her partner with the household expenses.  

Three years ago, Señora Flor acquired a publicly subsidized house, which is where they live.  During the hot season, it is very hot, and during the cold season there is so much humidity that it penetrates their clothes, and when it rains, the water seeps through the walls.  She needs to be helped to weather-proof her home, and so be able to provide her family with a better quality of life..

loans.use: to weather-proof her home.

loans.name: Teresa Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Teresa, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 14 años  los mismos que estudian en colegio, los mayores ya son profesionales y todos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es mecánico industrial.

Nuestra amiga para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa ya que muchos de sus clientes la visitan cuando necesitan una prenda de vestir. Trabaja tres o cuatro  días a la semana, deja a crédito  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Quito cada vez que necesite. Tiene más de 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido  muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal 8 años  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. 

Sus sueños es ver que todos sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Province of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the 8th of December Communal Bank get together every fifteen days. In this place we meet Teresa, 43 years old, married and from this relationship they have four children, two adults and the other two are 17 and 14 years old, and are studying at school. The older children are professionals and all of them live with her. Her husband is an industrial mechanic.

In order to earn her own money our friend sells all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door and also from her home and many of her clients visit her when they need something to wear. She works 3 or 4 days a week, granting the customers credit, which they pay on the weekend. Whenever necessary she goes to Quito to replenish her supply. She has been doing this for more than 18 years and she has done very well and has many clients.

The loan she receives will be used to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 8 years and she likes it because the group is so united.

Her dream is to see that all her children finish their education and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Yeng, 34, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Yeng produces plastic mats to sell, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 44 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. Yeng is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more plastic to produce mats. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more plastic to produce mats

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Абдували житель района Хамадони. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он десять лет как занимается изготовлением окон и дверей. Кредит берет для покупки сырья, то есть досок и стекла.
texts.en: Abduvali is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  He is 45 years old, married and has two children.  He has been involved in making windows and doors for ten years.  Abduvali is requesting this loan for the purchase of raw materials, i.e. wood panels and glass.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alexander; el tiene 29 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de taxi, el es propietario de un carro que hace servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere salir adelante, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi que brinda al público en general. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “HATUN RUMIYOC”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Sr. Alexander. He is 29 years old and single. The member divides his time between daily activities and his taxi service business. He owns a car which he uses as a taxi. The member works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. The member wants to get ahead by means of this work. The member wants to improve his taxi service which he offers to the public in general. The member is asking for a loan to pay for the maintenance of his car and buy spare parts.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to make the repayments.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance on his car and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Kargbo Group

texts.en:
Memuna is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has 4 children - 2 in secondary school and 2 in primary school. Memuna sells charcoal and firewood.  She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. 

With the help of this loan, she and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Memuna will use her share of the loan (SLL 700,000) to buy bags of charcoal and piles of firewood to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and piles of firewood to add to her business.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 4 y un año de edad; Víctor se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 15 años de estar cultivando maíz y frijol, este oficio le ha permitido tener los ingresos necesarios para su familia, ya que las cosechas cuando son abundantes, logra dividir una parte para alimentación familiar y otra para vender.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, para aplicarlos en la milpa, con los fondos de este préstamo podrá comprar los insumos y poder aplicar en el cultivo para tener una buena y sana cosecha.
El propósito de Víctor es trabajar por su familia, sacando sus hijos adelante y en un futuro poderlos preparar académicamente.
texts.en:
Víctor lives with his wife and two children who are 4 years and one year old. Víctor works in agriculture. For 15 years he has been growing corn and beans. This work has permitted him to have the necessary income for his family, as when the crops are abundant, he is able to share a part with his family for food and other purchases.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and herbicides in order to use them in the corn fields, and with the money from this loan he can buy supplies and be able to apply it in the crops in order to have a good and healthy harvest.

Víctor’s goal is to provide for his family, pushing his children forward towards an academic future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 63 years old and is married with four children. He is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. Virgilio has been engaged in fishing for quite some time now and is able to provide for his family's needs through fishing. He works hard to feed his family three times a day and keep them healthy.

Virgilio is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps, and rice. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps, and rice

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who describes herself as ambitious, has run a retail shop for two years. The business faces a challenge in that it is constantly necessary to increase the stock of goods. Jane will be using the loan Kes 20,000 to add inventory to her store. She looks forward to expanding the business in the next five years.

Jane is married and has a one-year-old baby daughter.

loans.use: to add inventory to her store

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Tita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Tita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Tita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Solema

texts.en:
Solema is 52 years of age, married, and has five children.

Solema runs a plantation business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business.  Solema needs a loan of WST $2,400 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and machetes.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Solema joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Solema's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Aren

texts.es: A sus 36 años de edad, el señor Aren se dedica a cultivar en su finca arveja y papa capira con la ayuda de su esposa para luego venderla a legumbrerias del municipio de Sonson ubicado al norte de Antioquia. Esta actividad, el señor Aren la aprendió desde muy corta edad cuando le ayudaba a su padre en las labores del campo. Debido a la ola invernal que se ha presentado, los cultivos del señor Aren se han deteriorado y disminuido producción, por lo que requiere de la compra de abonos e insumos con los cuales el señor Aren puede hacerles mantenimiento, recuperarlos, mejorar su calidad y así mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
At 36 years of age, Sr. Aren has a farm where he grows peas and capira potatoes with the help of his wife. They sell these legumes in the town of Sonson, which is to the north of Antioquia. Sr. Aren learned this business at a very young age by helping his father with the farm work. As a result of the cold weather that has arrived, his crops have deteriorated and decreased in production.

He needs to buy compost and farming supplies so that he can maintain his crops and enable them to recover and improve in quality. This will help improve his income and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 20 to 36 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of buying cereals. She will use the loan to purchase more cereals. Her business goal is to run another cereal retail stall within five years.

loans.use: To buy more cereals.

loans.name: 5044-0090007296 Group

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of  hard working women. Esther is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Esther has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables for resale, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay for rent for her business. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to support her family's basic needs.

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has three children ages seven, nine, and twelve. All are school-going children. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to be fostered.  

In 2010, Ibrahim established his business selling school bags, travelling bags, travelling boxes, hangers, and similar products. He began his business after he dropped out of school because of the death of his father. As he lacked financial support, he joined his elder sister in her business. His friend later supplied him with some stock to be sold. The commission he received was used to start his own business.

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,050,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy school bags, travelling bags and travelling boxes. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to open a shop, build a house and educate his children and younger brothers.  This loan will help him to achieve some of his future plans. Shortage of stock from suppliers is his major challenge. He is a hardworking and committed businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more suitcases

loans.name: Niêm

texts.en:
Niêm operates a fishing business. 

Niêm is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents. 
This is Niêm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Niêm hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is separated and has one son. He had the opportunity to study a technical career in electronics. When he divorced from his wife, he had to care for his son and could not find a job. He thought, and decided to open his own business doing what he knew how to do. 10 years ago he started the business of repairing machines like televisions and washing machines, etc. Since he didn't have to make a large investment, it seemed at that moment sensible to open his business at home, and quickly soon after he had more and more clients. Now his business has grown and is growing, and as a result he needs to have a stock of pieces and spare parts to repair the equipment that people bring to him. For this reason he is requesting a loan of US $750 which he offers to pay back in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Rodrigo esta separado y tiene un hijo. Tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera técnica en electrónica, al separarse de su esposa quedó a cargo de su único hijo y como no conseguía empleo, pensó y decidió en abrir su propio negocio en lo que sabía hacer y fue eso lo que hizo, hace 10 años atrás empezó en el negocio de reparación de televisores, lavadoras, refrigeradoras, etc. Como no tenía que hacer mucha inversión le fue en su momento sencillo abrir su taller en su propia casa y de ahí en adelante fue teniendo muchos clientes. Ahora como su negocio a mejorado el necesita obtener un stock de piezas y refacciones para los equipos que le lleven a reparar, por ello esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 750 que promete pagarlos en 6 meses.

loans.use: To purchase pieces and spare parts

loans.name: Asli

texts.en: Asli G. owns a small market in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Asli is looking for funding so that she can increase the diversity of her inventory as well as make some minor repairs to her store.

loans.use: To increase the diversity of her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: adding more stock from the main fish market in Kenya

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is 37 years old, married with five children and lives in a  semi-urban area of Benin City. She spent six months learning her trade and how to run a business at other companies before opening her own shop in 1998. She is seeking a loan to acquire more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu J. is thirty three years old and married with five children.  Married at an early age, Ramatu was forced start a business to meet family expenses when her husband was unemployed.  She now owns a small stall and sells peanut butter, chicken stock, onions, and chili pepper.  Her husband also assists her in managing the business.  She is requesting a loan of $200 to expand her business.

loans.use: Expansion of her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel C. is Mrs. Rosalina Simbine's partner, a member of the Vonkala group. Rosalina Simbine was a member of the Mondlane group but she encountered a few problems there. She then left that group and formed a new group. She now sells bags of charcoal and Mrs. Isabel sells a variety of goods such as: beverages, eggs, yogurt, cookies, etc. These products are purchased in Swaziland and are delivered to the Estrela de Maputo market.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Isabel C. é a par da senhora Rosalina Simbine membro do grupo Vonakala.Rosalina Simbine era membro do grupo Mondlane e este teve problemas, daí que ela saíu do mesmo e formou novo grupo.Ela vende Carvão em sacos e a senhora Isabel C. vende diversos produtos tais como bebidas, ovos, Yogurtes, biscoitos, etc., que compra na Swazilândia e parte faz entregas no mercado Estrela em Maputo.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil is a 36-year-old farmer who owns his livestock business in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Saatli. He has more than six years of experience in raising and breeding calves. He started his business in 2001 when he  borrowed his first loan from Aqroinvest CU to purchase a cow. It brought good income to his family. He is married and has one child. He sells milk to the local bazaar traders, and he would like to broaden his activities and start breeding calves. He is happy to run his business. He would like to expand by purchasing four calves. He applied for 1200 USD to purchase four calves each for 300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Teresa Cesaréa

texts.es:
Teresa, is from a natural born agriculture family, with immense strength she has observed that only labor with much dedication awards good fruits, with this conception she has worked her lands cultivating products native to the region such as the potato, corn, among others. Now that she is a mother of a family of 4 small children she has and feels more responsibility to continue with her daily labor, in another manner some time ago she acquired a small quantity of little animals to calm the hunger of her family in an epoch of shortage, while watching the cultivated lands she leaves the little animals free so that they can locate their daily sustenance. On the other hand, the health of her husband has deteriorated and they are worried a lot and to counteract the sickness that he suffers, he needs a demanding medical treatment, for this reason she has decided to increase the quantity and quality of her acquired products for the next season with improved seeds and balanced nutrition for the little animals. We consider the petition of a preoccupied wife who wishes to better the husband of her loyal companion with her work and sacrifice.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa, es de una familia netamente agricultora, con inmenso esfuerzo a través del tiempo observó que sólo una labor con mucha dedicación otorga al final buenos frutos, con esta concepción ha trabajado sus tierras de cultivo sembrando los productos oriundos de la zona como la papa, el maíz, entre otros.Ahora que es una madre de familia de cuatro pequeños tiene y siente aún más la responsabilidad de continuar con su cotidiana labor, de manera adicional hace tiempo atrás adquirió una pequeña cantidad de animalitos para aplacar el hambre de su familia en época de escasez y mientras realiza el cuidado de sus campos de cultivo deja libre a sus animalitos para que estos ubiquen su sustento diario.Por otra parte la deteriorada salud de su esposo la preocupan mucho y para contrarrestar la enfermedad que padece hace falta un exigente tratamiento médico, por esa razón ha decidido incrementar la cantidad y calidad de sus productos adquiriendo para la próxima época de siembra semillas mejoradas y alimento balanceado para sus animalitos.Posibilitemos la petición de esta preocupada esposa que desea mejorar la salud de su fiel compañero con su trabajo y sacrificio.

loans.use: The purchase of fortified seeds and balanced nutrition for her dear little animals

loans.name: Fredy

texts.en:
Fredy Mendoza is a 27 year old father of two children who lives in a populated neighborhood in the town of Luque.  As a single father, Fredy has been dedicated to recycling all types of paper and cardboard and selling them to local businesses.

Fredy has been in business for  five years now and the business supports his family.  He is applying for a loan in order to buy a great quantity of papers which will increase the quantity of clients and his sales.

loans.use: To buy paper and cardboard.

loans.name: Te

texts.en: Mrs. Te L. (pictured in the red shirt) is a 48-year-old widow with one daughter. She stays at home to look after the house and to cook food. In addition, she works as a farmer and as a clothes vendor in the market. Because her business is growing, she needs additional funds to purchase more clothes that she can then sell at the market. Therefore, she is seeking a $700 loan from Kiva to allow her to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to be sold at the market

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. Is 46 years old, and lives in Benin City. She is a widow with 4 children. She sells plantains and yams, and needs a loan of $875 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 6 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy yams and plantains for sale

loans.name: Rom Prak Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom P., 46, lives in Chom Teav village. She is married and has two children, one of whom is a student while the other is too young to study. She is the group leader. She is a farmer and works with her husband, Tith P., in the field that is next to her house. Last year, Mrs. Rom P. obtained a loan from AMK to help her with her plantation. In the village, it is difficult to get water since the river is far. Therefore, Mrs. Rom P. is requesting a loan so that she can dig a well. This will enable her to produce a better crop.

The man in the picture is the husband of one of the members who could not be present.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon T. is 35 years old and owns her own grocery store in Siem Reap province. Rural Khmers often set up small grocery stores outside their homes to turn small profits during the day. However, Chuon T. and her husband run a full-fledged food and produce stall at their local market. Working there together, they earn about $5 US per day. She supports all four of her children while they study in public school on this income. She knows she has something unique with the good location of her store and growing client base. Chuon hopes to expand her inventory drastically and to buy certain items in bulk.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Hortencia R. A. is a partner of the Communal Bank "Santa Isabel," and lives in the San Martin region, in the Picota district and Province. She makes and sells "anticuchos", "tacachos", and "juanes" (typical food of the region), developing her business on one of the principal corners of the city, located between little Picota and Bolognesi, where her regulars come daily. Her customers are locals and seasonal residents from other towns. Without the support of her husband, she started selling juanes. With her first loan she bought a rotisserie, tables, chairs and pans that she needed to grow her business. Now in addition to "juanes," she sells "anticuchos," "tacachos," and grilled meat in general, having earned a substantial clientele.

With a loan of $275, that will be returned in 6 months, she will buy the materials needed to prepare foods such as, rice, bags of sugar, gallons of oil, pork fat, chicken for the "anticuchos," banana bunches, as well as large pots to cook "juanes."

Hortensia is an enthusiatic 47-year-old woman with 2 children to whom she wants to give a better future, and wants them to feel proud of the mother they have. She is a happy woman contuniung to work and excel in life.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hortencia Rodríguez A. es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Isabel”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, tacachos y juanes (comidas típicas de la zona), desarrollando su negocio en una de las esquinas principales de la ciudad ubicada entre el Jr. Picota y Bolognesi donde diariamente acuden sus comensales, que son moradores y transeúntes de la propia localidad. Al no tener el apoyo de su esposo, se inicia en la venta de juanes, con su primer préstamo compró su parrilla, mesas, sillas y ollas que necesitaba para crecer en su negocio, ahora vende demás de juanes, anticuchos, tacachos y carnes a la parrilla en general, habiendo ganado gran cantidad de clientes. Con el crédito recibido de S/ 800.00 que devolverá en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones, manteca de chancho, pollo para los anticuchos, plátanos en racimos además compro ollas grandes para cocinar los juánes. Hortencia, es una mujer entusiasta de 47 años, con 2 hijos a quienes quiere darles futuro mejor, que ellos se sientan orgullosos de la mamá que tienen, es una mujer feliz con ganas de seguir trabajando y sobresalir en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and cooking pots

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
Mahsuda E. is 31 years old, married and has one son. She makes a living as a market vendor, selling shoes for girls and women. She has been in this line of work for four years, and has done well because she knows which items are going to be the most popular with her customers. Thanks to her success, Mahsuda is able to contribute quite a bit to the family budget and help her husband support his family and parents.

Mahsuda would like to buy new shoes for girls and women to sell in the late summer months. To do this, she needs additional funds, and has applied for a loan of $600 that she will repay in nine months. Mahsuda promises to make payments faithfully, and thanks everyone who chooses to support her because the loan will allow her to make better use of her shop's location and offer more goods to sell. She will use her increased income to ensure that her son can continue in school and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Assa

texts.fr: Assa D., née en 1958, mariée avec 02enfants plus 02 autres à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Thièkène depuis 3ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des produits cosmétiques et des portables. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins.<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Assa D., born in 1958 and married with 2 children and 2 others in her care, has been a member of the village bank of Thièkène for 3 years. Her business consists of buying and re-selling cosmetic products and cell phones. The income drawn from her business allows her to meet her needs. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell cosmetic products and cell phones

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K., age 70,  is an old grocery vendor who lives with two of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. On average, she makes around US$4 each day. She told a loan officer that before she became a grocer she grew rice with her husband.  She changed her work to selling groceries because it is easier to make profit. Her husband, Von Veng, age 71, still planting rice and raising pigs to support the family income. Normally, he earns around US$2 each day. Mrs. Sok is requesting a loan of US$750 to purchase a water pump, feed for pigs and increases the the ammount of groceries she is selling from her home.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, feed for pigs and increases the amount of groceries she is selling

loans.name: Angel Francisco

texts.es:
El  señor Ángel Francisco Castellón Ríos con edad de 50 años, su estado civil es de  soltero con 2 hijos sus edades son 3 y 5 años su compañera de vida es comerciante quien le ayuda en la comercialización también de mercadería,  los deseos de el son poder dar educación escolar a su hijos para que tenga una profesión y el día de mañana se puedan desenvolver como profesionales, su propósito es poder mantener la actividad activa para poder seguir aportando al hogar por consiguiente apoyar a sus hijos, así como sufragar sus gastos personales como compromisos financieros.


La actividad  económica de Ángel es la venta de de mercadería en general (cosméticos y ropa, mochilas escolares, electrodomésticos) el tiempo de tener su negocio es de 27 años, el expresa que le ha gustado mucho este negocio ya que le genera buenas ganancias, en esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para capital de trabajo el cual detalla en su plan de inversión como es la obtención de ropa de dama, caballeros, niños y cosméticos con el objetivo de poder cubrir los diferentes pedidos de sus clientes ya que el busca la manera de incrementar su establecimiento todo esto logrado por medio de la fundación león 2000, y todas aquellas instituciones que deseen apoyarle en sus ideas.
texts.en:
Mr. Ángel Francisco Castellón Ríos is 50 years old and single, and he has two children ages 3 and 5. His lifetime partner is a merchant who helps him also with the sale of a variety of products. His wishes include being able to provide an education for his children so they can become professionals one day. His goal is to continue with his activities so he can support the household, his children, and pay for his personal expenses and meet his financial commitments. Ángel’s economic activity is the sale of general merchandise (cosmetics and clothing, school backpacks, home electronics), and he has had his business for 27 years. He states that he enjoys his enterprise very much given that it generates good income. At this opportunity, he is requesting a loan for working capital which he details in his investment plan would be for the purchase of women’s, men’s and children’s clothing as well as cosmetics. His objective is to be able to fill the various requests from his customers, as he is looking to grow his establishment. Everything that he has managed to accomplish has been through the León 2000 Foundation and all those institutions who wish to support him and his ideas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Nay T. is a villager in Krang Banteay village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. She is a farmer who has a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Kuy Lorn, charges batteries for an income. Even though they have different business activities, they still cannot support their household. Thus, Mrs. Sok Nay T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy cow for breeding in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Née vers 1965 à  HETIN SOTA  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame    D. H. Joséphine  est mariée et mère de 5enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GF WANGNIME  DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson fumé. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1965 in Hetin Sota in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Joséphine D. H. is married and the mother of 5 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Wangnime of Hetin Sota, located near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells smoked fish.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Joséphine D. H. has requested a loan of 110,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Lumanai

texts.en: Lumanai M., 41, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in a plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Lumanai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home maintenance and things for her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, knives and sacks of fertilizers; also, for renovating her house.

loans.name: Yomaira Paola

texts.es:
Yomaira es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Yomaira es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, Yomaira junto a sus padres tienen una pequeña panadería en su casa en donde elaboran panes típicos, como la chapla, wawa, sus productos los comercializan en el mercado central y también en la puerta del horno. Además Yomaira esta estudiando enfermería en la universidad.
Yomaira necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y manteca.
Yomaira sueña con terminar su carrera y ser profesional y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Yomaira is a member of the Lila community bank. Yomaira is single, 22 years old and lives with her parents. Yomaira and her parents own a small bakery which they run from their home and bake typical breads such as "chapla" and "wawa". They sell their goods in the main market as well as fresh from the oven. Yomaira is also studying nursing at university. Yomaira needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy flour and butter. Yomaira dreams of finishing her studies so that she can be a nurse as well as open another business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and butter for her bakery.

loans.name: Hammed

texts.en: Hammed A. is 47 years old, married, and has 6 children. Hammed sells building materials in his shop. He is requesting a loan of  $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos de acuerdo a la temporada, cuando se inicia la época escolar, como ahora, vende calzado para los estudiantes, complemento del uniforme. Cuando termina esta temporada vende zapatos para dama y así aprovecha cada ocasión y cada pedido de sus clientes, Nancy deja su mercadería en las casas de sus clientes y luego cobra día a día hasta que completen su cuenta. Los resultados de su negocio son positivos, y esto le anima a seguir trabajando en esta actividad que le permite estar en casa con sus hijos por las tardes. Más adelante quiere tener un puesto de ventas estable de zapatos y de otras prendas de vestir, lo que la motiva a seguir trabajando. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y está muy animada de trabajar en este nuevo grupo, y ya tiene muy claro lo que es la garantía solidaria en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para comprar más zapatos y abastecerse en esta campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Nancy is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their four children. For the past three years she has sold shoes appropriate to the season. Now at the beginning of the school year she is selling the shoes required for school uniforms. At the end of this season she will sell women's shoes, thus making the most of each and every opportunity and customer request. Nancy delivers the merchandize to her clients, and then gradually collects their payments until the bill is paid in full. She has had positive results from her business, and that encourages her to continue working. This work permits her to be home with her children in the afternoons. In the future she hopes to have a regular stall from which to sell shoes and other items of clothing, and that motivates her to keep working. This is the first loan she has requested from Microfinanzas PRISMA (MFP), and she finds working in this new group encouraging, already fully understanding the guarantee community bank members provide to one another. The money that she has requested is for the purchase of more shoes to stock up for the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on merchandize

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 34 años, soltera, es una mujer colaboradora, y vivir junto a sus padres le ayuda a desarrollar mejor sus habilidades.
