Desde que se involucró en el  negocio de su padre fue adquiriendo conocimientos y práctica en administración de negocios, lo que con el tiempo fue perfilando su futura labor, ahora es quien administra la empresa de construcción de su padre. Sin embargo, con la intención de tener recursos propios compró un auto, el cual alquila todos los días para hacer el servicio de taxi, pero corre el riesgo de que las personas no le den un buen uso, perjudicando el funcionamiento del auto. Es por ello, que con el tiempo, desea tener el dinero necesario para invertirlo en la empresa familiar y tener un camión adecuado para el trasporte de los materiales necesarios. Rosa se encuentra trabajando con MFP más de 4 años, donde trata de aprovechar el tiempo que pasa con la socias para confraternizar, para ampliar sus redes sociales. En este momento, le es muy importante el mantenimiento de su vehículo y para ello invertirá los 3000 soles que solicita.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34, single, and very collaborative. She lives with her parents who help her develop her skills. Ever since she became involved in her father’s business she has been acquiring knowledge and experience in business administration. With time this was shaping her future work. Now she is the one who administers her father’s construction business. However, with the intent of having her own resources, she bought a car. She rents the car every day for use as a taxi. But, she runs the risk that the renter will not take good care and will damage the car. For this reason, with time, she would like to have enough money to invest in the family business. She would like to have a truck to transport the necessary materials. Rosa has been working with MFP for more than 4 years. She tries to take advantage of the time she spends with members by being friendly in order to expand her social network. She will use the loan of $975 (3000 PEN) for the maintenance of her vehicle which is very important to her right now.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her car

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар – 39 лет. Замужем и мать 5-х детей. Она занимается продажей женской одежды. Она торгует с Торговом Центре «Нури Хучанд» находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Дилбар закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Дилбар уже 3 года кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Дилбар расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию женской обуви. Теперь у Дилбар увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Dilbar is 39 years old. She is married and is the mother of 5 children. She sells women’s clothing. Dilbar sells at the shopping center “Nuri Huchand” which is located in the “Panchshanbe” area in Khujand. On Friday she goes to the “Dzhuma-bazar” market and on Sunday she goes to the “Yakshanbe-bazar” market. Dilbar purchases products in Bishkek, Kirgizstan. She travels for products once a month. Her husband is a construction worker. Dilbar has been our borrower for 3 years now. When she started out she had a small quantity of products. But now Dilbar has grown her business and used her last loan to purchase a stock of women’s shoes. Now Dilbar has a wider assortment of products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of women's clothing

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris pertenece al Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Iris es conviviente, tiene 27 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Iris vende cosméticos por catálogos de 3 líneas, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Iris vende ropa variada de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes.
Iris necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polo, pantalones y blusa.
Iris sueña con estudiar la carrera de ingeniería industrial y tener una empresa que genere empleo.
texts.en:
Iris is a member of the Chaska Lucero Communal Bank. Iris is 27 years old, lives with her significant other, and is expecting her first child. Iris sells 3 lines of cosmetics by catalog, and she sells on credit. Iris also sells clothing according to the requests of her customers.

Iris needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of sweaters, pants and blouses.

Iris dreams of studying for a career in industrial engineering, and has a business that generates employment.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Abdou Khadre

texts.fr: mr D. est instituteur depuis 7 ans ;parallèlement à ses fonctions il fait de l'aviculture chez lui pour renforcer ses revenus mensuels; avec ce pret il veut renforcer ses stocks de poulets de chair pour satisfaire sa clientèle;
texts.en:
Mr. D. has been a teacher for seven years. Along with that role, he raises poultry at home in order to bolster his monthly income. With this loan, he wants to bolster his stock of fryer hens to satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell poutry

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly M. is 45 years old. She is a married mother of five children, one son and four daughters. One is in senior high while the others are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana.

Nelly is a hard working woman. She works to support her husband, who works for a cocoa marketing company. Nelly runs a grocery store. She sells groceries such as Milo (a brand of malted milk sold by Nestle in West Africa), sugar, rice, candies, and bread in a store near the street. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben S., 30, is a local farmer and she uses her spare time to produce scarfs at her house. She has a typical income of around $1.60 US per day. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband is a local police authority in Takeo Province with an income of $2.50 US per day. She really wants a loan of $1000 US to buy a motorbike for transporting her products to sell at the local markets in her province. S. is photographed with her craft work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to take craftwork to market

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia A. is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. She has received schooling through junior high school.

Cynthia sells kenkey at Abura, which she has done since 1999. Kenkey is a Ghanaian dish which is prepared from fermented corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in the corn husk and eaten with hot pepper.

Cynthia uses her income to pay school fees and clothing for the children. She will use the loan to buy maize to prepare more kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy maize to prepare more kenkey for sale

loans.name: Nancy Relida

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 29 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Nancy vende leña en su casa, producto que compra de los intermediarios.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Nancy son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 29 years old and lives with her partner, and she is expecting her first child. Nancy sells firewood out of her home, and she buys the products from intermediaries. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to purchase more firewood. Nancy's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson B. is from the village of Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 56 years old. Nelson is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Nelson has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nelson has been in business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Nelson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to plant. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Juana Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Isidora es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa Mazocruz, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 07 hijos, estudio educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Av. Ejercito S/N.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años desde su fundación,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de carne de ovino y alpaca. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado vacuno,  en Acora donde tiene sus fundos de la comunidad.

Su sueño es poner una carnicería para poder vender directo a Tacna.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Isidoro is a member of the Generación 2000 Comunal Bank, which is located in the Santa Rosa Mazocruz district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 60, married, and has seven children. She has a third grade education. She lives on Av. Ejercito S/N. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement since its foundation, which has been several years,. With her initial loan for 300 PEN she bought lamb and alpaca meat. She is now asking for a loan for 2,500 PEN to buy cattle in Acora, which is where the community’s farms are. Her dream is to have a butcher’s shop where she could sell directly to Tacna. She likes the way they work and the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of moto-taxi

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 32 años, vive con su hijo de 4 años, en casa de sus padres. Ella se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde niña, sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar la tierra que hoy es su principal fuente de ingresos. Todos los días, Raquel se esfuerza por lograr mejoras en su casa, por lo que ayuda bastante a sus padres y también tiene sus propias extensiones de terreno donde siembra papa y el maíz. Para ella es un gran apoyo que su familia participe de la cosecha y la siembra de sus productos y siempre estará muy agradecida. 

Una vez recolectada, Raquel comercializa su cosecha, al por mayor, en el mercado de su zona y su deseo es tener más extensiones de terreno para seguir adelante con su actividad.

Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y siempre está pendiente del  progreso de su  grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y semilla para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Raquel is 32 years old. She lives with her 4 year old son in her parents’ house. She has been involved in farming since childhood. Her parents taught her how to cultivate the land, which is now her main source of income. Every day, Raquel strives to make improvements to her home with some assistance from her parents. She also has her own tracts of land where she grows potatoes and corn.

Raquel is grateful that she has the support of her family, who help her with planting and harvesting her crops. During the harvest season, Raquel sells her produce at the local wholesale market. She hopes to acquire additional tracts of land so that she can continue to succeed in farming.

This is Raquel’s 7th loan with MFP. As a member of her Communal Bank, she always participates in moving her group forward. The money she requested will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and seeds for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & seeds

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Mrs. Felicidad L. is from the village of Siloy, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, is married, and is blessed with three school-aged children.

Felicidad owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns 12,000 PHP monthly net income.

In 2007, Felicidad joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 3rd loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Phum

texts.en: Mrs. Phum O. is a villager in Sman Pream village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice for earning a living. Her husband, Mr. Suk Eom, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to help support the family. Mrs. Phum O. has six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker, and the others are attending the local school. Although they try to work hard, they still spend a lot on transportation to go to work, so Mrs. Phum O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her children to go to work, which will reduce their expenses. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to reduce expenses.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita C. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo Oroquieta City. She is 60 years-old. Perlita is married and has three adult children. Perlita owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Perlita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - J.” desde hace 11 años atrás, del distrito de J., provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, estudiò primaria completa, es casada y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella.  se dedica a la artesanía y tiene un kiosco escolar.
Eulalia se dedica a la artesanìa y paralelamente tiene un quiosco ubicado en un colegio. Nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró bayeta.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar bayeta, lana, hilos, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una cabina de Internet. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Eulalia has been a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima - J.” Communal Bank for the last 11 years. She is from J. District, Chucuito Province, Depatment of Puno. She is 30 years old, has completed her primary studies, is married and has 3 dependent children. She makes her living in handicrafts and has a kiosk in a school. Eulalia makes her living in handicrafts, and in parallel she has a kiosk located in a school. She tells us that with her first loan requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300.00 new soles, she purchased cloth. She is requesting a loan of 500.00 new soles, with which she will be able to purchase cloth, wool, string, etc. Her dream for the future is to have an internet booth. What she likes best about her Communal Bank is the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cloth, wool, string etc.

loans.name: Leonice's Group

texts.en:
Leonice A. is from the village of Buenavista, Santiago. She is 51 years-old. Leonice is the leader of a 10-member group loan offered by Kiva partner ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Leonice Group.

Leonice is married and has five adult children. Leonice owns and operates a business venture running a general store, tailoring and selling viand (prepared foods). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonice has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP tailoring and 500 PHP from her store weekly.

In 2009, Leonice joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonice is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris M. is a 31-year-old married lady. She is married to Timothy Sonje, a carpenter. Dorris owns a retail kiosk in Vipingo, Kilifi, which she opened a year ago to supplement the household income. 

Dorris joined KADET recently and this loan marks her first borrowing to boost her business. Her shop is under stocked and she hopes that with this loan she will be able to purchase new stock of flour, sugar and cooking oil. She will use part of the money to renovate the shelves in her kiosk. Dorris believes that she will be able to generate some profit to repay the loan as well as meet her daily expenses. She mainly serves the Vipingo stage residents in Kilifi.

She hopes and dreams of having a fully stocked retail shop soon and opening a food kiosk in the area.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 60-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Sanaa has been working in agriculture since 1995. She owns livestock that allows her to produce dairy products. She also breeds poultry. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a cow to increase her livestock. This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time. Sanaa is special in her work because she does her best to produce the best quality. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t use to produce as much as she does today. Sanaa decided on doing her business because she took over her family’s business. In the future, she plans to keep on expanding her work by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Melida Lisbet

texts.es: Melida Lisbet tiene 44 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, la inicia la intención de ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos, pues actualmente todos trabajan y ayudan a su Madre en lo que pueden, Melida además labora en una pequeña escuela donde asisten los niños de escasos recursos, por lo que el salario no es lo suficiente para generar ingresos necesarios. Ella solicita este financiamiento con el fin de comprar materia prima y seguir con sus clientes. Ella sueña con seguirle proporcionando a sus hijos una casa donde puedan dormir y dejárselas para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Melida is 44 years old, and her economic activity is selling dairy products. She has been engaged in this humble activity for more than 5 years. She was inspired to begin by the desire to improve the living conditions of her children, but today they all work and help their mother as they can. Melida also works in a small school for low-income children, but her salary from this job does not give her sufficient income. She is requesting this loan with the goal of buying raw materials and continuing serving her customers. She dreams of continuing to provide a home for her children where they can sleep in peace until the morning.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La Sra. Felipa tiene como actividad principal la venta de verduras en el mercado los Pinos, es cliente antigua, trabajo en grupo Gladiolos, ahora con el credito individual se encuentra  en su septima secuencia, ella trabaja tambien con un horno de panadería juntamente con su esposo, El dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de una amasadora, ellos tienen sus hijos que trabajan indepencientemente, ellos viven en casa propia en la zona de Rosales, donde se encuentra la panaderia, este producto elaboran todos los dias y proveen a las tiendas de la zona y de las comunidades aledañas, como Uni, Collana, etc. En el anterior crédito se dió esta tasa preferencial y no tuvo problemas de pago se vuelve a considerar la tasa preferencial ya que la Sra. Felipa es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.

La Sr. Felipa esta agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Felipa's main commercial activity is vegetable sales in the Los Pinos market. She is a long-standing client and is part of the Gladiolos (Gladiolas) communal bank. This loan will be her 7th. She also has a bakery oven with her husband. The funds will be used to buy a kneader. Their children work independently. She lives in her own home in the Rosales neighborhood, which is where the bakery is. They bake every day and sell their product to stores in the area and neighboring communities like Uni, Collana, Etc. She received this preferential rate on her previous loan and she didn't have any problems with repayment so this preferential rate is being offered again because Felipa is considered to be a responsible and hard-working person. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a kneader for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of televisions

loans.name: Noélie Yémissi

texts.fr: A. Noélie Yémissi  est née le 24 Décembre 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Noélie Yémissi  vit depuis 33 ans environs au quartier Lom-Nava à Cotonou. Mariée à AGOSSA, Noélie Yémissi  est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants de Noélie Yémissi , un n’est plus à sa charge. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Noélie Yémissi  vend des ustensiles de cuisine à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Noélie Yémissi  achète ses produits à Lomé au Togo, et au Ghana, deux Etats voisins du Bénin. Noélie Yémissi  exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans. C’est la première fois que Noélie Yémissi  sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Noélie Yémissi A. was born on December 24th, 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Noélie Yémissi has lived for almost 33 years in the area of Lom-Nava in Cotonou. Married to Agossi, Noélie Yémissi is the mother of three children, who are all attending school. One of the children is not under her responsability anymore. The couple provides for the various family expenses. To provide for that, Noélie Yémissi sells kitchen utensils in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Noélie Yémissi buys her supplies in Lome, Togo, and in Ghana, two neighboring states of Benin. Noélie Yémissi has been in this business for twenty years. This is the first time that Noélie Yémissi requests a loan from ALIDé in order to improve her business and better respond to the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años,  es viuda, tiene 2 hijos, y juntos viven con su mama en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 15 años que tiene una tienda en su casa, en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, paralelamente a ello, se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, en donde realiza un proceso de selección, para luego prepararlos listos limpios para su consumo. Esta última actividad le es muy rentable, más que la venta de productos, puesto que la carne de cuyes tiene alto valor nutritivo y por ello tiene mucha demanda de su consumo. En adelante espera intensificar la crianza de este animal y para ello desea tener más galpones y un espacio amplio en donde pueda instalar su granja. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la construcción de sus galpones como madera, rejillas de metal, asimismo desea comprar más cuyes reproductores para incrementar la producción de este animal.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old and has 2 children who live with their mother in her own house. For 15 years now she has had a store in her house, selling products of primary necessity. In addition, she raises guinea pigs, carrying out a process of selection, then preparing them for consumption. This latter activity is very profitable, more so than the sale of products, since guinea pig meat has high nutritive value and for this reason, is in great demand. In the future, she hopes to raise many more of these animals and for this, she will need more cages and an ample space to expand her facilities. This is Rosa's 12th loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. Moreover, she thinks the loan will be very useful in advancing her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase materials for the construction of cages, including wood and metal grating. In addition, she wants to buy more reproducing guinea pigs in order to increase the production of this animal.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING REPRODUCING GUINEA PIGS AND MATERIALS TO CONSTRUCT CAGES

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe L. is from the town of Mias, Katipunan. She is 49 years old. Guadalupe is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Guadalupe owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Guadalupe has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Guadalupe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guadalupe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Guadalupe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Guadalupe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza E. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Liza is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Liza operates a specialized clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ready-to-wear clothes in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly M., 43 years old, is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merly has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Merly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm supplies. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Merly from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy B. Sr. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 52 years old. Jimmy is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Jimmy owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jimmy has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lidia Vanessa

texts.es:
Lidia C. C. es una joven que vive en Sabanagrande, municipio del departamento del Atlántico, con sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10, 13 y 14 años. Ella tiene un salón de belleza donde ofrece el servicio de  corte, pedicure y manicure y gradualmente le ha agregado el de asesoria y venta de productos de belleza asociada a su actividad.

Lidia está aplicando a un crédikiva por valor de $900.000 COP con él comprará productos de belleza que distribuirá entre sus clientes que siempre le compran y tambien tiene otros nuevos. Desde que inició su negocio lo hizo primero en su familia, luego con sus  vecinos y a domicilio, pero en la medida en que se ha incrementado su clientela  ha  organizado su salón de belleza en la casa donde vive. Ella gradualmente se está extendiendo en ese mismo nicho de mercado con una nueva alternativa y es la de recomendar y vender  productos de belleza de acuerdo a lo que cada cliente  requiere y con ello ha ganado clientela.

Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y desde que ingresó a esta organización se ha entusiasmado mucho con su negocio y por eso   ha logrado especializarse en su tarea cada día más, y sus ingresos han mejorado preemitiéndole también satisfacer las necesidades del hogar. Su meta principal es trabajar fuertemente para generar suficientes ingresos para que sus hijos tengan siempre acceso a una educación de calidad y mas adelante sueña con adquirir una vivienda propia y justamente conseguir este propósito es el mayor desafío de Lidia.
texts.en:
Lidia C. C. is a young woman living in Sabanagrande, a municipality in Atlántico department, with her three children who are 10, 13, and 14 years of age. She has a beauty salon where she offers haircuts, pedicures and manicures. She has gradually added beauty consulting services and the sale of beauty products associated with her business. Lidia is applying for a Kiva loan in the amount of 900,000 COP to buy beauty products for sale to her regular customers as well as to new ones. She started her business first with her family members, then to her neighbors and in-home service. However, as her customer base has grown, she has set up a beauty salon in her home. She has been gradually expanding within this market niche by offering a new alternative: the sale of personalized beauty products that meet each customer’s needs. This has led to the addition of new customers. This is her 2nd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Since becoming a member of our organization she has been very excited about her business and has continued to specialize in her tasks daily. Her income has increased which has allowed her to better meet household expenses. Her main goal is to work hard so that her children have a quality education and that later on she can have her own home. In fact, precisely reaching this goal is Lidia’s major life challenge

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn M., 29 years old, has been a food vendor for three years. Ma. Lyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Ma. Lyn owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is seeking funds to help her buy additional merchandise.  She is working very hard to be able to help buy the basic needs of her family.

She needs a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy food ingredients. In that way, she will be able to provide her customers with more food with variety. She said that she likes the services of CEVI. She likes it because she also has micro-insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen S. has spent her life farming crops — a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has five children: one is already married and lives independently, while the other four are single. Her husband, shown in the photograph, frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. She has had great success in raising crops. The couple is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing but Pen S. doesn’t have the necessary capital so is looking for a loan to use to plant rice.

loans.use: To use to plant rice.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 46 years old married man with two children in school.  For twenty years, he has earned a living by tailoring and dress-making.  Most of his customers are from his local community.  Peter also does farming to supplement his income.  He has membership with the New Mwala group in Faulu Kenya.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya because his business is doing well.  He has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy fabric.  He hopes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: Buy fabric.

loans.name: Twisakilala Group, Jinja

texts.en:
B. Mwajab of Twisakilala Group, Jinja, is 38 years old and has, for the last four years, been in charge of a business selling secondhand clothes in Wakitaka, Jinja. With profits from this business she has, to a certain degree, managed to elevate her family’s welfare.

What has been of paramount importance to Mwajab all these years has been hard work. Her amiable personality has also played so much into her favor as this has gotten her many friends who in turn have turned into clients.

Prior to this, Mwajab was selling timber which she still does, albeit on a small scale. This was her first business but, because she was not making ends meet, she decided to try bearing a hand in her current business undertaking. She has never looked back since, as this business has proved to be worthwhile.

In a week Mwajab makes profits that add up to 180,000 Ugandan shillings. With this loan she wants to buy more bales of secondhand clothing and also new clothes, especially for Christmas sales.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of  secondhand clothes and also new clothing

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: A decade has now elapsed since 48-year-old  Charles B. embarked on his drug store or pharmacy business in Maanyi Trading Center in Mityana. This married father of five draws experience from his training as a professional health worker or clinical officer to effect transparency, accountability and professionalism in his business.  His drug pharmacy is replete with myriad human medicines that he says many patients ask for. A profit of 500,000 shillings a month accrues to his business. Charles describes himself as cooperative, open-minded and progressive, and with this loan he wants to purchase more drugs for his pharmacy. With resales, he says he will broaden his accrued profits.

loans.use: The purchase of more drugs for resale at his pharmacy

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city in Pakistan that is famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived with her family in a 2-room brick house for the last nine years. 

She is a 29 year old housewife who spends most of her time at home taking care of her household responsibilities. She is married to M. R. and has no children. 

Her husband is a salesman and sells edible items (candies and chocolates) to different shops to put three meals on their table. He buys the items on wholesale, and he generates income by selling them to different shops. He is the only breadwinner of the family, and this makes him more responsible towards his obligations.
  
Lubna has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy the edible items on wholesale and increase his sales. He has been running this business for the last 8 years, and Lubna is hopeful that this investment will become profitable for his business. 

She is a regular loan borrower with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year she built good credit behavior and has attended all required meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds the book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Lubna.

loans.use: To buy candies and chocolates on wholesale to resell

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.en:
Leocadie is 38 years old and she is married with 3 children who are 5, 8 and 10 years old.  Leocadie owns a shop where she sells hardware items as her picture above indicates.  Leocadie has been in this business for about 4 years and her shop is open from7 am to 7 pm every day.

Leocadie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  This loan will allow her to expand her business through purchasing a variety of hardware items which in turn will increase her sales as well as profits.  If successful, she will keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability and in addition to that, she will continue improving the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: a variety of hardware items

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla is a wife and mother of Samah, Afaf and Asad who are between 17 and 20. Nahla and her husband own a farm where they plant olive, lemon and almonds trees which they take care of, harvest and sell. The farm is the family's source of income. The three children help the parents work the land when they don't have school. 

Nahla came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase and install a greenhouse in the farm to grow different plants as winter is starting and this would create another source of income during winter.

The family also produces and sells olive oil.

Nahla appear in the picture here on the farm.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase and install a greenhouse

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane L. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Culipapa, HInobaan, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  fishing and a fish selling business.  Her husband Randolf, who is 42 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  

They have four children who are between the ages of 2 to 16 years old.  Mary Jane joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Jane has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to buy fishing gears and equipment for the fishing boat so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Mary Jane L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tools and wood for carpentry business

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jessica de 34 años, ella vende productos de uso personal como cosméticos por catalogo de marca Avon (empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras a vender cosméticos a un bajo costo) y Esika. 

Viviendo en zona periurbana llamada Paraíso inicio con las ventas de cosméticos Avon para tener ingresos suficientes y así dales una mejor vida a sus dos hijos de 12 y 8 años. Vende maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un bajo costo por catalogo. Ella vende los productos a sus conocidos y vecinos. También con ayuda de su esposo vende comida los fines de semana para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. 

Para incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, maquillaje, cremas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que una parte es de caña.
texts.en:
Jessica is 34 years old.  She sells Avon-branded personal products such as cosmetics through a catalog (Avon is a company that helps enterprising women to sell cosmetics at a low cost).  She also sells Esika-branded products.

Jessica lives in a peri-urban area called Paraíso.  She started selling Avon cosmetics so that she would have enough income with which to provide her two children, aged 12 and 8, with a better life.  She sells make up, perfume, creams and deodorants through a catalog at a low cost.  She sells her products to acquaintances and neighbors.  With her husband's help, Jessica also sells food at weekends to guarantee her children's future.

To increase her merchandise, Jessica would like to use her loan to buy perfumes, make up and creams for her business.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house since part of it is made from cane.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfumes and creams

loans.name: Jose Eldy

texts.en:
Jose Eldy T. is 37 years old and single. He is from the village of Tamban, Baliangao. To make a living, Jose Eldy is engaged in selling cosmetic items. He has been in his business for 10 years and earns a monthly net income of 3000.00

In 2008, Jose Eldy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose Eldy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for his business. Jose Eldy is requesting his 3rd loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to acquire new stocks for his business.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To acquire new stocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries to resell and to start a new business

loans.name: Chom

texts.en: The young woman in the photograph is Chom Y., age 36. Chom lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Chom Y. is a married woman who is devoted to her husband. She has three children who are employed in various jobs. They always contribute their profit to Chom Y. so that she can use it for daily expenses. Chom Y. is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to buy wood for mending her old house. She will use the remainder of the loan along with her savings to buy a secondhand motorcycle for her employed children so they can ride it to where they work.

loans.use: To buy wood for home repairs and to buy a used motorcycle for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Lud Roxana

texts.es:
La señora  Lud Roxana V.,  tiene 33  años de edad, viven en la comunidad de Konchupata de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   tiene dos hijos, el padre de su primer hijo les dejo a causa de un accidente y a su segundo esposo tuvo que dejarlo por el mal trato que les daba a sus hijos y a ella, ahora  ella sola tiene que mantener y alimentarlos a sus dos  hijos.

     Lud Roxana es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijos  y su trabajo se dedica a trabajar de cocinera y  a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando el crédito para   abrir un negocio de su propio restaurante en el lugar donde vive  para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y puedan asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a sus hijos y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Sra. Lud Roxana V. is 33 years old and lives in the community of Konchupata in Mizque Province, Department of Cochabamba. She has two children. The father of her first child died in an accident and she left her second husband because he did not treat her and her children well. Now she is the sole provider who must support and feed her two children.

Lud Roxana is an admired and respected individual in the area where she lives. She is devoted to her children and her job as a cook. Sometimes she works as a farm laborer in order to earn extra income to help support her two children.

Lud Roxana is requesting a loan so that she can open her own restaurant. This will improve her financial situation, provide her children a better quality of life, and enable them to attend a school with better conditions. The loan will be a great help to her children and to the hard work she has undertaken.

loans.use: Operating capital to start a restaurant

loans.name: Cyrus Tepela

texts.en:
Cyrus has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last 10 years and gets good returns from this business. He is 24 years old and married to Janet N..  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

In future, Cyrus hopes to buy a pick-up truck which he will be using to transfer his farm products to the market.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es: Ángela Maritza su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este medio de vida. Siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable y que disfruta de comunicarse con sus clientes, la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de productos y ella siempre está dispuesta a brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes por lo que es una mujer dedicada y abnegada. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, pintura de uñas, brillos, tratamientos entre otros.
texts.en:
Ángela Maritza has been selling cosmetics for a living for over three years.  She has always been very responsible and enjoys talking to her customers, most of whom request a wide variety of products.  She is always willing to provide the best customer service she can since she is very dedicated and self-sacrificing.

She plans to use the loan to buy lipstick, face powder, nail polish, gloss and other treatments.

loans.use: To buy lipstick, face powder, nail polish, gloss and other treatments

loans.name: Las Palomas Del Centro Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las palomas del centro", esta ubicado en el Estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por sus dos balnearios populares los cuales son: balneario la plata y parque acuatico aquas splash. El grupo esta conformado por 13 integrantes. La señora Alma Teresa T. M. es la presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 36 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de bachillerato, es casada y tiene una hija de 15años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 10 años. Ella solicita su prestamo para comprar ropa de temporada. Sus clientes estan agusto por su manera de atenderlas. Al momento de solicitar su prestamo se siente feliz porque va a poder ampliar su negocio, quiere este prestamo para hacer crecer su negocio y con las ganancias que obtenga piensa poner un local para que ya no sea ambulante, también desea darle una carrera profesional a su hija para un mejor futuro.
texts.en: This group is called “Las Palomas del Centro” and is located in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  This community is distinguished by its two spas, which are the Silver Spa and the Aquatic Waters Park.  The group is made up of 13 members.  Alma Teresa T. Martiniez is the group’s president.  She is 36 years old and attended three years of collage.  She is married and has a 15 year old daughter.  Alma has been selling clothing for the past 10 years.  She is asking for this loan to buy seasonal clothing.  Her customers are comfortable with her customer service.  She is happy because she will be able to expand her business.  She wants this loan to grow her business.  She plans to open a small shop with her earnings so that she won’t have to sell on foot.  She also wants her daughter to have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Ray

texts.en: Mrs. Ray P. is 32 years old and a married woman who has been living the province of Siem Reap. To earn a living, Ray P. and her husband sell some grocery items, both retail and wholesale, at the local market. They have several years of experience in this sector and earn approximately $6 per day. They have been marred for several years and have six young children who attend school. She will use her loan to purchase additional grocery inventory. This loan will really increase her net income so she can use this cash to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery inventory.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina A. is from the city of Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 52 years old. Lucina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lucina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Lucina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Lucina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair a piece of equipment used for fishing. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lucina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a piece of equipment used for fishing.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with 7 family members who 3 of them work.

Ali has a shop selling electrical items and household since 2010. He has 1 year experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is being well known in his area.

He is requesting $2400 to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent of his shop and to add more inventory for his store.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren is 28 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger, or Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Her daughter, who is six years old, goes to kindergarten while Dolgorsuren runs a consumer-goods business at a rented stall at Narantuul, one of the busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar.

Dolgorsuren started her business in 2005 and now sells more than 200,000 MNT worth of goods every day. She has also begun importing products from China, and says, "Previously I used to buy my products from wholesalers in Mongolia. However, I began importing my goods directly from China, and it is much more profitable than before."

Dolgorsuren uses her profits to care for her daughter and buy the many things she needs in life. She is an open-minded woman who says, "I am working hard to save money to build a house." She is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy construction materials for this new house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build a house.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 11. Melanie’s husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Melanie is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice crops. She also grows root crops like taro. Melanie plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ronald Amaury

texts.es: Ronald  de 32 años es un hombre que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 3 a 10 años. Él es el propietario del negocio “Decoraciones Ronald”. Desde la edad de 15 años aprendió con su padre el arte de acabado en yeso y marmolería en los interiores y exteriores de las construcciones. Cuando creció se especializó en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “  SENA “ organismo apoyado por el Estado Nacional donde perfeccionó su arte y posteriormente se independizó para  ofrecer sus servicios con el apoyo de un ayudante.  Ronald realiza los contratos con personas naturales o empresas a todo costo, esta es la razón de su requerimiento en credikiva, pues necesita comprar materiales para lograr acabados en viviendas donde lo han contratado y debe poner todo el dinero para sus materiales. Su sueño  es establecerse en un local y ofrecer los servicios y productos en yeso que también elabora como cenefas y adornos, en un punto comercial, con el fin de aumentar su reconocimiento y con ello sus ingresos. Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea una vez más con su inversión,  tener un capital de trabajo disponible para responder a los contratos a todo costo.
texts.en:
Ronald is a 32-year-old man who lives in the city of Cartagena. He has three children aged 3 to 10 years old. He is the owner of a business called “Decoraciones Ronald” [Decorations by Ronald]. At the age of 15 he began learning the art of plaster and marble finishings for the interior and exterior of buildings from his father.  

As he grew older he specialized in the National Apprentice Service “SENA”, an institution supported by the state. There he perfected his art. Later he started working independently, offering his services with the help of an assistant. 

Ronald carries out his contracts, all costs included, with both individuals and companies. That is why he needs a kiva loan to buy the materials to complete the finishings in homes where he has been contracted as he must put up the money for the materials. 

His dream is to establish a storefront, where he can offer his services and plaster products, which he also elaborates with friezes and decorations, in a commercial location. This will serve to increase his recognition and with it, his income. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Again, he plans to use this investment to have working capital available to be able to respond to contracts, all costs included.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making friezes.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; la socia tiene 33 años; la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo;  La socia se dedica a la compra y veta de artesanías; la socia también elabora chullos, guantes, chalinas, ponchos de alpaca, también realiza finas mantas con diseños paisajísticos, en la misma manta borda paisajes como arboles, cerros, aves, flores, ríos, animales, en general la flora y fauna de nuestro ande; La socia tiene un pequeño taller en su casa desde hace 7 años y venta muy feliz por poder expresar ese bello arte del pueblo como ella lo manifiesta. La socia desea poder comprar lana de alpaca procesada, botones, hilos al por mayor para implementar su negocio y también realiza estandartes, ropa para santos a pedido. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de mantas, estandartes, ropa para santos, chullos entre otros.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the CHOQUEQUIRAO” communal bank, in the Huanchac district in the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Maribel; she is 33 years old and has one son. The member dedicates herself to buying and selling handicrafts; she also makes chullos (traditional woollen hats), gloves, and alpaca wool ponchos. In addition, she makes fine blankets with traditional designs and embroiders them with country motifs such as trees, birds, flowers, rivers, and animals - all the flora and fauna of the Andes. The member has had a small workshop in her house for 7 years, and is very happy that she can create this beautiful traditional art. She wishes to buy spun alpaca wool, buttons, and needles wholesale, to be able to carry on her business, and also to enable her to make hangings and clothing for saints, to order. The member is seeking a loan to invest in materials for making blankets, hangings, clothing for saints, chullos, and other things.

The member states that she is very satisfied with and grateful for the support offered, and promises to comply with the repayment of her loan in the place agreed.

loans.use: To invest in materials for making blankets, hangings, clothing for saints, chullos, and other things.

loans.name: Ginorah

texts.en:
Ginorah, 22, is married and sells porridge and light foods such as doughnuts and chapatis. She has been in this business for one year and earns a monthly income of about 10,000 KES, which she uses to help take care of her family.

This loan of 20,000 KES is her first from KADET Ltd. She intends to use 10,000 KES of the loan to put up a structure to accommodate her current business and the rest to start up a new business selling used clothes. 

With the anticipated profit, she will continue sustaining her businesses and help look after her family. In the future, she hopes to own her own restaurant and boutique.

loans.use: to put up a structure to accommodate her current business.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 27 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Banigan, a part of Liloy in Zamboanga del Norte province in the Mindanao islands. Liezel has a newly-opened general store from which she earns 3,500 PHP monthly.

This year, Liezel became a member of PMPC. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her store. In the future, Liezel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Galt

texts.en: Galt is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd, Mongolia. His eldest daughter is a high school student. Until 2010, Galt sold coal and wood at the local market. With the profits he earned from this business, he bought a small truck and started to transport goods and vegetables within his town. He is planning to buy vegetables in the countryside and sell them in the town. He is a diligent man who says "I want to build my house in the near future." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy vegetables at wholesale prices, and to repair his truck.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosielyn

texts.en:
Rosielyn is married with two children. She is 43 years old and lives in Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur.
Rosielyn sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail store.
Rosielyn has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Rosielyn hopes to earn a total income of 10,000 PHP each month.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail store

loans.name: Nyakyanika 11 Women Group

texts.en: Damas is 26 years old and married with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a member of Nyakyanika Group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. His family goal is to start up a small business for his wife to supplement the family income. He is a fishmonger and he has been in the business for four years. He started the business with 100,000 shillings but now it has grown to 1,500,000 as his working capital. His challenge is price fluctuation and the difficulty of transporting the fish due to poor feeder roads. Damas needs the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a is a vendor of fruits and vegetables. Dhe has operated her business for the past three years and sells to local area residents. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators in the market. She dreams of supplying her products to local factories.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase tens bags of passionfruit and five bags of oranges for her business. She decided to join Yehu to boost herself financially.

Margaret is a single woman with two school-going children. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tens bags of passionfruit and five bags of oranges

loans.name: Efren Humberto

texts.es:
A sus 42 años de edad Efrén es un hombre emprendedor, un esposo responsable y un padre que se siente orgulloso de sus 4 hijos, desde  hace varios años tiene un negocio familiar que les ha ayudado a cumplir con las necesidades básicas de su hogar, y entre sus hijos su esposa y él se encargan de sacar adelante su microempresa donde venden arepas de queso en un sector muy comercial de Bello, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia.

Actualmente sueñan con ver progresar el negocio, y comenzar a distribuir las arepas a otras microempresas que se encarguen de su venta, pero esto requiere producir en mayor cantidad, pero hoy en día no cuentan con el capital necesario para comprar la materia prima al por mayor para que la producción y comercialización de las arepas sea mas efectiva, Efrén solicita un préstamo para hacer dichas compras, mejorar y aumentar las ventas para lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: At 42 years of age, Efrén is an entrepreneurial man, a responsible husband and a father who feels proud of his four children. For several years, Efrén has had a family business which has helped him to cover his household's basic needs. Between his children, his wife and himself, they work to get ahead in their micro-business selling cheese 'arepas' in a very commercial area of Bello, a town in Antioquia department. They are currently dreaming of making progress in their business and starting to distribute their 'arepas' to other micro-businesses to sell. However, this requires them to produce in larger quantities. Right now, they don't have the capital they need to buy their supplies wholesale which would make their production and sales of 'arepas' more effective. Efrén is requesting a loan to make these purchases, and to improve and increase their sales so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 44 years old man. He is married with six sons and four daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He has a bicycle repair workshop which is a source of income to the family. Mohammad wants to improve his work by purchasing a new bicycle repair kit, but he does not currently have enough money so he needs to take a loan of amount $1,500 from FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase a new bicycle repair kit, enabling him to improve the quality of his work and increase his customers, this will increase his income and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family. Mohammad is a conservative man, so his son is photographed instead in the workshop.

loans.use: To purchase new bicycle repair kit to improve his work.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad  de  55 años, esta casado y vive con con su esposa e hijo. El con el crédito va comprar ropa para luego venderla a su clientela. El cuenta con varios años de experiencia en lo que es comercio de ropa o venta de esta y el quiere invertir en el crédito para compra mas mercadería pues está llegando una temporada alta para la venta. El quiere darle a su clientela una mejor atención y tener más diversidad de productos para los gustos de las personas. Tiene como meta prioritaria generar los ingresos para mejorar su nivel económico y su bienestar familiar y también salir adelante con los pagos del crédito.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Gerardo, 55, is married and lives with his wife and son.  He will use the loan to buy clothes to then resell to his customers.  He has several years experience in clothing sales and he wants to invest the loan in purchasing more merchandise because a season of high sales is approaching.  He wants to provide the best service to his customers and have a wider variety of items available to cover all tastes.  His main priority is to generate income to improve his economic level and his family’s wellbeing as well as to make the installment payments on his loan.  This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40-year-old married man, father of four lovely children. Mohamad has been working in construction for 28 years. He was only 12 years old when he started working, in order to help his family in making a living.
This long experience gives him customers' trust and a wide knowledge in all construction fields.
Mohamad has been with Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for three consecutive loan cycles. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his social and financial situation, and in providing his children a healthier and more educated living. 
His goal is to prevent his children from experiencing the type of childhood he had, because he believes that a child is brought to life in order to be cherished not to be used.
This time, Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools required in his business, since he is involved in all construction fields like plumbing, electricity, painting, and pasting tiles.
He hopes to buy a shop in the future to sell all necessary construction tools.

loans.use: To buy new construction tools necessary for his business

loans.name: Glory Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Stewart from Harare. He is married with two children, one of whom is still in school. Stewart runs a restaurant business selling fast food. The business has been in operation for 6 years. He says the main challenge faced is competition as the business depends on customers among motorists and there are some other players by the road side. Stewart has requested a loan of $400.00 to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, meat products, and snacks. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his school-going child to go to a better school. In the future, Stewart plans to have a state-of-the-art restaurant.

loans.use: to buy stocks of drinks, meat products, and snacks

loans.name: Namisa

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Namisa. She is married and has two children, aged 9 and 2 years. She has five additional dependents. 

In 2010, Namisa established her provisions and drinks business. She began her business because she was receiving a very low income from the hairdressing she was doing, so she decided to create an additional source of income. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Namisa requires a loan in order to buy more provisions and drinks for her business. In the future, Namisa plans to develop her business to the point of a full-scale provision shop and to become a distributor for breweries and cold storage companies; she also plans to educate her children very well. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 13 years old. Jacinta's husband works as a driver.

Jacinta has been in the business of raising hogs for the past 10 years. She is able to support her family through her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. Jacinta hopes to have a stable income so she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: One Word Group

texts.en:
Mariama is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariama was born in Mayamba town about thirty years ago. She is married to a miner and the couple has four children – three in primary school and one in secondary. 

For four years now, Mariama has been selling ready-to-wear clothes. This is the first loan that she and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mariama will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy more clothes to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a forty-six year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal to educate his children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. 

Christopher has been a farmer for the last twelve years and is facing hardships due to seasonal weather and soil exhaustion. Christopher needs a loan to buy fertilizers for his plantations.

His vision is to buy land to grow more crops and engage in modern farming activities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his plantations.

loans.name: Zhamalkan
