texts.ru: Жамалкан, 49 лет, вдова, есть 4 детей. У нее средне образование. С 1999 года в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, 9 овец. На 1,0 Га земли выращивает картофель и фасоль для реализации. Также в целях собственного потребления, Жамалкан занимается садом, выращивает фрукты и ягоды, в огороде прорастают овощи. Она получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере 16,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и топлива для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистых продуктов. Жамалкан является участником группы "Чат-Базар", в группе всего 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Жамалкан планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zhamalkan is a 49-year-old widow with four children. She has a secondary education. She has been involved in agriculture since 1999, thus providing a source of income for her family. She has one cow and nine sheep on her farm, and she also grows potatoes and beans for resale on one hectare of land. She makes a monthly income of approximately 16,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further grow her farming business, Zhamalkan has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers and fuel to cultivate her land and grow organic produce. She is a member of the "Chat Bazar" group which consists of a total of three people. Zhamalkan is planning to use the earnings from her loan to expand her activity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic produce.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La  socia Socorro ; tiene 49 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de belleza ,la socia vende lo que son cremas, perfumes entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia a la vez se dedica a ejercer su carrera de docente en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar colonias entre otros.
Los  socios en general agradecen el apoyo que se les otorgara y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de sus cuotas.
Las socias que salen  adjuntas a la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud,las  socias se comprometen para la siguiente foto estar todas juntas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the San Antonio Communal Bank, located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. Member Socorro is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with working in her beauty product business. She sells creams, perfumes, and other products to her customers.

She is a responsible and diligent person. She is currently also working in her career as a teacher at one of the local high schools. She hopes to continue working and supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase colognes and other products. The other members of the group are thankful for the support that has been extended to them, and they are committed to fulfilling all their payments in a disciplined way.

The members whose photos have been inserted into the photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting, due to work and health reasons. They are committed to all being together for the next photo.

loans.use: to purchase colognes and other products.

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.en:
My name is M. Soul and I sell watches for men, women and children. My customer base is very good because I am located in the center of teh city. My goal is to increase my inventory of watches and to have several different kinds of watches. I hope to increase my sales and support my family and pay for my son\'s education.

Loan Use: Purchase watches, batteries, bracelets and pins

Mi nombre es Alma M. me dedico a la venta de relojes para caballero, dama y niños, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario de relojes para poder tener varios tipos de relojes e incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga mantener mi familia y el estudio de mi hijo

loans.use: compra de relojes, beterias, brazaletes, pines

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region, settled in Khaladj village,Salyan region. He is married and has a child.
He has run this business for 2 years. He has his own shop. He needs a loan of $700 to expand the area of his shop.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Mrs. Folake is a woman of great dignity and power who sells provisions to people in her community. Mrs. Folake A. is 30 years old. She is married with four (4) children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She hopes to use the loan for business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his fruit selling business

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en: Running a business is not easy but for Senerita, she enjoys it.  Being 29 years old and a mother of three, she sells various products in her stall at the local flea market, but mainly kava bowls with different designs and different shapes.  After all of the expenses, she makes a profit which helps provide for the family and pay for her children’s school fees.  She has requested aid to increase her supplies and products to be sold, and income gained will go to fund her children’s education.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Younes

texts.en: Younes is a 37 year old father of 4 children. He lives with his family in the outskirts of the city of Tyre in the South of Lebanon. The children and young people from the neighborhood get together in his cafe and games center in which they play pool and spend their free time. He wants to expand his business and start buying more games in order to attract more clients. Younes is confident in this new step he is undertaking and is very proud of his initiative.

loans.use: To buy new games

loans.name: Elis

texts.en: Elis is 38 years old, and the mother of a child aged 6. She sells some foods such as coconut milk, rice, fried snacks, Indonesian salad (gado - gado), etc. She usually earns $6 per day. Her husband, B., is a tailor who earns $10 income per week. She really needs a $100 loan to expand her business and make it sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa is 44 and her husband, Nelson Ruiz, is 37. They live in a very nice house with their three children and Ninfa's mother in the Golondrina neighborhood in the city of Villa Hayes-Chaco.
Ninfa tells us that, thanks to some savings she had, she was able to open a convenience store where she sells different kinds of basic goods such as sugar, flour, fruit, vegetables, pasta, etc.
For the past few years she has worked with loans that Fundacion Paraguaya has granted her, and this time she is requesting a new loan with which she will acquire a greater variety of goods for her business, since due to the year-end holidays her customers demand a greater amount of products.
Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ninfa tiene 44 años, y su esposo Nelson Ruiz tiene 37 años de edad, ambos viven en una casa muy bonita con sus tres hijos y la madre de doña Ninfa en el barrio Golondrina de la ciudad de Villa Hayes - Chaco. 

Doña Ninfa cuenta que gracias a un pequeño ahorro que tenía pudo abrir su despensa, donde vende distintos tipos de artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, harina, frutas, hortalizas, fideos, etc. 

Hace varios años que trabaja con los créditos que le otorga la Fundación y en esta oportunidad está solicitando un nuevo crédito con el que surtir de mayor variedad su negocio, pues como se acercan las fiestas de fin año sus clientes demandan mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase bakery goods, canned goods, wine, soft drinks, cider, sweet bread, candy, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Yakaar 1 Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of young men who are trading cereals. We go and buy them once a week at the weekly markets organized in the neighboring villages. We then resale them after transformation. This is how we got started with a first loan that we have repaid completely. Now the group has grown and has a lot more members, most of them women. We have regrouped them in an association that will do the same thing as us.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes hommes qui fait du commerce de céréales que nous allons acheter dans les foires hebdomadairesqui sont organisées dans les villages limitrophes et que nous venons revendre après transformation pour le revaloriser. C'est ainsi que nous avons débuté avec un premier prêt que nous avons fini de rermbourser et maintenant, le groupe s'est agrandi avec beaucoup plus de membres dont la plupart sont des femmes que nous avons regroupé dans une association qui va faire la même chose que nous.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals for transformation and resale

loans.name: Chon

texts.en: Mr. Chon S. is 27 years old and works as a motor-taxi driver. On a typical day, he earns $2.50 of profit. His wife, who is also 27 years old, works as a farmer and earns, on average, $1 of profit per day. To allow the family to live a better life, this couple would like to start another business (such as raising pigs) to generate additional income, but they do not have enough money to do so. As a result, they are seeking a $600 loan from Kiva to start a pig-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and breed.

loans.name: Elias

texts.pt:
Elias Comé was born on April 11, 1964 in the Inharrime district and spent his childhood there. He began school in 1971 at the elementary school in Magula but quit going that same year due to the distance. In 1976 they moved to Namaacha where he went to school at the elementary school in Namaacha. In 1981 he finished the sixth and seventh grades.

In 1983 he was recruited to fulfill his obligatory military service which ended in 1986. In the same year he began to work in the money office of a warehouse, and in 1988 he was promoted to be head of the office at the same company. In 1989 he married his wife with whom he has 5 children. 2 years later he became Chief of Finances until 1993 when the company closed.

In that same year he began to work in the Society of Namaacha Farming as head of the office and assistant to the book keeper until 1996 when it also had to shut down. He went one year without work.

In 1998 he went on to work in Mozal as a stonemason with a contract for 5 months. In 2000 he began work at Delta Security where he only remained for one year because the work conditions were not good.

In 2001 he worked in security for the TDM company where he works today. He learned of the existence of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA through his colleagues and solicited a loan for 10,000MT to purchase construction materials to finish his family home. In the future he intends to access more credit to construct a local brick factory, a skill he acquired with his friends in the years he was unemployed.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Elias Comé, nasceu ao 11 de Abril de 1964 no distrito de Inharrime, passa a sua infância no mesmo distrito. Inicia os seus estudos em 1971 na Escola Primaria de Magula, e desiste no mesmo ano devido a distância. Em 1976 mudam de residência para Namaacha, reC.ça os estudos na Escola Primária de Namaacha, em 1981 passa para escola secundaria onde frequentou a 6ª e 7ªclasse .

Em 1983 é recrutado para cumprir com o Serviço Militar Obrigatório, tendo concluído em 1986. No mesmo ano C.ça a trabalhar como fiel do armazém, em 1988 passa a ser chefe da secretaria na mesma empresa. Em 1989 junta-se com a sua esposa com a qual tem5 filhos, dois anos depois fica como chefe das finanças até 1993, quando a empresa fechou. No mesmo ano C.ça a trabalhar na sociedade Agro-pecuária de Namaacha como chefe da secretaria e auxiliar de contabilidade até 1996 esta também veio a fechar, e fica um ano sem trabalhar.

Em 1998 passou a trabalha na Mozal como pedreiro num contracto de 5 meses. Em 2000 C.ça a trabalhar na Segurança “ Delta” onde só permaneceu por um período de um ano alegando não ter boas condições de trabalho.

Em 2001 trabalha na Segurança da empresa TDM onde trabalha até então. Soube da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA através dos colegas e aproximou solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10,000.00MT para a compra de material de construção para concluir residencia familiar. Pretende futuramente adquirir mais crédito para construir uma fábrica de tijolos local, arte adquirida com os seus amigos nos anos que ficou sem emprego.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a family home

loans.name: Muhammad Muneer

texts.en:
Muhammad Muneer, son of  F. H., lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail food and mobile repair shop in Kabul.
He wants to develop his small business at present, but he needs capital to invest in it. Therefore he has requested a short-term loan in the amount of 42,000 Afghanis (US$ 875) from AFSG, to buy some necessary materials for his shop.
Muhammad Muneer intends to repay this loan over 12 months and he hopes that with this money he can improve his business.

loans.use: To buy some necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel A. is 43-year-old man married to Modesta Narváez. The couple has two young sons. He owns a despensa (grocery store) located in their house. In rural areas in Paraguay, the despensas could be considered as a meeting point, where people not only buy products but also gather and gossip. That is why is despensas are a very profitable business in those areas.

Miguel always tries to offer a wide variety and quantity of products for a lower price. After a lot of effort he bought a car, which allowed him to start a delivery service. He dreams of having an autoservice store and competing with the big supermarkets.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of meat, bread, milk, cheese, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase of milk, cheese, bread, meat, rice, sugar, and others

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa C. B. is a member of the “Sowing a Future” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region of Peru, in the Province of San Martin, District of Tarapoto. Her business is located in her own home, situated on Jr. Huallaga St. # 719, where she sells grocery items, sweets and common edible household products.

She and her son began selling fish brought from the coast but saw that it was not a very profitable business. They chose to open a small grocery store, and thanks to her perseverance, the business kept growing little by little until she had a well-stocked general store with all the items needed by residents of the neighborhood in which she lives.

With the loan of 1,000 soles ($350), which she will repay in 6 payments, she will purchase packet of noodles in different varieties, preserved fish in boxes, sacks of rice and sugar, liters of oil, bulk detergent of various brands, soft drinks, sweets, and personal hygiene products. She wants her customers to be able to be able to find everything they need or are looking for in the same place.

Mrs. Rosa is 52 years old and feels very sure of herself. She is known as a fighter (for what she wants), a very hard-working and responsible woman, and is very perseverant. She dreams of having a Mini-Market and being able to assure the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa C. B., es socia del Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jr Huallaga Nº 719, en el cual vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario.

Ella junto con su hijo se inicio vendiendo pescado traídos de la costa y vio que este trabajo no era muy rentable y opto por la venta de abarrotes gracias a su perseverancia en el trabajo hizo que poco a poco vaya creciendo hasta llegar a tener una bodega surtida con todos aquellos artículos que son de requeridos por los moradores del barrio en el que vive.

Con el préstamo recibido de S/. 1000.00 que pagara en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros y a granel detergentes de diferentes marcas, bebidas gasificadas, golosinas y productos de aseo personal, quiere que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que buscan y necesitan en un mismo lugar.

La señora Rosa tiene 52 años se siente muy segura de si misma se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante, sueña con tener su Minimark y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of grocery products wholesale

loans.name: Kesia

texts.en:
Kesia, 38, is a married woman with five children, ages 19, 17, 12, 6 and 1. She became a millet and cakes seller in 1996. She works from 6AM to 8PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Kesia has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more millets, cooking oil and wheat flour cakes for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of millets, cooking oil and wheat flour cakes

loans.name: Inacio Sambulelo

texts.pt:
Inacio Sambulelo N. tem 48anos, nasceu em Cabo Delgado estudou até 5ªclasse e compriu com serviço militar obrigatório,é separado e pai de 6 filhos de idades compreendidas entre 27anos á 11anos.Os três mais velhos já estão empregados e sustenta somente os três ultimos que ainda estão a estudar.
Inacio depois de cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório, foi transferido para Maputo, onde esteve atrabalhar com PRM (Policia da Republica Moçambicana) no ano segunte juntou-se com asua esposa. Em 1987 é franferido para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Suazilândia, Inacio uma vez que já tava em conflito com a esposa, separou se dela deixando a com a casa e os filhos e veio viver em Namaacha sozinho numa casa oferecido pelo Estado.Trabalha como Oficial de permanênçia, é funcionario permanente a 29anos, trabalha 24h por dia durante 3dias da semana, oufere mensalmente um salario no valor de 5,853.00mtn e tem uma pensão militar de 4,558.00mtn.Sustenta os seus três filhos mandando lhes uma mesada no valor de 1,000.00 para cada filho e em cada três meses manda 3,000.00mtn para sua mãe em Cabo Delgabo e não consegue poupar nada no final do mês porque está a contruir a sua casa na mesma vila.

Este é terceiro emprestimo de Inacio, segundo com Huvuku e primeiro com Kiva, o primeiro teve com BIM ( Banco Intrnacional de Muçambique), para iniciar a sua obra no valor de 40,000.00mtn e pagou em três anos. Em 2007 conheceu a hluvuku a través dum amigo e pediu o primeiro empretimo de 12,000.00mtn que usou para comprar material de construçào para continuar com a obra, conseguiu pagar antes do prazo. Pede este segundo para concluir a sua obra, assim que concluir de pagar este emprestimo pretende pedir mais para mobilar a sua  casa.
texts.en:
Inacio Sambulelo N. is 48 years old and from Cabo Delgado. He went to school until the fifth grade and fulfilled his compulsory military service. He is divorced and the father of six children between the ages of 27 and 11 years. The three eldest are already employed and supporting the three younger, who are still in school. After completing his compulsory military service, Inacio was transfered to Maputo, where he worked in the PRM (Police of the Republic of Mozambique), and in the following year married his wife. In 1987 he was transfered to Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland. As he was already in conflict with his wife at that time, Inacio divorced her, leaving her with the house and children, and came to live alone in Namaacha in a house provided by the State. He got a permanent position as a residence officer at 29 years old. He works 24 hours a day, three days a week, earning a monthly salary of 5853 meticais, and has a military pension of 4558 meticais. He supports his three children, sending them a monthly allowance of 1000 apiece, and every three months he sends 3000 meticais to his mother in Cabo Delgado. He doesn't manage to save anything by the end of the month because he is building his house there in the village. This is Inacio's third loan, his second through Hluvuku, and his first with Kiva. His first loan was with the BIM (International Bank of Mozambique), to launch his construction work. It was for 40000 meticais, and he repaid it in three years. In 2007, he became acquainted with Hluvuku through a friend and requested a first loan in the amount of 12000 meticais, which he used to buy construction material to continue the construction project. He was able to repay that loan ahead of time. He requests this second loan to finish the construction. Once he repays this loan, he plans to request another, for furnishing his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama M., 48 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants et 05 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout à Thiès depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des fruits et produits locaux comme les pastèques  et les mangues. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de fruit. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Mariama M., age 48, is married and has seven children and five other people in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Bayouf Pout in Thiès for two and half years. Her business consists of buying and selling local produce and fruit, such as watermelons and mangoes. She wants to bolster her trade in fruit. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell local fruit

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María tiene 36 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y vive en la calle Antenor Orrego s/n del distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando porque se casó con el señor Carlos Alfaro Guzmán, tiene 2 hijos varones y 2 hijas mujeres aún estudiantes.
Ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de animales mayores, pero ella independientemente se dedica a la costura y a la elaboración de manualidades, también hace quesos y vende leche, pero últimamente no pudo trabajar por encontrarse delicada de salud. Su negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, es cuando se independiza del negocio de su esposo creando otra entrada económica para su hogar, compró cuajada y elaboró quesos, también compró animales menores y algunos materiales para su costura.
Con este préstamo de 100 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará un cerdo a 25 soles y el resto lo gastará en material para manualidades para vender en Navidad.
Su gran sueño es tener su propio capital para no tener deudas pendientes.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa María is 36 years of age and a member of the community bank Mujeres del Mañana ("Women of Tomorrow"). She lives on the street Antenor Orrego of the district of Agallpampa, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through secondary school completely but did not continue studying because she got married to Señor Carlos Alfaro Guzmán. She has two sons and two daughters who are still students. She and her husband together are dedicated to buying and selling animals. She works independently sewing and making craftworks and she also makes cheeses and sells milk, but lately she couldn't work because she found herself in a delicate state of health. Her business is located in her home. With her first loan of 300 Soles, repaid in four months, she made herself independent of her husband's business and created another economic source for their household. She bought curd and made cheeses; she also bought young animals and some materials for sewing. With this loan for 100 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a pig for 25 soles and the rest of it will be spent on material for craftworks to sell during Christmas. Her great dream is to have her own capital so she won't have pending debts anymore.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pig and material for craftworks.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo S. is 41 years old and sells Kmer Noodle in Bathrotes Village in the Preynhy Commune in Pursat Province. Her husband, Mr. Bunna Doch, 43, is in the Cambodian Military and earns a salary of $50 per month. Together they have five children, all of whom are in school.

Keo is seeking a loan of $100 to buy rice and other ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients

loans.name: Becky

texts.en: Becky O. sells drinks and provisions. Her husband is an automobile mechanic. Becky is 48 years old and married with nine children. She is a Lapo client. She needs the loan amount of 70,000 NGN ($600 US) to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is now settled in the Fizuli region, Dilagarda village. He is married, with two children, and he has been in the business of selling clothes for five years. Ramiz was born in 1960. He is requesting a loan to he can increase his inventory and better supply his customers' demands. This will help him better provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in his business

loans.name: Sandra Alina

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Sandra es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Sandra vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Sandra junto a su esposo venden peces ornamentales, accesorios de peceras, entre otros productos. Sandra en sus tiempos libres hace peluches.
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas para peluches.
Los sueños de Sandra son salir adelante y seguir ahorrando para el estudio superior de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the communal bank "Buena Suerte" (Good Luck). Sandra is married and has two children. She is 42 years old. Sandra sells cosmetic products through catalogues. She offers her products to friends and family members. Her customers pay her when they receive the product and sometime they make payments for the products. Sandra and her husband also sell ornamental fish, accessories for fish tanks and other related products. In her free time Sandra makes stuffed animals. Sandra needs a loan of 1,250 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of fabric to make stuffed animals. Sandra's dreams are to work hard, to get ahead, and to continue saving money for her children's high school and university educations.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to make stuffed animals

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu S. is 48 years old. He is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. Abdu sells motor and bicycle spare parts in Iganga. He is using the loan to purchase parts such as rims, tyres, tubes, and brake pads. 

The business earns him an approximate profit of ush 700,000 per month. With eight years of business experience, Abdu looks forward to opening a spare parts wholesale shop. He also dreams of sending his children to the university.

loans.use: Purchasing rims, tyres, tubes, brake pads.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan A. est une femme de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de l’huile rouge depuis 10 ans à womé. Elle achète ses marchandises auprès des producteurs et les revend à Lomé, la capitale. Massan espère avec ce crédit relancer son activité en payant plus de l’huile rouge et louer un magasin pour le stockage
texts.en:
Massan A., age 49, is married and the mother of 5 children. She's been reselling red oil (palm oil) for 10 years in Womé. She gets her supplies from producers, and resell them in Lomé, the capital. With this loan, Massan hopes to revitalize her business by buying more red oil, and by renting a store for stocking her goods.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell red oil (palm oil)

loans.name: Sévérine

texts.fr:
L. Sévérine est née le 18 Avril 1979 à Tori agonsa; elle est originaire de missérété un petit village situé à 15 Km de la ville de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Sévérine a laissé l'école après son échec au Certificat d'Aptitude Professionnel en comptabilité. Sévérine est mère de deux garçons: HALIM âgé de sept (7) ans est en première année du cours primaire; et le second enfant âgé de trois (3) ans est à la maternelle. Les charges familiales sont assurées par le mari de Sévérine. Le couple vit à Kowegbo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou. Après l'abandon de l'école, Sévérine a commencé par aider sa maman dans la vente des boissons alcoolisées (liqueurs) à Tokpa, marché international du Bénin. Aidée par sa maman, Sévérine a créé son propre étalage de boissons alcoolisées (liqueurs) dans le même marché international du BENIN. La majorité des clients de  Sévérine est faite de Nigérians qui achètent ces boissons en gros. Sévérine a besoin de plus d'argent pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Sévérine a aussi pour projet de diversifier son activité vers la vente de tissus. C'est pour toutes ces raisons que Sévérine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Sévérine L. was born on April 18 1979 in Tori Agonsa; her roots are in Missérété, a little village situated 15 km from the town of Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Sévérine left off school after she failed her CAP exam in accounting.

Sévérine is the mother of 2 boys, the older, Halim, age 7, is in the first year of primary school; the second child, who is 3 years old, is in pre-school. The family's living expenses are covered by Sévérine's husband. The couple lives in Kowegbo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou.

After leaving school, Sévérine began by helping her mother sell alcoholic beverages (liqueurs) in Tokpa, the international market of Benin. Helped by her mother, Sévérine set up her own display of alcoholic beverages (liqueurs) at that same international market in Benin. The majority of Sévérine's customers are Nigerians, who buy these beverages wholesale. Sévérine needs more money so as to satisfy her customers. Sévérine also has plans to diversify her business toward the sale of cloth. For all these reasons, Sévérine is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of alcoholic drinks (liqueurs) and cloth

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en:
I. Abdurashid is 52 years old and was born in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is the father of three children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family.

A very ambitious man, Abdurashid would like to buy a greater number of cattle, and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of $700 for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Abdurashid will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima D. est un vendeur de colas au marché central de Ziguinchor. Ce produit est au centre de beaucoup de cérémomies au Sénégal, c'est pourquoi ce commerçant sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son stock et réaliser le maximum de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ibrahima D. is a seller of kola nuts at the central market of Ziguinchor. Many ceremonies in Senegal are centered on this produce. This is why this merchant is requesting a loan, so as to boost his inventory and to maximize his profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in kola nuts

loans.name: Mhmad

texts.en:
Mhmad is a 39 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Mhmad has a minimarket for almost two years. Mhmad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mhmad has requested a loan.  
Mhmad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhmad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mhmad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: Dolores es soltera, de 39 años de edad, trabaja en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como responsable de presupuesto, de oficio contador público, con 5 años de servicio.  Esta solicitando su 3er credtio para la construccion de un sumidero con las siguientes medidas: 2 mts de ancho x 2.5 mts de largo, tambien desea construir un baño de 1.5 mts de ancho x 2 mts de largo, con inodoro y lavamanos, desea realizar esta obra ya que es de suma necesidad, pues las aguas pluviales estan causando muchos problemas y solamente a traves del credito es que se puede concreitzar la obra que tiene planificado, este credito esta garantizado, pues está pactado con un vonvenio a traves de la alcaldia y ademas respaldado con garantia de electrodomesticos.
texts.en:
39-year old Dolores is single and works in the mayor’s office in Juigalpa. She is in charge of budgets in the public accounts office where she has worked for five years. Dolores is asking for her third loan. It will be used to construct a drainage system measuring 2m wide x 2.5m long. She also wants to build a bathroom 1.5m wide and 2m long with a toilet and washbasin. It is very important to do these projects because the rains are causing many problems, and only through a line of credit can Dolores complete the work she is planning. The loan is guaranteed through an agreement with the mayor’s office, and also through a lien on her electrical appliances.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a drainage system

loans.name: Mukhtaran Abdul Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran baji is a wife of A. R. and has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband has a business selling vegetables. He has been doing this work for over 3 years. Mukhtaran baji wants to set a good example for her grandchildren and for her family. In spite of her age, she keeps working at sewing clothes for her own well being and that of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to advance her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Hamidan baji and Sumera baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Jamila baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: “Mukhtaran baji is showing her sewing machine in this picture”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. owns a small spot where she cooks and sells oats, rice and beans at Amsisanu in Elmina. Margaret has received primary education. She is divorced and has 6 dependants. Margaret has been selling oats, rice and beans since 2000. She is responsible for paying fees and bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice to be cooked for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to raise money to support her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to be cooked for sale.

loans.name: Mignonmi Malherne

texts.en:
Mignonmi is married and has two young children. She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, where she is a hairdresser. She was an apprentice in another salon for four years and then decided to open her own business. At her salon, she cuts and braids hair. She sells a variety of cosmetic products, hairstreaks, shoes, and necklaces. Right outside of her salon, she sells cookies, candy, and other snacks. 

Mignonmi is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner, to replenish her supplies and to better respond to the needs of her clientele. In the future, if she is able to secure more funds, Mignonmi would also like to sell pagnes, which are Beninese fabrics.

loans.use: Hairstreaks and cosmetic products

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio S. is from the village of  Salay in Misamis Oriental. He is 52 years old. Eleuterio is widowed and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Eleuterio runs a sari-sari (variety) store where he sells both food and daily-use products in the local community. Eleuterio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eleuterio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleuterio is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will Eleuterio's first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to educate his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Dely

texts.en:
Ma. Dely A. is 40 years old and lives in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City, with her husband Sonny, 44, who works as a company driver. They have three children, two of whom are attending school. Ma. Dely has been in business for the last year buying and selling basic household necessities. She is now concentrating on food items ranging from frozen processed meats, fresh meats, and eggs, to dried fish. She sells her items in a leased space and earns 13,000 PHP net income per month.

Ma. Dely joined Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT), in 2006 and has been enjoying the warm ambience of the weekly gathering of her fellowship group. Now on her ninth loan cycle with CCT, she has applied for a 22,000 PHP loan, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She hopes to have her own stall in the marketplace soon.

About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.
CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El cliente es el Sr. Marcelino G. Chamorro es casado tiene un hijo posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. Es microempresario propietario de un local comercial en Maria Auxiliadora se dedica a la de artículos de primera necesidad, bebidas, artículos de bazar etc.
 Cuenta con 2 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos la misma es cliente recurrente de la sucursal, el destino de la operación será para compras de mercaderías de primera necesidad harina, azúcar, bebidas en cantidad que le estaría saliendo en menor precio y que le generará mayor ganancia lo cual se le otorgo 5MM a 12 meses.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías de primera necesidad harina, azucar, aceite.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Locumba” del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 04 hijos, vive en el Barrio Casani, ella  tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudios de educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace medio año, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ovinos.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, ella luego los venderá en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank “Señor de Locumba” located in Yunguyo District, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno; she is 37 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children. She lives in the Casani neighborhood and has had the opportunity to complete her high school studies. Juana has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six months. Her first loan was for PEN 300, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling sheep. Today, she is requesting a new loan of PEN 1,000, which will allow her to buy more sheep to fatten and resell at the local markets. Juana's biggest wish is to keep working. She loves going to loan center meetings and to save.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly M. is from the village of Conat. She is 42 years old. Jelly is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jelly owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jelly has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jelly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena A., a young entrepreneur from Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  She is 33 years old.  Her husband Joey, 36, is also a vendor.  

Lorena owns and manages a general store and sells various toys for children. She earns P4,000.00 a month.

She applied for a new loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for P10,000.00 as additional capital for her business.  She’ll be purchasing new toy designs.  It has been Lorena’s long sought after dream to have her own toy store in a big shopping mall.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase new toy designs

loans.name: Gerges

texts.en: Gerges is a 53-year-old married man and the father of 2 children. He has owned a vegetable shop since 2000 and has 16 years of experience in the agriculture sector. Today, Gerges is asking for a loan of $1,200 to renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica, el señor Julio Cesar C. se ha destacado arduamente por ser muy trabajador dedicándose a su actividad agrícola por medio de la siembra de frijoles el cual se ha dedicado con el fin de obtener los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

Es importante destacar que ella actualmente necesita comprar insumos y alambre para elaborar una cerca para dar protección a la siembra de frijoles y luego tener una cosecha exitosa con el fin de comercializar los frijoles y obtener ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica, Sr. Julio Cesar C. has stood out for being a very hardworker in his agriculture business through the sowing of beans, which he does in order to earn income for the improvement of the level of his life and that of his family.

It is important to point out that he currently needs to buy raw materials and wire to make a fence in order to protect the sowing of the beans, and then to have a successful harvest, in order to market the beans and earn income for the improvement of the level of life.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural raw materials and barbed wire

loans.name: Godelia

texts.en: Godelia P. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Godelia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Godelia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Godelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 150 PHP daily. In 2005, Godelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Godelia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Godelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nao's Group

texts.en: The village bank loan which consists of sixteen people is located in Preak Khmaer village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nao S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members and they will all use the loan for different purposes. She is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Tub Yuon, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support their family. In the field, Mrs. Nao S. faces a problem because the soil is infertile, but she does not have money to purchase fertilizers. Thus, Mrs. Nao S. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers and expand her vegetable business. She is a mother of three children; one is a security guard, one is a farmer, while the other is a student in secondary school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 36-year-old married lady with three children in school.  She owns a retail shop where she sells curtains, bedding and detergents. She has been in the business for four years and has one employee.   Previously, she was tailoring.  She intends to add to her stock of curtains and bedding with the loan of 40,000 KES. She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her grow her business.  She hopes to expand her business so as to earn more income.  Virginia is aiming high for success.

loans.use: To buy more curtains and bedding to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
l  señor Pedro es casado, tiene 60 años, con 2 hijas,  menores de edad.
El señor  y su esposa  se dedican a la venta ambulante de ropas (a crédito).
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar stock de mercaderías; en esta temporada ellos entregan en forma masiva las mercaderías y después van cobrando en forma mensual y semanal  dependiendo de los ingresos de los clientes.
El señor tiene suerte de contar con el apoyo de toda la familia, gracias a eso cuenta con casa propia  y van incrementando sus ingresos,  por lo que considero que es una persona a quien debemos apoyar constantemente, ya sea económica y moralmente.
texts.en:
Pedro is married, is 60 years old, and has 2 daughters that are minor in age. Pedro and his wife are travelling sales people who sell clothes on credit. The loan is sought to increase the stock in merchandise. During this season they deliver a great amount of merchandise, and then charge their clients either on a weekly or monthly basis depending on their clients’ income. Pedro is fortunate to count on his family’s support, as a result of that support he owns his home and his income continues to increase. For this reason, Pedro should be consistently supported both economically and through moral support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Maria D. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Alfonzo en el municipio de Trojes departamento de El Paraiso. Jose se dedica al comercio, comenzo su  negocio vendiendo en su carrito y ahora tiene 3 puestos ubicados en diferentes puntos comerciales del municipio de trojes. Don Chema se caracteriza por los precios comodos que brinda a sus clientes y por la amabilidad con la que  atiende.
tambien sale a vender en su carrito a diferentes aldeas y caserios de la localidad lo que le genera ingresos permanentes. el credito lo invertira para surtir mas su negocio donde tenga varios prodcutos que ofrecer a sus clientes, de tal manera no dejar irse al cliente sin comprar nada.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Maria D. is 46 years old and lives in the Alfonzo neighborhood of the town of Trojes, Department of El Paraiso. He is a merchant who began his business selling from a small cart and now has three vending posts located in different commercial areas within the town of Trojes. Don Chema is known for offering his customers comfortable prices and providing them friendly service. He also travels to different neighborhoods and villages with his cart as a way of generating permanent income. The loan he is requesting will be invested in more merchandise for his business so that he will have everything and can prevent a customer from leaving without having bought something.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rubber sandals & plastic utensils

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a 36-year-old widow and mother of four children. She lives with her family in Likoni, Mombasa. Mwanaisha makes and sells juice. This she initiated in 2005 to supplement her other business (selling new clothes). Her clients mostly are schoolchildren and the local community. She uses water, sugar, juice coloring detergent and packages. All this she buys in Mombasa town. To cope with the demand, Mwanaisha needs Kshs 20,000 to further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ran U. is 47 years old and she is the village bank president who has selected by the twenty-four members located I. Sdau Kanlaeng village I. Kandal province. The members will each use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Ran U. is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Khon Cheok, raises and sells chickens. With these two businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family.

Mrs. Ran U. decided to ask for a loan to buy chicken feed to support her husband’s business and to buy more vegetables to enlarge her own business activities. With this loan, she hopes to increase their income to improve their family living.

This couple has four children: three are attending the local school while the youngest is only 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her husband's business and to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jhon Silver

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JHON ES UN JOVEN SOLTERO, DEDICADO AL AMBITO DE LA PINTURA DESDE  SU NIÑEZ, YA QUE SU PAPA SE DEDICABA A LA PINTURA DE CASAS Y DEPARTAMENTOS, ESTE TRABAJO LO REALIZA JUNTO A SU HERMANO MAYOR CON EL QUE REALIZA TRABAJOS DE PINTURA EN LA ZONA DONDE ELLOS VIVEN, Y SIENDO ESTE SU UNICO INGRESO IMPORTANTE  PARA MANTENERSE Y MANTENER  A SUS HERMANOS  MENORES Y AYUDAR ASUS PADRES, EL TAMBIEN REALIZA TRABAJOS DE CONTRUCCION Y PINTURA AL MISMO TIEMPO. GRACIAS A SU EMPRENDIMENTO DURANTE ESTE TIEMPO ELLOS SON BUSCADOS PARA REALIZAR DISTINTAS OBRAS, EL ANHELO QUE TIENE JHON ES LA DE CREAR SU PROPIA EMPRESA QUE PRESTA SERVICIO DE PINTURA AL CLIENTE Y CONSOLIDARSE EN EL MERCADO. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA PINTURA AL POR CANTIDAD Y ASI PODER REAÑLIZAR SU TRABAJO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACI0ON DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Jhon is young and unmarried, and has worked in painting since he was a child. His father also worked painting houses and apartments. Jhon currently works alongside his older bother. They do painting jobs in the area where they live, and this is their main source of income to support themselves and their younger siblings, and to help their parents. Jhon also works doing jobs that involve both painting and construction. Thanks to their enterprising spirit, at this point in time the brothers are sought out to undertake various jobs. It is Jhon's wish to build up his own painting business and stake out a place for himself in the market. With the loan money he will buy paint in bulk in order to keep up with his work. He is very thankful to Emprender [the Kiva field partner] for the confidence it has shown in him by giving him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 46 years old, married with 4 children. Her eldest child is 22 years old while the youngest child is 10 years old. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband is an electrician and he also supports their home. She sells mouth watery Nigerian cooked foods to make a living in Benin City. She needs to expand her business in order to make more profits. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita R. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Pacita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Pacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en: T. Ngô Thị's main source of income comes from providing waste disposal services in her community. She is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. is married and has four school-age children. T. has been in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,800,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,006,000 VND from SEDA which was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. This will be her third loan from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. T. is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Nghiêm Xá nhóm 18 (Nhóm 18)". (20201020092) About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nguyễn Thị Huề (0) is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services. 2. Mẫn Thị V. (0) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector. 3. Nguyễn Thị X. (0) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nghiêm Thị H. (0) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 5. Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business providing waste management services. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Ngô Thị (20201020092) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá nhóm 18 (Nhóm 18). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ xử lý chất thải cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. T. hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 13 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND. Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.006.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị Huề (0) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. 2. Mẫn Thị V. (0) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 3. Nguyễn Thị X. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nghiêm Thị H. (0) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 5. Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide a waste disposal service

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Y. Philomène est née le 30 Juin 1972 et est mariée à METONOU Ludovic. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a près de quinze ans que Philomène s'est installée au quartier Wlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins du foyer. Il y a environs douze ans que Philomène mène comme activité la vente de produits de mer (poissons et crevettes) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Philomène vend également de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons et aux crevettes). Philomène achète ses produits de mer au Port de pêche à Cotonou. Philomène est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. En vue d'élever davantage le niveau de son activité et d'accroître encore plus sa clientèle, Philomène sollicite un autre crédit pour augmenter ses stocks de produits.
texts.en:
Philomène Y. was born June 30, 1972 and is married to Ludovic Metonou. The couple has two children who are both in school. Nearly fifteen years ago, Philomène moved to the neighborhood of Wlacodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she lives with her children and her husband. Together, the couple supports their various household needs. For almost twelve years, Philomène has been in business selling seafood (fish and shrimp) in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Philomène also sells food (rice, corn pastries in a sauce of fish and shrimp). Philomène buys her seafood at the fish port in Cotonou. Philomène is a long-time customer of ALIDé, who has always successfully paid back her loans. With an eye to raising her level of business and growing her customer base even more, Philomène is requesting an additional loan to increase her stocks of her products.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, corn, sauces, and seafood (fish and shrimp)

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
la joven Eva R. M. tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años, viven en la casa de la mama quien  tambien se dedica al comercio.
Eva ademas de dedicarse a su negocio tambien se dedica a estudiar en la universidad por la noches.
Eva vivio tres años en los estados donde logro ahorrar dinero para establecer su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de trajes de niño, calzado, fajas, pantalones, carteras, etc.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hijo y de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eva R. M. is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She is a single mother with a six year old son. They live at the house of her mother, who also works as a merchant.

In addition to managing a business, Eva is a student who attends university classes at night. She lived in the United States for three years and was able to save money for starting her business. This loan will be used to buy children’s outfits, shoes, belts, pants, handbags, and other items. Her earnings are needed to cover expenses for her son and his education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing, accessories, and handbags

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr:
Madame Bineta G.  est une veuve de 52 ans qui habite  à Ndeugagne à Yoff. Elle est mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 21 et 26 ans.
Madame G.  évolue  dans le commerce depuis plus de 40 ans. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi parce que c’était celle du Prophète  Mohamed  PSL. Et par ce biais son objectif étant de réaliser des bénéfices et de  satisfaire ses besoins personnels  ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, elle s’active dans la vente de beignets et de poissons séchés.
Madame G. est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis avril 2009. Elle a déjà bénéficie d’un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs qui sera destiné  a l’chat de poissons séchés en Mauritanie. Une partie du financement sera utilisée pour développera  sa vente de beignets.
L’accroissement de ses bénéfices  sera un moyen pour elle de contribuer a l’amélioration  du cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bineta G. is a 52 year old widow who lives in Ndeugagne in Yoff. She is the mother of two children between 21 and 26 years of age. Mrs. G. has more than 40 years experience in business. She chose her business because it was the business of the Prophet Mohammed PSL. She went into the sale of beignets and dried fish and by this means her goal is to make a profit and satisfy her personal needs as well as those of her children. Mrs. G. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since April of 2009. She already received a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs which will be used to buy dried fish in Mauritania. One part of the financing will be used to bolster her beignet sales. The growth of her earnings will enable her to contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her working capital

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz lives in a city called Borewala, with her family, in Pakistan. She is 25 years old, is a housewife, and has one daughter and a son. They are both illiterate because Imtiaz is not in a position to afford their school fees.

Her husband paints walls and buildings and is the only breadwinner in the family. Sometimes he manages to get work and sometimes not, it is very difficult for Imtiaz to survive financially. She has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially support her husband, who will buy different colors of paint boxes in order to offer better services to his clients.

Imtiaz is hopeful that with an improved business condition, she will be able to send her children to school some day. This is the first time she has applied for a loan to any MFI. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her and for her family as well.

loans.use: To purchase paint boxes for paint business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is 54 years old, married and has five children between the ages of 12 and 28. Three of her children are still in school. She sells clothes to earn her daily bread. Most of her customers are low-income earners.

Beatrice has been in business for four years. She considers herself lucky to be a member of Faulu Kenya because she can easily access financial resources. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to add to her stock of t-shirts and blouses. She hopes to start selling cereals in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran lives in a city called Gujranwala, which is a big industrial city in Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. Both of her elder sons work in the factory and earn a small income. Her elder daughter does sewing work at her home. Her younger children are getting their education by attending school. Bashiran does business in order to financially support her family. She sells clothes in her native city. Her husband's name is M. R.. He is a loader by trade and loads different items such as construction supplies and fruits & vegetables. He put loads on his donkey cart and delivers them from one place to another. They have been living in a two-room little house made of bricks for the last 15 years.  

Bashiran has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because the old cart has become rough and rotten in different areas. Due to its roughness Bashiran’s husband can’t put heavy loads on it and, as a result, his business is affected. Bashiran is hopeful that by purchasing a new donkey cart, her husband will be able to do his work more comfortably and make more income.
She is a regular user of Asasah and has a good credit record. This is her fourth loan application.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Harleth Patricia

texts.es:
Se acerca la temporada de fin de año y Harleth S., una joven madre de un niño de 4 años, se prepara adornando su miscelánea y ofreciendo artículos empacados en papel de regalo, para hacer mas perceptible a su clientela la expresión del   espíritu navideño y de fin de año,  fechas en las cuales las familias manifiestan su unidad e intercambian regalos  que alegran esta bella época.  En  el barrio el Campito de la ciudad de Barranquilla y en toda Colombia, este es un momento de mucho repunte comercial, y en este sentido las más favorecidas   son las microempresas, que por estar ubicadas en   sectores cercanos al lugar donde habitan las familias, logran una rotación constante de su mercancía.
La idea de Harleth  de emprender esta miscelánea, fue impulsada por su madre, una confeccionista muy querida en el barrio el Campito, teniendo en cuenta que al no poder continuar sus estudios debía buscar la forma de generar ingresos para apoyar el crecimiento de su pequeño hijo, y eso es lo que  ocurre en la actualidad. 

Harleth está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque necesita una inyección de capital de trabajo para su negocio especialmente en esta época en que se incrementarán sus ventas, siempre y cuando tenga todo lo que sus clientes necesiten. Ella con su credikiva comprará   mercancía variada especialmente juguetería y otros artículos de temporada,  como regalos, ropa  y cosméticos  que engalanarán su negocio y a las familias que forman parte de su exclusiva clientela.
texts.en: The end of the year is approaching and Harleth S., a young mother of a four-year old son, prepares by decorating her small shop and offering gift wrapped items to show off to her clients her Holiday spirit.  This is a time when families show their unity and exchange gifts to brighten up this beautiful period.  In the Campito neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla and all over Colombia, this is a crucial commercial moment, being the most favorable for the smaller businesses since they are located in residential areas close to families.  As a result, they successfully have a constant turnover of merchandise.  Harleth's idea of starting this shop was encouraged by her mother, a beloved tailor in the Campito neighborhood.  Realizing that she wouldn't be able to continue her studies further, she had to find a way to earn money to support and raise her young son, which is what she is currently doing.  Harleth is applying for her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo because she needs an investment of work capital in her business, especially during this time when her sales will increase, if and only she has everything that her clients need.  With this credit, she will purchase a variety of merchandise, specifically toys and other seasonal items, such as gifts, clothes, and cosmetics that would embellish her business and the families that form part of her exclusive clientele.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise, specifically toys and other seasonal items.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
A. Stella is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child who is not currently in school.  Stella has a beauty salon business, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Stella hopes to open up a big salon.

loans.use: To purchase braids for the hair

loans.name: Usalama Group

texts.en:
Kizito Mahunidi is in his mid-thirties and is single. He has been running a sewing business since 2000. He specializes in sewing garments into traditional Tanzanian clothing. The shop is open from 7:00 am to 8:30 pm and earns Kizito a good monthly profit.

This will be Kizito's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Kizito used his first loan to increase supplies of material such as thread and garments, a loan which he has successfully repaid. Kizito will use his second loan to once again increase stocks as he is meeting an increasing demand for his products. Kizito's dream is to one day open a big shop from which he can both produce and sell his products.

Kizito will share this loan with his loan group Usalama, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Kizito is the first on the left wearing a white shirt with a blue mark.

loans.use: Increase her stock of garments.

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
La Señora.
