Carmen T. es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por la parroquia del Sinincay en donde su gente se dedica a la cría animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población sale a la ciudad en donde desempeñan varias actividades, también han migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora Carmen es muy joven con apenas 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad que esta estudiando en el pre kínder. Su esposo labora en una fabrica de joyas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá pero independientes.
 
Doña Carmen se dedica a trabajar en una imprenta, actividad que la desempeña hace 7 años,  labora de ocho de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a viernes. También se dedica hace 3 años a vender ropa a sus familiares.
 
Se encuentra en su quinto crédito en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá. Con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para la temporada navideña. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen T. is a member of the community bank Loma de la Cruz.  She lives in Sinincay parish where people are involved in livestock and agriculture.  Much of the population has left for the city where they have various activities, they have also emigrated to various parts of the world in search of a better job.

Señora Carmen is very young, she's only 24 and is married with a 4 year old child who attends pre-kindergarten.  Her husband works in a jewelry factory.  They don't have their own house so they live in her mom's house, but independently.

Doña Carmen is works in a printing business, where she has been for 7 years.  She works from 8 am until 6 pm, Monday through Friday.   She also has been working for 3 years selling clothes to their families.

This is her fifth loan in the community bank and was suggested by her mother. With her new loan she will invest in buying more clothes for the holiday season.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: Buying clothes.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. She is separated and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates retail store. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her work.

In 2008, Jessica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
Jessica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital for her retail store. Jessica plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. She will use some of the revenue to meet her family's basic needs, and save some for future use and house renovations.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her retail store.

loans.name: Janarbek

texts.en:
Janarbek is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children, aged between 2 and 7, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son attends a local primary school while his youngest two daughters are in kindergarten. 

Janarbek operates a car repair and service business. He started his business in 2000 by providing a car repair on call service and since then he has found a success in his business which was allowed him to open his own car repair shop. In addition to supplementing his earnings, he purchased old cars in order to resell them after making repairs which gives him considerable profit. For the future, he hopes to expand his car repair center. 

Janarbek is a modest and decent person and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his car repair center.

loans.use: To expand his car repair center

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena tiene una casita por la zona D. Wilacota, donD. atienD. el negocio D. venta D. pan, refrescos, abarrotes, etc., ella viva con su esposo y sus hijos menores que están en edad escolar, el esposo es albañil, quien tiene contratos por los Yungas muchas veces y en otras por la zona sur, ella saca montos pequeños, para compra D. mercadería y para la venta D. verduras, ya que paralelamente a esa actividad ella tiene un puesto D. verduras en el mercado 29 D. enero D. Chasquipampa, productos que trae D. su pueblo que es Totorani y D. Rio Abajo, es una cliente muy cumplida. por lo que anteriormente también fue cliente Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Filomena has a small house in the Wilacota area where she also runs a store selling bread, soft drinks, groceries etc. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband is a builder who works often in the Yungas area and also in other parts of the south.

Filomena takes out small loans to buy merchandise. She also sells vegetables in Chasquipampa’s January 29th market.  She transports the produce from her village of Totorani and the Abajo river. Filomena is known to be a very responsible person; she has worked with Kiva previously.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y comidas, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para el restaurant como carnes, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Segundina is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Segundina is 49 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She works from 7.00am to 9.00pm.  Segundina would like to expand and improve her restaurant.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to cook in her restaurant such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

Segundina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to cook in her restaurant such as meat, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia B. is from the village of Brgy. Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 school-age children. To make a living, Julia raises crops. Her main source of income is planting and harvesting rice for sale. Julia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Julia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Julia is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Julia's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul M., 48, is the leader of this group. It’s been 10 years since she and her husband began cultivating land and breeding livestock. They are very thankful that during this time they’ve managed to build a house for the entire family, a place where their four children can feel comfortable. The purpose of this loan request is to purchase additional cattle for further reselling. Nazgul is well-acquainted with the lending rules and pledges to repay the loan on time.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF) a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es: El señor Perfecto es Chofer de taxi; el crédito lo quiere para comprar material de escritorio ya que su esposa tiene una librería y  una fotocopiadora. Estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso para la manutención de su familia.Vive  en casa Propia ubicada en la zona de Tacagua la ciudad de La Paz y  tiene un hijo. El cliente se siente satisfecho con los préstamos que le otorgamos. Esta es la primera vez que se canalizará uno de sus préstamos a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Perfecto is a taxi driver. The loan will be used to buy writing materials since his wife has a bookstore and a photocopier, and these are their main sources of income to support their family. Perfecto lives in his own house located in the Tacagua region of the city of La Paz and he has one son. He is satisfied with the loans he has been given. This is the first time that one of his loans has been channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy writing materials for his wife's book store

loans.name: Sork

texts.en: Sork S. is a 43-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is married to Lim Kheng, age 48. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have four single children. One of them works as a sewing worker at the manufactory and has a proper salary every month. Sork S. will be adding her loan to her personal savings to buy a piece of her neighbor’s farmland. The land is near her house, which is in a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: to buy a piece of her neighbor’s farmland.

loans.name: Julia Janet

texts.es:
Julia de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones a futuro. Por eso es maestra de una escuela “Mixta Salesiana”. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 15h00pm todos los días. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir trabajando ya que no está casada pero tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad.  Por ahora quiere construir mejor su casa para poder darle una mejor vida a su hijo. Quiere el préstamo para comprar cemento, zinc, bloques.
texts.en:
32 year-old Julia is a hard-working woman who has many aspirations for the future.  She is a teacher at 'Mixta Salesiana' school.  She works from 7.00am to 3.00pm every day.

Julia has many aspirations to continue working since she is not married but has a 5 year-old son.  Right now, she would like to better build her home in order to be able to provide her son with a better life.  She would like this loan to buy cement, metal sheets and blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement, metal sheets and blocks

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia en el caserío Tierra Rajada ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la  parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Tomas se dedica al comercio de animales menores como ganado ovino y caprino. Tiene una experiencia de 6 años en este rubro. El recorre los alrededores de su caserío comprando ganado para engorde. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los revende en la ciudad de Chiclayo y Trujillo. Realiza ventas al crédito y al contado. Su esposa también se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como ovejos, cabros y chanchos. Ellos trabajan juntos para solventar sus gastos familiares y brindar una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos menores. Desea invertir en su negocio con la compra de más animales menores y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Tomas es muy trabajador. Es bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Tomas tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia en el caserío Tierra Rajada ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la  parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Tomas se dedica al comercio de animales menores como ganado ovino y caprino. Tiene una experiencia de 6 años en este rubro. El recorre los alrededores de su caserío comprando ganado para engorde. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los revende en la ciudad de Chiclayo y Trujillo. Realiza ventas al crédito y al contado. Su esposa también se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como ovejos, cabros y chanchos. Ellos trabajan juntos para solventar sus gastos familiares y brindar una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos menores. Desea invertir en su negocio con la compra de más animales menores y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Tomas es muy trabajador. Es bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.

loans.use: to buy livesstock and feed

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. Mrs. Sem, who was B. in 1972, was selected to be the group leader by the other members.

Mrs. Sem is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also earns a living by breeding pigs. 

Her husband, Mr. Khut, who was B. in 1973, is an iron welder, and he is also a fisherman. This couple has two children. One is a grocery seller and one is a student. 

In order to support her pig breeding, Mrs. Sem would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of Afghani food, beverages and other things

loans.name: Berryl

texts.en: Berryl is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She sells second-hand clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for seven years. Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she has become more financially stable and she can provide for her family without strain. Her dream is to open a boutique in the future. She has requested 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Rissa

texts.en:
Rissa  is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Rissa has a retail shop that sells electronic loads from several networks. She has had this business for a year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional electronic loads from several networks like SMART & GLOBE.

Rissa  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rissa  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads from several networks like SMART & GLOBE

loans.name: Anna Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Anna Maria works hard to support her family. 

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Anna Maria is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business. 

Anna Maria has been sustaining her business activities with her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 30 años, reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí conformó su familia junto a Natalia, su esposa desde hace 9 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Cintia y Angie a los cuidan en su casa propia. El trabajo de este joven padre de familia se centra en “la agricultura”. Su principal actividad económica. La siembra de café en sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, es lo que más le gusta; ya que tiene 10 años de experiencia en el cuidado y cultivo de los mismos. Además de ver como en estos meses el costo por kilo del grano de café subió considerablemente. Este año venderá su producción a la cooperativa “Café Montaña” y “Bioazul”, donde espera obtener una buena ganancia. Pero consiente que la cosecha se realiza una vez al año, trabaja a la vez en trasporte público, con un motocarro que alquila, cubriendo las rutas de Pichanaki a Puerto Sotani. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, por ello desea en este año comprar uno propio, que le sirva también para trasladar su cosecha de los terrenos de cultivo hacia la ciudad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el desarrollo de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juan, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado, en completar el dinero adquirido para la compra de un vehículo llamado “torito” (especie de movilidad para el trasporte público).
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old and lives in the indigenous community of Shankivironi (in the central Peruvian rainforest).  There he started his family together with Natalia, his wife of 9 years.  The couple have two children: Cintia and Angie, who they care for in their own home.  This young father's work is 'farming'.  It is his main business activity.  Growing coffee on his 3 hectares of farmland is what he most enjoys doing because he has 10 years experience in caring for and growing this crop.  He has also seen how, over the last few months, the price per kilo for coffee beans has risen considerably.  This year he will sell his produce to the “Café Montaña” and “Bio Azul” cooperative where he hopes to obtain good profits.  However, as he is aware that his coffee harvest only happens once a year, he also works providing a public transport service with a vehicle that he rents.  He covers routes from Pichanaki to Puerto Sotani.  His work is going very well but this year he would like to buy a vehicle of his own which he can also use when transporting his harvest from his farmland to the city. 

Juan belongs to the "Los Clavelitos de Shakivironi" community bank and this is his third loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation in helping him reach his goals.  For his part, he pledges once more to make his loan repayments on time as he has done with his previous loans.  Juan enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.

Juan, with your support, will invest the money he has requested by adding it to a sum of money he already has in order to buy a vehicle called a 'torito' (a type of motorcycle taxi which is used for public transportation).

loans.use: to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, es un hombre valiente y trabajador, tiene 37 años; que junto a su esposa Dina, cuidan de sus 3 menores hijos; Fresia, Frank, y Denis. Los que en armonía familiar viven en su casa propia, ubicada  en el caserío de Yanama Alta. El trabajo que desarrolla desde hace 15 años, es la agricultura; donde siembra diversos productos oriundos como papa, arveja y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder invertir, pues su secreto es la siembra escalonada, que consiste en sembrar diversos productos, para poder contrarrestar las variaciones de  los precios en el mercado. Ahora después de su próxima cosecha, comenzará a sembrar habas, adelantándose a la temporada, de esa manera estabilizará su economía. Aparte de tener 5 toros con los que surca la tierra, ganando así S/. 60 soles diarios, pero esta actividad lo realiza en sus tiempos libres, por lo que, según sus propias palabras es “su pasatiempo”. Los planes de Félix, es adquirir un auto con el que pueda dedicarse al transporte público, además de poder tener sus propios terrenos agrícolas ya que trabaja alquilando grandes extensiones de tierra. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Yanama”, y esté es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es un socio activo y comprometido con el trabajo que desempeñan los integrantes de su banco. Por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Félix, cosechará flor de gladiolo dentro de unos días, por eso de recibir su apoyo está pensando invertir el dinero del préstamo; en la compra de 1 bolsa de semilla de arveja para lo que necesitará también 6 sacos de fertilizantes naturales y así comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Félix is a courageous and hardworking man. He is 37 years old, and along with his wife Dina cares for his three minor children: Fresia, Frank and Denis, who live in familial harmony in their own home, located in the hamlet of Yanama Alta. 

The work he has done for 15 years is farming, in which he grows various crops native to the area such as potatoes, peas and gladioli. What he enjoys most about his work is to be able to invest, since his secret is to plant crops on a staggered basis, which consists of planting a variety of products so as to counteract fluctuations in market prices. Now after his next harvest he will begin sowing beans, ahead of season, and in this way he will stabilize his finances. In addition he has five bulls with which he does plowing, making 60 Peruvian soles a day, but he does that activity in his free time so, in his own words, it is "his hobby."  

Félix's plans are to acquire a car with which to offer public transportation, in addition to being able to own his own farmland since he currently rents large areas of land to do his farming. He belongs to the communal bank "Manantiales de Yanama" [Springs of Yanama] and this is his sixth loan with MFP. He is an active member and committed to the work of the other members of his bank. Thus he hopes for the support of all of you so he may keep pursuing his objectives. 

Félix will harvest gladioli within a few days, and so upon receiving his support he is thinking of investing the money in the purchase of one bag of pea seeds for which he will also require six bags of natural fertilizers, and thus successfully begin his next planting.

loans.use: to purchase pea seeds and six bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married with two children. She is grateful for her farming business because through it, she earns an average net income of 25,000 PHP every cropping season, which happens twice a year. 

She has grown rice and corn for seven years now. The profit she generates from it enables her to support the needs of her family and in sending her children to school continuously. Due to lack of capital, Lea is asking for a loan to buy the seeds and fertilizers she needs in her farming business.  

Lea also raises pigs as another source of income for her family. She hopes for the maintenance and further growth of her agriculture business for a bright future for her two children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers she needed in her farming business

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is a 46-year-old married man who has worked painting homes and shops for 28 years. It is his only source for living and he works hard on keeping his customers very happy with his work in order to make sure that they will request him the next time. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time in order to buy new tools necessary for his business. He had a small accident in his car on his way to a place he had to paint, so he has to fix his car which transports him and his paint equipment to any place he gets a project. Kassem is a well-known man, an expert in his field, and most of his customers recommend him to each other. This is his high season so he has to stay ready to cover all his requests.

loans.use: To buy new, better tools

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia, a 53-year-old married mother of eight children, has been raising pigs in the Philippines  for 25 years to make a living. She earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothes. Now requesting a loan of PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed, Florencia  is working tirelessly to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
Doeun (shown in the photo with her loom) is a widow with one son, who is married. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  
Doeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta is a 44-year-old man who is married with two sons and four daughters. He lives in Rafah City in Gaza located in Palestine. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Atta has a store for selling cosmetics, which is another source of income for the family. He wants to purchase more cosmetics and to have a better collection to sell. The amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Atta takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase more cosmetics and have a better collection to sell. That will increase his income and improve his family life positively with better living conditions. Atta is photographed in the picture in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Benter

texts.en: Benta is the mother of two children who attend the local school, and is married to an accountant. Her family lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees her children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling a specialized type of cloth called Khanga to passersby and neighbors. She earns additional income on the side by working as a cleaning lady in a local school. Her biggest challenge is the highly-variable cost of the cloth she sells. Her dream is to open a large shop in the countryside. Benta is applying for a loan for KHS 40,000 to buy a piece of land and more cloth to sell. She decided to join Yehu because it has affordable financial services.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Clara Violeta

texts.es:
Clara de 48 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada  “Isla trinitaria”.
Sus negocios son talleres de costura. Empezó hace 12 años, la cual están ubicadas en diferentes partes de la urbe. 
Su dificultad al iniciar sus negocios eran la delincuencia, pero ahora ella ya es conocida en el sectores de sus locales.
El esposo la ayuda en la supervisión de los locales, aparte el vende botellas de aguas.
Tiene3 hijos pero ya son mayores de edad, son independientes.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios y para la compra de maquinas de coser.
El sueño de ella es poder brindar empleos a las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Clara is 48 years old and lives in a suburban area called “Isla Trinitaria”. Her businesses consist of sewing workshops. She started 12 years ago and has several locations in different parts of the city. Her difficulty with starting her businesses has been dealing with the crime, but now she is well-known in the areas where she operates. In addition to selling bottled water, her husband helps with supervising each of the locations. Clara has three children who already grown and independent.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her businesses by purchasing sewing machines. Her dream is to provide jobs to people who need them the most.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 9.  To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. She has been in the business for the last four years. Through the financial support from Faulu Kenya, she has been able to build her own house. She has also increased her business stock. Loise hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a popcorn machine.

loans.use: to buy a popcorn machine.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y francés, él vive con su esposa y no tienen hijos, su oficio es la compra y venta de pan en colonias cercanas, distribuye de algunas panaderías todos los días de la semana, transportándose en una bicicleta.
Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la reparación de la canasta donde transporta el pan, además lo que le quede utilizara para compra más pan en efectivo, esto le permitirá tener en mejores condiciones la bicicleta, con una mayor seguridad para transportar el pan.
Su aspiración es en un futuro comprar su propia casa, que su empleo sea el que le permita mejorar y estabilizar su vida.
texts.en:
José sells sweet bread and French bread. He lives with his wife. They have no children. He purchases and sells his bread in nearby neighborhoods and also distributes it to some bakeries. Every day of the week he uses a bicycle for transport.

Currently, he is applying for a loan in order to repair the basket in which he transports his bread on the bicycle. What is left over he will use for purchasing more bread for cash. The loan will allow him to have a bicycle in better condition for transporting bread securely.

His goal for the future is to purchase his own house. His job will allow him to improve and stabilize his life.

loans.use: to repair the bicycle which he uses to transport bread and to purchase bread.

loans.name: Keny Edilia

texts.es: Keny Edilia D. 35 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa y a la elaboración y venta D. pupusas. Estos negocios  los tiene ubicados en su hogar D. residencia los cuales le han ayudado por mucho tiempo a colaborar con la economía del hogar.  Tiene mucha  clientela y cada día crece más ya que ella siempre mantiene variedad D. prendas D. vestir. Además   los clientes la prefieren ya que en el mismo lugar los clientes pueden comer deliciosas pupusas preparadas con mucho amor por las manos D. Keny. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para invertir en sus negocios en la compra D. los productos necesarios para poder mantener activo el negocio. El crédito lo piensa invertir en la compra D. variedad D. prendas D. vestir (blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisetas, etc.) y en los insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. pupusas (maíz, arroz, gas propano, queso, chicharon, etc.). Tiene mucha confianza que D. esta manera logrará salir adelante y podrá tener acceso a mejores condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Keny Edilia is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband.  She dedicates herself to selling clothing, and to making and selling pupusas (a stuffed tortilla traditional of her country).  These businesses are located in her home, and have helped her contribute toward the household’s finances for a long time.  She has many customers, and her business grows every day since she carries a large selection of clothing.  In addition, customers prefer her since, at the same location, they can also eat the delicious pupusas prepared by Keny’s own hand with much love.

She has maD. the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her enterprises and buy the necessary products to support them.  She’s thinking about investing the funds into the purchase of a variety of clothing (blouses, skirts, pants, t-shirts, etc.) and in the ingredients necessary for making the pupusas (corn, rice, propane gas, cheese, sausage, etc.)  She is very confident that, in this manner, she will get ahead and be able to have access to better conditions in life.

loans.use: buy items such as:  blouses, skirts, pants, t-shirts, corn, rice, propane gas, cheese, sausage, etc.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
This is Leah, 42, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Her husband is Roderick, an overseas contract worker. She is the mother of one child. She manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Leah operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the item. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 50,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leah hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Florie

texts.en: Florie, a 49-year-old married mother of  five, lives in the Philippines where she has been making and selling snacks like pan and rice cakes for the last five years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more raw ingredients to make snacks. In the future, Florie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Davy

texts.en: Davy, 34, is widowed and resides with her two children in the Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her daughter is also a garment worker. Davy is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and a toilet. In the future, she would like to purchase a sewing machine to sew at home, build a kitchen, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”NUEVA LUZ";  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac; situado en el departamento de Cusco.

La socia;  La socia tiene 30 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 8 meses de edad; la socia se dedica  al comercio minorista, la socia normalmente compra y venta de  celulares  y accesorios de celulares de todo tipo y modelos, la socia por estas fiestas navideñas se ha prestado de su familia un monto para comprar juguetes y poder aprovechar las fiestas y venderlos, ella desea pagar el prestamo y aumentar para comprar accesorios de celular y continuar con su negocio. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de accesorios para celulares y pagar el prestamo de la compra de los juguetes.
La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido mediante el cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Nueva Luz communal bank, located in the Huanchac district in the department of Cusco.

The member, Janeth, is 30 years old and lives with her partner.  She has two children, ages 10 and 8 months.  She works in retail.  Normally she buys and sells cell phones and accessories for all brands and models.  

For this Christmas season she has a loan from her family to buy toys, to be able to take advantage of the holidays and sell them.  She wants to pay back the loan and increase buying her cell-phone accessories and continue with her business.

She is requesting the loan to invest in buying cell-phone accessories and to pay back the loan for buying the toys.

She is committed to making her payments on time in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy cell-phone accessories and to pay off a loan.

loans.name: Jerevasio

texts.en: Jerevasio is 48 years old, has 9 children, a farmer, and works 12 hours a day. He began the business because the environment favors it. He will use the money to buy fertilizers and seedlings. He hopes to have a big banana plantation, however, his challenge is the dry weather that dries down his bananas. He is honest and hard working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Scolar's Group

texts.en:
In Omalo Koth village in county Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Scolar has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Scolar is a friendly member of the community with two children. Scolar lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Omalo Koth village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Kojwang well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Scolar’s family and the 27 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Scolar has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Scolar volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community access safe water, this reducing water-borne diseases. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Rose, Ann, Rose and Caleb.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Scolar’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Jlg-003-Melapatti Group

texts.en:
Kanniyammal is a 40-year-old, married woman. She lives with her family of four in Karur district of Tamil Nadu, in the southern part of India. She has formed a group along with two of her friends to avail a loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Kanniyammal works hard to support her family, and saves diligently. However, her current household income is not sufficient for them to access basic necessities like a toilet in their home.

They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and falls ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in the family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Seeking to improve their situation, the group members seek a loan of INR 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to construct a toilet and improve sanitation facilities in her home

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
I repair electrical household goods in my city. This is a good business since there are few repair shops for electrical household goods. My business has grown and I have two young people that help me work from home. Thanks to the aid I have been offered, I have been able to increase my income and help my children pay for school.

Loan Use: Purchase Electrical and other supplies

Me dedico a la reparacion de electrodomesticos en mi ciudad, que es un buen negocio ya que casi no existen talleres de reparacion de electrodomesticos. Mi negocio ha crecido ya que tengo dos jovenes que me ayudan y yo realizo trabajos a domicilio. Gracias a la ayuda que me han brindado he podido obtener mejores ingresos y ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Compra de materiales electricos y otros.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Madam O., a 47 year-old woman with 6 children, has a livesock farm where she rears local goats and sheep for sale. Her farm is producing well nourished varieties and she wants to expand livestock farm. She is seeking a loan of $1000 from Kiva to enable her expand and produce more. She has been trained using the TEACH lending model of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paullina

texts.en: Mrs. Paullina O. is 41 years old. She is married with seven (7) children. She has been a LAPO client for over 4 years. She lives in Benin City. She wants the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 31 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband works in the fields harvesting corn. She produces and sells tostadas in the market of the city of San Cristobal as an ambulant salesperson. She belongs to the group “Dulce 3” together with: Ortencia Alejandra Sanchez (who makes handcrafted shirts), Petra Maria Hernandez de la Cruz (who sells handcrafted clothing). Estela will invest her part of the loan to buy a more corn and firewood to increase her production. Ortencia and Petra will put their parts to get a to invest in thread, blankets, and doomed to lower their sourcing costs and therefore increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

ESTELA TIENE 31 AÑOS, CASADA, 1 HIJO, SU ESPOSOS TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ. ELLA VENDE Y HACE TOSTADAS EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL COMO VENDEDORA AMBULANTE, PERTENECE AL GRUPO DULCE 3 JUNTO CON: ORTENCIA ALEJANDRA SANCHEZ (HACE BLUSAS Y CAMISAS ARTESANALES), PETRA MARIA HERNANDEZ DE LA CRUZ ( VENTA DE ROPA ARTESANAL). CON EL PRESTAMO ESTELA INVERTIRA SU PARTE COMPRANDO MAIZ Y LEÑA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION, ORTENCIA Y PETRA UNIRAN LA PARTE DE SUS PRESTAMOS PARA INVERTIR EN HILOS, MANTA Y TELARES PARA REBAJAR COSTOS DE COMPRA Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS

loans.use: to sell tostadas

loans.name: Tepa

texts.en: For 5 years, Tepa has been fishing. She is married with 3 children, and her husband takes care of their pumpkin patch as she sells fish in the village. (She is pictured with the pumpkins). Sometimes, she takes the pumpkins to the fish market.  Earlier, she received aid from SPBD that enabled her to buy fishing gear, fishing nylons, fishing floater and other materials necessary for fishing.  She hopes to own another fishing boat soon.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Ziada

texts.en: Ziada is a 27-year-old mother and a resident of the Makangarawe community. She runs a ladies salon. She makes different styles of hair for her customers. Her business always booms during the festival seasons. She has recently received business management training organized by the Youth Self employment foundation.  She wants to buy more equipment for her salon to get prepared for the Christmas season. She is in need of $425 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosario P. R. is an associate of “Flor del Café,” a microfinance institution situated in the Soritor district of the Moyabamba province in San Martín. She sells Peruvian street food, such as fried sausages and French fries, and a variety of beverages. She operates her business from her own home, where she waits for her customers to provide them with good service. She decided to start her own business because she has the support of her mother-in-law, who motivated her by giving her a street food cart. She likes this business because her house is located in an optimal place that is free of competitors. She took advantage of this opportunity because she counts on the support of her husband and daughters. Through this business, she makes use of her abilities and generates her own income.

With a recent loan from “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” of $667.00 USD, which will be repaid in six installments, she will buy one refrigerator (a quite useful appliance for this type of business) for storing cold beverages. She will also buy assorted carbonated drinks, condiments like ketchup and mustard, cooking oil, and all the products necessary for preparing her Peruvian street food.

She is 42 years old and has three children who help her out with both the business and the housework. She also plans to expand her business in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosario, es socia del Banco Comunal “ Flor del Café ” del distrito de Soritor, provincia de Moyabamba departamento de San Martín, ella se dedica la venta de comidas al paso como salchipapas, salchipollo, bebidas de diferentes marcas; Su negocio lo realiza en su propia casa que esta ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya No 1045 del mismo distrito, allí ella espera a su clientela para atenderles con un buen trato. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque tuvo el apoyo de su suegra quien le motivó regalándole un carrito salchipapero porque vió que le gusta el negocio y su casa tiene una buena ubicación y no tiene competencia, ella no desaprovechó esta oportunidad porque cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijas, de esta manera ella pone en practica sus habilidades y genera sus propios ingresos.

Con el reciente crédito recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 soles ($ 667.00) que será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará un refrigerador para que pueda atender con bebidas heladas porque es muy útil en este tipo de negocio, también comprará bebidas gasificadas de varias marcas y tamaños, y algunas cremas que utiliza como ketchup, mostaza en baldes, aceites en galones y demás productos que ella utiliza en la preparación de salchipapas y salchipollo.

Tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, quienes ahora ya la apoyan en el negocio y las actividades de la casa, dentro de sus proyectos está la ampliación de su negocio, con lo que podrá atender mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and one refrigerator

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio B. Arguello is married and has an adult son.

For 7 years now, he has owned a tire shop, where he sells new and used tires. He has a vast clientele thanks to his good location.

Mr. Emilio is well known in his area for being hard working, and he also has good commercial and personal references.

His dream is to expand his locale so he has space to increase his merchandise stock, buy more tires, and offer his customers a greater variety in tires. In this way he would be able to increase his sales, and in consequence his income, so he can offer his family more financial stability.

The loan will be used to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Emilio Benítez Arguello es casado y tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad.

Desde hace 7 años es propietario de una gomeria, donde vende cubiertas nuevas y usadas. Cuenta con una amplia clientela gracias a su buena ubicación.

El Señor Emilio es conocido en la zona por ser trabajador, aparte tiene buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

Su sueño es ampliar su local para tener espacio para poder aumentar su stock de mercaderías, comprar más cubiertas y así brindarle a sus clientes una mayor variedad de cubiertas, de esta manera generar mayores ventas para que sus ingresos aumenten y pueda darles a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de cubiertas.

loans.use: Buying tires (COMPRAS DE CUBIERTAS.)

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.en:
Maria Antonia P. is a 46 year old separated woman with two children. Her nineteen year old daughter works on a farm to contribute to the family income. Her son is fifteen and still attends school. Maria has worked in the dressmaking and tailoring trade since she was twenty three and has worked for various businesses. However, for the past eight years she has worked for herself and has operated a business out of her house. She currently has three machines consisting of a five thread over lock, an industrial sewing machine and an embroidery machine.

With the loan, Maria will invest the money in buying bundles of linens for her tailor shop; she will also buy pieces of clothing and cloth. All of these will contribute to greater business and more efficient work.

loans.use: To buy fabric, pieces of clothing, and tablecloths for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem S. Khem, 27, is a housewife looking after her children and cooking food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Thang Chea, 28, is a guard who looks after a banana farm, making on average $1.20 a day of profit. To provide more income for the family, Nhem is requesting a loan from Kiva to rent a plot of farmland to grow a variety of vegetables.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland and grow a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi:
Since her house's location is excellent to run a business, Mrs Lương Thị V. had applied for a loan and opened a restaurant to serve the workers in the area. She is 42 years old. Her husband is a cadre so he has a lot of contacts plus the food that she serves is good so the restaurant is quite busy. The revenue from the restaurant is stable. She makes 250-270 USD a month. One of the secret to attract and retain customers is to have an excellent service, friendly and warm. Her plan is to obtain a loan of 950 USD to buy food, add more items to the menu to better serve the customers. She's living in Bình Xuyên, Vĩnh Phúc with her husband and their 4 young children

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tận dụng nhà ở là địa điểm thuận lợi cho việc kinh doanh, buôn bán, chị Lương Thị V., 42 tuổi, đã mạnh dạn vay vốn kinh doanh bán hàng ăn phục vụ công nhân viên chức. Chồng chị là một cán bộ đang công tác cộng với món ăn sạch và rất ngon nên cửa hàng có nhiều khách quen. Nhờ đó thu nhập từ cửa hàng khá cao và ổn định. Mỗi tháng chị thu từ 250-270USD. Một trong những bí quyết giúp thu hút khách hàng của chị V. là phục vụ chu đáo, nhiệt tình và luôn niềm nở. Thật tuyệt nếu được thưởng thức một bát phở do chính tay chị chế biến. Dự định của chị V. là sẽ xin vay 950USD mua nguyên liệu làm hàng ăn và mở rộng cửa hàng, phục vụ khách ngày càng tốt hơn. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 4 con trong độ tuổi đi học tại Bình Xuyên, Vĩnh Phúc.

loans.use: Buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Grace's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Grace is 53 years old and divorced. She owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 am to 4 pm at the restaurant and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to increase the amount of stock in the restaurant. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Tausi, who has a business in honey sales.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to increase the stock in a restaurant

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba is a single mother, but this hasn't stopped her from getting ahead. On the contrary, she has gained a good reputation for her work in the agricultural sector. For a long time, this was the only activity which provided an income for her family, and Elba would now like to set up a grocery store, as she has noticed the need for one in her community.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Elba es madre soltera y su condición no ha limitado su progreso, por el contrario le ha otorgado una importante fortaleza para su desempeño agrícola. Durante mucho tiempo esta ha sido la única actividad que ha sostenido a su familia y ahora desea implementar una bodega ya que ha observado la necesidad de su comunidad.

loans.use: To set up a small grocery store at home.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo S. D. Rodríguez is a partner of the "Coffee Flower" Communal Bank in the San Martín region in the Moyabamba Province, Soritor District. She prepares and sells meals and provides a meal service to the professors of the school located next to her house, which is in the Jr. Ramón Castilla No. 896 block.

Upon being widowed and with a desire to help her children, she decided to dedicate herself to what she enjoyed so much, cooking. She chose to prepare and sell typical menu items. The business began borrowing kitchen utensils and other materials; soon they were being acquired with loans and earnings from sales.

With a loan of S/. 500.00 to be re-paid in 4 months, she would buy rice, sacks of sugar, packets of noodles, bunches of bananas, oil in bulk, and other ingredients for the preparation of the menu items that she sells daily.

Consuelo is 54 years old. She is very enthusiastic and cheered by the idea that, along with her children, she can dream of having her own store one day so that she can get some rest. While she very much enjoys cooking, the work requires many sacrifices.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Consuelo S. D. Rodríguez, es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Del Café”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia D. Moyabamba y distrito D. Soritor, se dedica a la preparación y venta D. comida, y da pensión a los profesores del colegio que esta al lado D. su casa, ubicada en el jr Ramón castilla Nro 896.

Al quedar viuda y con la en el afán D. sacar adelante a sus hijos, decidió dedicarse a lo que tanto le gusta, la cocina, por eso deciD. vender comida tipo menú, el negocio empezó prestando utensilios D. cocina y otros materiales, luego los fue adquiriendo con los prestamos y las ganancias que le brinda sus ventas.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 500.00 que será devuelto en 4 meses, implementará su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar por sacos, fideos en paquetes, plátano en racimos, aceite a granel, y demás ingredientes para la preparación D. su menú que diariamente venD.

La señora Consuelo tiene 54 años, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre que junto a sus hijos y con la humildad que demuestra sueña con tener una bodega para que pueda descansar, si bien es cierto le gusta mucha la cocina, pero es un trabajo muy sacrificado.

loans.use:
Puchase of wholesale items of consumption.
Compra de insumos al por mayor.

loans.name: Lilian's Happy Group

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with 2 children aged 10 and 15. She became a clothes seller in 2008. Every day, she works from 10am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

Lilian now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with vegetable sales, clothes sales and a cafe.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Husna

texts.en: Husna K. is a Tanzanian woman. She sells Tanzanian traditional clothing (vitenge and kanga) at Buguruni Mnyamani in Dar-es-Salaam. She purchases the goods from Mnazi Mmoja wholesale shopping center and sells to customers retail. She has been in the business for three years. Her business plan is to run a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of US$ 350 to expand the business.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Djamadjigui (The Hope Of The World) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djamadjigui est composé de cinq (5) femmes mariées vivant en générale dans des foyers polygames traditionnels élargis avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 2 enfants et résidant dans le quartier Fadougala du village Thien Bamanan de Ségou (quatrième région économique du Mali).
Ces femmes exercent le commerce de produits maraîchers tel l’oignon et la tomate. Unies par des relations professionnelles et de voisinage elles ont décidé ensemble (après avoir vu l’exemple de certaines femmes du village à travers le prêt solidaire) d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 400kg d’oignon et 2 baignoires de tomate fraîche sur place au village et à la foire de Markala (les dimanches) auprès des forains venant des préfectures de Niono (région de Ségou) et de Sikasso (région de Sikasso). Cette opération est hebdomadaire.
Ces produits sont ensuite vendus au comptant ou en détail dans les différents quartiers de Markala ou sur place au village de Thien Bamanan à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
 Les femmes du groupe Djamadjigui espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 18.335 FCFA mensuel qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, et renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The Djamadjigui group is composed of 5 married women who live, in general, in polygamous traditional extended households. They have an average age of 38 and 2 children on average, and they live in the Fadougala neighborhood of the village Thien Bamanan near Ségou (fourth economic region of Mali). These women sell vegetables such as onions and tomatoes.

United by professional ties and living in the same neighborhood, they decided together (after having seen the example of what certain village women have done through a group loan) to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their first group loan.

They intend to use the loan to buy 400 kg of onions and 2 basins of fresh tomatoes in the village and at the fair of Markala (Sundays) from merchants coming from the prefectures of Niono (Ségou region) and from Sikasso (Sikasso region). This happens weekly.

These products are then sold for cash or retailed in the various districts of Markala or on the village square of Thien Bamanan to a clientele composed mainly of women.

Each of the women of the Djamadjigui group hopes to make a profit of 18,335 F CFA per month, which will be used to make payments on the loan and bolster their working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of onions and fresh tomatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Argentina tiene 40 años de edad,  habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Sabana grande, soltera, no tiene hijos y ayuda a su hermano a criar a sus sobrinos, el negocio de doña Rosa es la elaboración de cosa de horno, pues tiene treinta años de experiencia ya que es una herencia de su madre ya que desde muy joven ayudaba hacer los ricos horneados lo cual ahora ha sido su fuente de trabajo para sobrevivir. Con la solicitud de trabajo es para comprar más insumos para aumentar la producción de ventas de cosa de horno. A largo plazo es tener vendedores que le vendan el producto y poder enseñar a su familia para que también sea una herencia y puedan seguir trabajando en este negocio.
texts.en:
Senora Rosa Argentina is 40 years old and lives in a neighborhood in Managua called Sabana Grande. She is single and does not have any children, but she helps her brother raise his children. Rosa makes and sells grilled snacks for a living. She inherited this trade from her mother, and after 30 years it is her only source of income to live on. She needs to purchase the necessary ingredients to increase her production and sales. Her long term plan is to have salespeople who can sell her products, and to be able to teach others in her family this trade so they can inherit it and continue with the business.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients she needs to increase production and sales of the local snacks she makes and sells

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a 60-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. 

Habib owns a grocery shop where he sells vegetables and candy. He has requested a loan of $1100 from Al Majmoua in order to improve his assets. Habib has been a micro-credit client for a long time and has always repaid his loans on time.

Habib has owned his grocery shop for 39 years. He is open every day of the week until late at night. Habib has a good reputation in his village, thanks to the quality of merchandise he offers. His clients are his home and shop neighbors and as well as people who walk by. 

He is willing to purchase more merchandise to improve his business and satisfy more his clients’ needs. Habib has been having difficulty getting reimbursement from former clients. In small villages, asking for reimbursement might sound rude, especially when your best clients are neighbors and family.  

Before the repetitive Lebanese wars, Habib used to own 12 shops. Habib has lost a lot and, adding to it, there has been much theft. Indeed, all this has affected a lot his business. 
 
All through the situation, Habib has remained a tough man and he is planning, in the future, to open a mini market, rather than another grocery shop, because he wants to expand his business and diversify his merchandise.

loans.use: Habib needs the loan to improve his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. owns a restaurant in Uselu Market Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods like rice and beans. She has lots of customers patronizing her. She needs the loan amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is 42 years old and married with two children. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. sells glass and rubber/plastic products such as plates, cups, bowl, etc and sells them in a shop in the market square. She has been in business for twelve years. Yaa procures her goods from Kumasi in the South central region of Ghana. 

She is 35 years old and divorced with two girls, who attend basic school. A slight misunderstanding between her and her husband resulted in their break up. She lives with her children in Bibiani, a town in the Western Region.Yaa pays and provides for school fees, accommodation, food and every need of the family. 

She wants a loan to buy goods on a large scale. It is her dream to make more more money so she can pay for her girls school and help them pursue tertiary education.

loans.use: To buy glass and rubber/plastic products

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es: Don William  a sus 37 años de edad, ha logrado tener su propio negocio una tienda de venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace doce años, que inicio con ahorro y créditos de Afodenic, con estos préstamos ha podido hacer su negocio, ahora viaja  a los departamentos. Reside en villa reconciliación, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 8,12 y 17 años de edad, que estudian, ella se desempeña como cajera para ayudar a su esposo  con los gastos y poder terminar de hacer las mejora de su vivienda, con esta solicitud va invertir en materiales de construcción para poner cerámica a su casa ya que es de suelo. Y así poder lograr tener en mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Don William, at 37 years old, has managed to have his own business, a store selling clothing and shoes, for two years. He started it with his savings and loans from Afodenic. With these loans he has been able to grow the business; he now does business in other areas. He lives in the Villa Reconciliación and with his wife he has three children of 8, 12 and 17 years of age that are students. His wife works as a cashier to help her husband with the household expenses and to be able to complete the improvements to their house. With this loan they will purchase construction materials to be able to put ceramic floors in their house, since it currently is a dirt floor, to allow the family to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of construction materials to put down ceramic flooring in his house

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Cet homme a pour activité la menuiserie, il a installé une atelier « Ets béni de l’éternel »dans son quartier à agoè, il a beaucoup de commande c’est pourquoi il sollicite un prêt de wages pour pouvoir s’acheter 50 planches, il fait son activité depuis 2000, il a déjà obtenu un crédit de wages qu’il a bien remboursé. Il est marié et a deux enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Dovi A. is a carpenter by profession, and he has set up a workshop named "Ets béni de l'éternel" in his area in Agoè. He has many orders, which is why is asking for a loan (through WAGES) to buy 50 boards. He has been running his business since 2000. He has already obtained one loan through WAGES, which he repaid without problems. He is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boards

loans.name: Ursina

texts.en:
Ursina G. lives in Itá, Paraguay, where she owns and operates a small store. At the store she sells items such as rice, sugar, noodles, and beverages to her neighbors and passers-by. She works at the store in order to support her eight children. Along with her husband, who works in construction, Ursina has seen her oldest son graduate from his studies and become a teacher, while another son has become an electrician, and another is currently studying law. “If you don’t support your children,” she says, “there is no way they will receive an education or obtain a good career. This is why I continue to seek credit.” Her youngest son is seven years old, and Ursina plans to continue to work hard as her son makes his way through school.

Ursina uses the loans she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to keep her store well-stocked. Ursina was one of the first clients to work with Fundación Paraguaya when it opened an office in Itá almost four years ago. She stated that she is very proud of the fact that she always makes her payments on time, and she still has all the receipts to prove it.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, and beverages for re-sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Julia es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Julia tiene un puesto en un mercado en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su cuñado, además Julia vende medicamentos naturales.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Julia son ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos, mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Nobleza (Nobility) Communal Bank. Julia is 23 years old, has a son and lives with her domestic partner. She has a stand in a market where she sells groceries mostly, and she also sells natural medicines. She does this every day with the help of her brother-in-law. Julia needs a loan of 2,000 Sols that will be invested in the purchase of cereals, rice and sugar. She dreams of saving up money for her children's education and to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Shuhradjon

texts.en:
The business activity from which Y. Shuhradjon makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business eight years ago with a small number of livestock, but as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and gain from their derivatives.

According to Shuhradjon, he works very hard so that he can maintain his children. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve the lives of his family. Currently Shuhradjon needs a loan of $800 in order to purchase more cattle and later resell them after breeding them. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family and educate all of his three children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Irma Leysi

texts.es:
IRMA LEYSI V. N., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” con domicilio en el Jr. PACHITEA N° 729 del distrito de Callería, tiene 41 años, 3 hijos,  donde uno de ellos continua estudiando.

Tenía un negocio de venta de ropa, carteras y relojes. La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 1 año, con él, compro algunas prendas más y afianzo su negocio, pero por inconvenientes dejo por un tiempo el negocio y hoy se encuentra vendiendo comida por las noches en la vereda de su casa.

Actualmente su negocio es la venta de comida, lo hace por las noches.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, que invertirá en la compra de alimentos como carne, pollo, arroz, etc. 

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Irma Leysi V. N. belongs to the Communal Bank “Loreto”. She lives in the district of Calleria, is 41 years old, and has 3 children, one of which continues in his studies. She had a business in the sale of clothing, purses, and watches. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she obtained 1 year ago she purchased various additional articles of clothing and strengthened her business. Due to setbacks she left this business for a while and now finds herself selling food on the sidewalk of her home. Currently her business is the sale of food, which she carries out at night. With this loan of 1,500 PEN she will invest in the purchase of food such as beef, chicken, rice, etc. In the little time that she has been with Manuela Ramos program she has felt happy for the support that it gives women to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beef, chicken, rice, etc.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 21 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Kamal owns a barber shop. Kamal requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat and beauty products for his salon. This is the first time that Kamal has requested a loan.
Kamal's salon is popular because he cuts hair well and is aware of new haircut styles. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Kamal learned his business in an academy and by experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Kamal will use the loan to purchase a new seat and beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Blanca Nevai

texts.es: Blanca es casada, vive en la zona # 3 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, los dos estudian, trabaja como Asistente de registro desde hace tres años en la universidad URACCAN en Nueva Guinea, su esposo trabaja  para la empresa lechera, ambos comparten con  los gastos del hogar, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do credito para Terminar de construir un porche, cancelo credito anterior para mejora de vivienda con el fondo KIVA, logrando satisfactoriamente construir una habitacion,  doña Blanca es una mujer profesional  muy alegre,  responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy servicial con la personas que lo necesitan y con muchos deseos de superacion,  ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya con los financiamientos obtenidos por AFODENIC ha mejorado su vivienda y a obtenidos electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia, su sueño es  que sus hijos estudien, salud,  tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia y seguir estudiando para ser cada dia una profesional con mucha experiencia.
texts.en:
Blanca is married and lives in Zone #3 of Nueva Guinea, where the population increases each day. She has two children, 14 and 19 years old, who are students. She has worked for three years as a registration assistant in the URACCAN university in Nueva Guinea. Her husband works for the dairy company and they both share the household expenses. She is requesting refinancing of her second loan in order to finish constructing a porch. She repaid a previous loan used for housing improvement, satisfactorily completing construction of an additional room. Doña Blanca is a professional woman, happy, responsible, honest, hard working, and very helpful to the people who need it. She has a strong desire to advance and is grateful to AFODENIC since with the financing obtained from AFODENIC she has improved her house and obtained electric household appliances with which she has improved the living conditions of herself and her family. Her dream is that her children study, and to have health and work stability so she can help her family and continue to study in order to be a professional every day with much experience.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a porch

loans.name: Saera

texts.ru: Камолова Саера проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Саера более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует одеждой. Ей в этом также помогает ее муж. Клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saera K. lives in the Tursun-Zoda region. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. Saera has been in the retail business for more than eight years. She has a vendor spot on the market where she sells clothing. Her husband is helping her with this. The client is asking for a loan to increase her sales and turnover.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales and turnover

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Dernita J. is a Haitian immigrant who lives in La Caleta, a town in the outskirts of Boca Chica. Boca Chica is known for having white soft sand, and the water is calm, clear and shallow. But tourists don’t normally see those that are trying to survive in the nearby communities. Especially now in the down-turning economy many are left without employment because businesses keep on shutting their doors. Dernita has been able to survive because 13 years ago she started her own business. She sells clothes and basic food products from her house. Currently her colmado sells rice, beans, sugar and flour, but does not sell fruits and vegetables. With this loan she hopes to attract new customers by expanding to also sell fruits and vegetables. 

Prior to 2006, when she was still not an Esperanza client, Dernita realized that a lot of the time when she found herself out of money to re-stock she would borrow money from local lenders. The local lenders charge a 20% interest rate per week! Esperanza charges a 2% declining-balance interest rate every two weeks, 4% a month. Esperanza also helps its clients with complimentary services such as savings account, medical and life insurance, literacy courses, and business management training, just to name a few. 

Please strongly consider loaning to Dernita and her group. She deserves a fair interest rate and an opportunity to grow her business. Esperanza thanks you for your time and consideration.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for home grocery store

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
