Ce monsieur est un tailleur de profession, il confectionne des habits appelés "boubous" pour hommes et dames qu'il revend à ses clients , il a  deux ans d’expérience et a ouvert son atelier qu'il a appelé "CENT DOLLARS" dans le quartier de Bè Kpéhénou N°1 à Lomé. la demande de ses clients est elevée , pour les satisfaire convenablement il doit  acquérir une machine à coudre ainsi que du fil à coudre et divers outils nécessaires à son activité, c'est pour cela qu'il s'adresse à WAGES pour obtenir un crédit. ainsi il pourra améliorer ses prestations de services.
il est marié et a à sa charge deux enfants. c'est avec ce qu'il gagne comme revenu de son activité qu'il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a professional tailor with two years of experience in the Bè Kpéhénou N°1 neighborhood in Lomé and intends to acquire a sewing machine and thread so that he can improve the service he offers. This man is married and raising 2 children. This new equipment will permit him to expand his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion L. is from the town of Dban in Calamba Misami.Occidental. She is 59 years old. Concepcion is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Concepcion makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Concepcion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Concepcion from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
This is Marlyn F., a 42-year-old fish vendor from Tala, Caloocan City. Four of her six children are still in school. Her husband, Salvador, 46, is a driver. Marlyn has been selling fresh fish in the flea market downtown. She earns more than 10,000 PHP a month, mostly on weekends. Most of her clients are restaurant owners and busy workers.

Marlyn joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only eight months ago, yet she is on her third loan cycle with the cooperative. She has applied for a new loan of 8,000 PHP as additional capital to keep her fish selling business going. She wishes to see all her children finish their college education in the future.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through a fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer colaboradora y alegre, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, tiene 43 años y es madre de seis hijos de los cuales cuatro son mayores de edad y dos menores, se dedica a vender frutas de la región como aguajes, cocos, coconas, etc, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es miembro de seguridad de una empresa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Trabajadoras de los Pinos” desde hace un año y cuatro meses. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 500 soles que invirtió en frutas.  
Este crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado una parte para mejorar su kiosco y otra para comprar las frutas. La meta de Esther es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes en general.

loans.use: Invertirá una parte para mejorar su kiosco y otra para comprar frutas.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
La señora Teodocia es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” ubicado en el centro poblado D. Corazón Pampuyo del distrito Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito y departamento D. Puno; tiene 60 años D. edad, estado civil V., tiene 06 hijos todos casados, vive en Ticaraya, ella no pudo seguir estudios.

La señora inicia su  trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su préstamo es D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. D. aves D. corral, las cuales las venD. en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades en el préstamo.

loans.use: Para la compra de aves de corral

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene I. is from the village of Buena Vista. She is 32 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Irene owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2004, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Kha

texts.en: Mrs. Kha A. lives in Ta Pov village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vith Tab, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. They have a problem with the soil, so Mrs. Kha A. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating rice. She hopes to increase their rice revenue and improve the family's living. She is a mother of five children, two of whom breed pigs, two are enrolled the local school, and the youngest is only two years old.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: M. Bernadette est née le 20 Août 1958 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin.Bernadette vit au quartier Oganla à Porto-Novo, depuis une dizaine d'année. Mariée à DANDJINOU Armand, un instituteur à la retraite, Bernadette est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés,dont deux sont à sa charge. Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Bernadette a fréquenté jusqu'au cours secondaire. Il y a environs deux ans que Bernadette vend des ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, plats en séries, verres à boire) par le système de distribution. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo, que Bernadette s'approvisionne. Bernadette a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien remboursé le crédit. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'agrandir sa marchandise pour mieux vendre ses articles en temps de fêtes, Bernadette sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Bernadette ambitionne ouvrir plus tard sa propre boutique pour vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Bernadette M. was born on 20 August, 1958 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Bernadette has lived in the Oganla area of Porto-Novo for ten years. Married to Armand Dandjinou, a retired teacher, Bernadette is the mother of four children, all in school, of whom two are in her care. Bernadette lives together with her husband and children. Bernadette attended school up to the secondary level. For about two years, Bernadette has sold kitchenware (iceboxes, plate sets, drinking glasses) through the distribution system. It is in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, that Bernadette gets her supplies. Bernadette has obtained one previous loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and repaid this loan properly. With the goal of increasing her working capital and expanding her merchandise to better sell her items during the holiday period, Bernadette is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ. Bernadette aspires to open at some later time her own shop to sell her products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchenware (iceboxes, plate sets, and drinking glasses)

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette A. is from the city of Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old, is single, and has one school-aged child. Jeanette owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jeanette joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: H. Akouavi Bernadette

texts.fr: Z. H. Akouavi Bernadette est née en 1953 à Allada, dans la commune de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Akouavi Bernadette vit depuis près de 15 ans à Dodomey à Allada. Mariée à AGUENON Paul, Akouavi Bernadette est mère de deux enfants. Akouavi Bernadette a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Akouavi Bernadette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour venir en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille, Akouavi Bernadette vend des bois de chauffage à son domicile. Akouavi Bernadette mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale). Akouavi Bernadette exerce cette activité depuis trente ans. C'est dans les villages de Allada que Akouavi Bernadette s'approvisionne. Akouavi Bernadette a bénéficié déjà de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a bien remboursés. Dans l'optique d'agrandir son activité et se faire une épargne qui servira à l'éducation de ses enfants, Akouavi Bernadette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Akouavi Bernadette envisage plus tard construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
H. Akouavi Bernadette Z. was born in 1953 in Allada, Benin's Atlantic community. Akouavi Bernadette has been living in the Dodomey area of Allada for the past 15 years. She is married to Paul AGUENON, and mother of two. Akouavi Bernadette has another child under her care, in addition to her own children. Only some of her children are educated. The couple share household expenses. Akouavi Bernadette has not attended school. To assist her husband with the household expenses, Akouavi Bernadette sells firewood from her home. As a secondary business, she also sells "sodabi" (a local alcoholic beverage). Akouavi Bernadette has been performing these activities for the past 30 years. She gets her supplies from the villages of Allada. Akouavi Bernadette has already been granted two loans by ALIDé, which she has fully reimbursed. With the view of increasing her activity and putting money aside for her children's education, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. In the future, Akouavi Bernadette considers building her own home.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 20 loads of firewood and twenty 50-litre drums of "sodabi"

loans.name: Mẫn

texts.en:
L. Mẫn Thị is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two infant children.  To make a living, L. operates a restaurant, serving breakfast foods to customers in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately $233 a month from this activity.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.  

L. is now requesting a new loan of 7.804.000 VND, which again will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.  This will be her 3rd loan from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Mẫn Thị (20201060035) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ phục vụ thức ăn sáng cho khách hàng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 4.300.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn & đồ uống cho nhà hàng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.804.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn & đồ uống cho nhà hàng.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.use: To get fresh supplies

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, el señor Armando C. se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado especialmente a la crianza de vaquillas las que son criadas por él mismo y luego les extrae la leche para su respectiva comercialización.
Está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido directamente en la compra de seis vaquillas las que serán utilizadas para su respectiva crianza y después sacarles el máximo provecho por medio de la leche que sin duda la venderá satisfactoriamente en su localidad.
texts.en:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, el señor Armando C. se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado especialmente a la crianza de vaquillas las que son criadas por él mismo y luego les extrae la leche para su respectiva comercialización. Está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido directamente en la compra de seis vaquillas las que serán utilizadas para su respectiva crianza y después sacarles el máximo provecho por medio de la leche que sin duda la venderá satisfactoriamente en su localidad.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy six heifers

loans.name: Jicaltepec Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO DE "JICALTEPEC" LLEVA ESE NOMBRE PORQUE ASI SE LLAMA LA LOCALIDAD DONDE HABITAN CERCA DE PINOTEPA NACIONAL OAXACA, LOS CLIENTES SE DEDICAN A COMERCIALIZAR ALIMENTOS,REBECA M. Y JUANA G. VENDEN TACOS, SOTERA G.,EUSTOLIA V. Y RICARDA S. VENDEN DESAYUNOS EN UNA ESCUELA,ORALIA S. ELABORA SERVILLETAS TEJIDAS A MANO Y LAS VENDE, TERESA T., CARMELA L. M. Y EUSTOLIA G. VEDEN TAMALES, OFELIA S. VENDE TOTOPOS, MARIA L. VENDE CENA (COMIDA PREPARADAS Y ANTOJITOS COMO SON:SOPES,ENCHILADAS,TACOS, EMPANADAS)
LA SEÑORA MARIA L. G. ES CASADA TIENE 3 HIJOS DE 9, 12, Y 14 AÑOS DE EDAD,ELLA DECIDIO VENDER ALIMENTOS DEBIDO A QUE ESTE TRABAJO LO HA REALIZADO YA POR MUCHOS AÑOS YA QUE AHORA TRABAJA EN SU PROPIO LOCAL Y EL DINERO DEL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA A FUNDACION LO VA A UTILIZAR PARA COMPRAR MATERIAL COMO ES CEMENTO, ARENA, CALHIDRA, Y PAGAR LA MANO DE OBRA PARA AMPLIAR SU LOCAL PORQUE QUIERE QUE SUS CLIENTES SE SIENTAN A GUSTO CUANDO VAN A CONSUMIR.
ELLA COMENTA QUE LE AGRADA TRABAJAR CON LAS COMPAÑERAS DE SU GRUPO YA QUE DICE CONOCE A TODAS Y QUE CONFIA QUE NO VAMOS A TENER PROBLEMAS PRA LA RECUPERACION DEL CREDITO YA QUE TODAS SON RESPONSABLES Y PAGADORAS.
TAMBIEN ESPERA QUE LOS PRESTATARIOS DE KIVA CONTINUEN APOYANDO A LA FUNDACION PARA QUE ELLAS SIGAN RECIBIENDO EL BENEFICIO DEL CREDITO Y HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO ADEMAS COMENTÓ ENVIEN NUESTROS AGRADECIMIENTOS A LOS QUE PRESTAN EL DINERO EN KIVA Y QUE NO SE OLVIDEN DE NOSOTROS.
texts.en:
The “Jicaltepec” group is called thus because that’s the name of the place the members are from; it is near Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. The members are merchants selling a variety of food products: Rebeca M. and Juana G. sell tacos; Sotera G., Eustolia V. and Ricardo S. sell breakfasts in a school; Oralia S. hand knits napkins to sell; Teresa T., Carmela L. M. and Eustolia G. sell tamales; Ofelia S. sells Totopos (corn chips); Maria L. sells dinners (prepared meals and snacks like: sopes (fried tortilla dough circles topped with various toppings), enchiladas, tacos, empanadas). Maria L. G. is married and has three children; they are 9, 12, and 14 years of age. She decided to sell food because this is something she has done for many years. She now has her own work place and the loan money that she has requested from the Foundation will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand and whitewash and to pay labor costs to enlarge her eatery because she wants her customers to be comfortable when they come. She comments that she likes working with her fellow group members because she knows all of them and trusts that they won’t have any problems repaying the loan because they are all hard-working and good payers. She also hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support the Foundation so that they can continue to receive the benefits that credit represents and to help their businesses grow. She also asked that we send their appreciation to all those who lend money to Kiva and that don’t forget them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing a supply of smoked fish

loans.name: Isata

texts.en: Isata K. is married to a diamond miner. They have two children in primary school. Isata sells lace and fabrics at a popular market called Roma along Gerehun Road. She needs a loan to buy fabrics that are popular with her customers. She intends to use the proceeds from the loan to pay for her children's schooling and to get materials to start building a house.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Esmeralda C. A. es originaria del departamento de Estelí trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como conserje tiene mas de nueve años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien en su trabajo ,se le otorgo el crédito para la tramitación de titulo de su hija que salió de la universidad  ya que no contaba con la suficiente cantidad de dinero para hacerlo y necesitaba el crédito con urgencia 
Antes de tener este trabajo ella se dedicaba a hacer otras labores como trabajo de domestica y cuidar niños.  
Ella plantea que el crédito le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá el problema de sus hija y se sentirá satisfecha ya que uno de sus sueños fue darle el estudio a ellos y poder contribuir en lo posible a que no les falte nada.

Rosa es una madre soltera y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad a los que también les brida su apoyo cuando la necesitan. Ellos trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente en los gastos familiares de la casa.
 
Este es el cuarto crédito que rosa tiene con Ceprodel
Y espera no quedarlos mal y poder seguir trabajando con la institución para seguir mejorando su nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
La señora Rosa Esmeralda C. A. es originaria del departamento de Estelí trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como conserje tiene mas de nueve años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien en su trabajo ,se le otorgo el crédito para la tramitación de titulo de su hija que salió de la universidad ya que no contaba con la suficiente cantidad de dinero para hacerlo y necesitaba el crédito con urgencia Antes de tener este trabajo ella se dedicaba a hacer otras labores como trabajo de domestica y cuidar niños. Ella plantea que el crédito le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá el problema de sus hija y se sentirá satisfecha ya que uno de sus sueños fue darle el estudio a ellos y poder contribuir en lo posible a que no les falte nada. Rosa es una madre soltera y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad a los que también les brida su apoyo cuando la necesitan. Ellos trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente en los gastos familiares de la casa. Este es el cuarto crédito que rosa tiene con Ceprodel Y espera no quedarlos mal y poder seguir trabajando con la institución para seguir mejorando su nivel de vida familiar.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tramite de titulo de su hija

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita L., 37, is married to Mario L. and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Margarita makes sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. She has been managing her own rug-making shop for quite some time now.
Margarita has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her rug business.
To ensure the success of her business, Margarita would like to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw materials needed to continue rug production. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can cater to more customers and have more patrons.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for rug production

loans.name: Hoshmand Group

texts.en: Shoghofa is a member of the Hoshmand group. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She has a beauty salon in her house. She works there in order to support her children and husband. She needs the loan to purchase good quality cosmetics and new furniture. She would like to enhance her business and have an organized beauty salon to attract more clients. She is confident that she will repay her loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and furniture for beauty salon

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.en:
O. Abdujalil is a 44-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and seven children in the southern part of Tajikistan, in the Kumsangir region. Abdujalil has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local wholesale traders. He also has farm land where he grows vegetables. He has 9 years of experience in his businesses. The milk products are in demand in his village and his orders for them are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for the traders, so he decided to apply for $3000 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder as well as seeds and fertilizer. Abdujalil is very grateful to everyone who is helping him improve his standard of living with this loan.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a cow and farm supplies

loans.name: Untie

texts.en:
Untie A. is married and has five dependents. She has completed a senior high education. Untie travels to Teshiman to buy bags of maize, tubers of yams, bunches of plantains, and other foods to sell at Abura. Her husband is a laboratory technician. Untie uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. 

Untie will use the loan to purchase additional bags of maize and other foods to meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Jenipher Olanga

texts.en:
Jenipher could hardly bear the economic hurdles her family was experiencing since affording even a single meal was a hard task due to the fact that she was separated from her husband and had to single-handedly fend for the family's needs. In the year 2003, she started a hotel business (a very primitive restaurant) in Nyamasaria market to generate income for the family's upkeep. 

She normally travels after every three days to bring in more stock. Her main reason for joining K-MET was to get a loan worth 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which she will use part of to expand her business and will then channel some into paying college fees for her son. 

She is aged 45 years and a mother of five children.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley B. is from the village of Mambabanga, Luna, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Shirley is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Shirley owns and operates a general store. She decided to restart her typical retail store in their village, and plans to sell food and daily use products. She hopes that generous Kiva lenders will grant her loan to use as additional capital in her business.

In 2010, Shirley joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Shirley from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel C. es un gran comerciante de 55 años que vive en Palmar de Varela en el departamento del Atlántico, un municipio muy cerca al Río Magdalena, río colombiano de mayor extensión y principal arteria fluvial del país; allí  tiene un expendio donde vende carne de res, vísceras y pescado y también mercancía variada  como vestidos, accesorios; en este pueblo  habita con su esposa, que lo apoya  y sus tres hijos en las edades de 13 a 20 años.
 
Manuel inicialmente vendía vísceras y carne de res en su familia y luego vendió poco a poco a sus vecinos mas cercanos, hasta que  lo organizó con una   mesa en la sala de su casa y agregó pescado, producto que le solicitaron los mismos clientes; fue así como empezaron a comprarle vecinos de otros barrios por la calidad de sus cárnicos y gradualmente ha ido creciendo. Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual ha podido ofrecer créditos para sus mejores clientes, porque antes contaba con muy poco capital para hacerlo. El tiene como meta adecuar un local para su negocio de cárnicos y en un futuro extender su negocio hacia el centro del pueblo. Hoy  solicita su credikiva para comprar mayor cantidad de productos de carnicería y respaldar su cartera que cada día es mayor, porque sus sueños también están concentrados en su negocio, para mejorar su nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel Cabellero is a great salesperson, he is 55 years old and he lives in Palmar de Varela, in the Atlantico region. The municipality is very close to Rio Magdalena, the longest river in Columbia and the primary source of water in the country. He has a stand where he sells beef meat, tripe and fish, as well as various other merchandise such as dresses and accessories. In this village he lives with his wife and their three children, aged between 13 and 20 years of age. Manuel initially sold tripe and beef meat to his family but later he started selling to his closest neighbors. He later refashioned a table in his living room to store fish, a product that was highly sought out by his clients. Clients from other districts started to buy from him, given the high quality of his meat products. He has gradually expanded his business. This is the second loan he seeks through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). He will be able to provide his clients a better service. Prior to this he had very little capital to work with. His goal is to set up a store from where to sell meat products and in the future he would like to move his business to the downtown core of the village. He requests a loan to purchase greater quantities of meat from the butchers to supply his ever growing roster of clients. His dreams are to improve his business, and improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of meat products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a member of Elshadai group in Faulu Kenya.   She sells clothes to earn a living. She also runs a cafeteria and a retail shop in Muthurwa open-air market.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya because her business and her life have improved.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy second-hand clothes, sugar and cooking flour for use in her cafeteria.  She sees herself owning a big supply shop for clothes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes, sugar and cooking flour

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: El señor Rafael Antonio B. A., tiene la edad de 37 años vive en un Barrio de la Capital, con su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad que dependen económicamente de sus padres, pero que ayudan a las tareas del hogar y el trabajo del campo, ya que la familia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 20 años, y durante este tiempo han luchado contra la sequia y las enfermedades en sus plantillos, fue gracias al apoyo de su padres quien le enseño esta actividad para ganarse el sustento de ella y su familia, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como insumos, fertilizantes y fungicidas que favorezcan a un mantenimiento mas optimo a la producción de su cosechas, incrementar sus ventas y a futuro optar con los recursos económicos para solventar el gasto de sus carreras profesionales y la de sus hijos y/o remodelar su viviendo puesto que con las lluvias del invierno se ha deteriorado y amenaza con la seguridad y salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio B. A. is 37 years old and lives in a neighborhood of the capital with his wife and two underage children who depend economically on their parents but help with housework and farm work. The family has dedicated itself to farming for over 20 years. During this time they have fought against drought and disease in their crops. It is thanks to the support of Rafael Antonio's parents who taught him how to farm that he can earn a living for his family.

He is requesting a loan for his business to purchase materials such as agricultural supplies, fertilizers, and fungicides that favor a more optimal maintenance and production of his crops, increase sales, and in the future to use these economic resources to settle the expense of his professional careers and those of his children and/or repair his home because the winter rains have damaged it, threatening the health and security of his family.

loans.use: Compra de materiles vegetativo para sus cosechas

loans.name: Wesley Kiprono

texts.en:
Wesley Kiprono K. has been operating a butcher shop for six years in Turbo Eldoret-Kenya. He is 44 years old and married to Magdaline Jepkorir K.. They have three children who are 22, 18 and 16 years old. The wife is a businesswoman and this is another added income for the family. Out of the butchery business Wesley earns a profit of about $200 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, with which he is planning to buy three more cows. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business he wants to educate his children and support his family. 
  
Wesley hopes and dreams to own a bigger butchery where he would be able to sell meat to all of the town.

loans.use: To buy three more cows.

loans.name: Aurelia Monserrate

texts.es:
Aurelia de 44 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc. vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Ella tiene la tienda hace varios años para ayudar con los gastos a su esposo y poder conseguir sus propios ingresos, comenzó comprando bebidas, arroz, enlatados. Desde ese tiempo ella construyo la tienda en la parte delantera de su casa para que sea visible para sus clientes vendiendo toda clase de víveres ha podido surtir su tienda. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, lácteos, arroz. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 44 years old.  She has a convenience store where she sells rice, groceries, drinks etc.  She lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads and whose houses are located in the mountains).

She has had the store for several years to help her husband with household expenses and to generate her own income.  She started off buying drinks, rice and groceries.  Since that time she built the store in the front part of her home so that it would be visible to her customers.  Selling all kinds of provisions, she has been able to stock her store.  She works from 7.00am to 10.00pm every day.

In order to increase her merchandise she would like to use the loan to buy drinks, dairy products and rice.  In the future, she would like to expand and better stock her store in order to give her children a better future.

loans.use: Drinks, dairy products

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza E. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Esperanza is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Esperanza owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esperanza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Esperanza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. M. is forty-eight years old, married, and has four children aged between twenty-four and six years old. Her business is located at Mwingi town and is served by Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for its production of pineapples. She has been selling baby accessories which include diapers, wet wipes, baby shirts etc. She sells mostly to the local people. 

She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more diapers, plastic pants and baby shirts to expand her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to wholesale status in future. She describes herself as creative, innovative, time conscious and aggressive.

loans.use: Diapers, plastic pants and baby shirts

loans.name: Rizal

texts.en:
Rizal T. is from the village of Sta. Cruz. He is 54 years old. Rizal is married and has three children. To make a living, Rizal owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rizal has been engaged in his business for over 34 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rizal joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizal has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rizal is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rizal from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana Luz H. de 34 años que vive en el barrio la Chinita con su conyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años . Desde hace 15 años se dedicò a la elaboraciòn de cojines  y desde hace 5 su esposo adicionò la venta de cerdos  los fines de semana , en base a estos trabajos Diana y su esposo han planeado toda su vida con el fin de sacar a sus hijos adelante y ofrecerles una eduacion de calidad que asegure un futuro exitoso. El sueño de Diana es lograr adecuar su vivienda completamente y esto lo lograrà afianzado su negocio de la mano de su esposo y apoyada por los financiamientos de la Fundaciòn Santo Domingo, organizaciòn en la que esta aplicando a su primer financiamiento, asì con su credikiva comprarà materia prima para elaborar cojines de la època navideña de los que tiene ya pedidos  y quiere atrasar su entrega, asi mismo invertira en la compra de cerdo de contado, porque en las fiestas navideñas este es el insumo principal de todas las comidas especiales y diana Luz y su esposo aprovecharàn este buen momento que tendrà su negocio llamado : “Venta y elaboraciòn de cerdos y cojines, la bendiciòn de Dios”
texts.en:
Diana Luz H. is 34 years old.  She lives in La Chinita neighborhood with her husband and two children aged 9 and 12.

She has been making cushions for 15 years.  5 years ago, her husband also started selling pigs on weekends.  Through their work, Diana and her  husband have managed to get their children ahead in life and offer them a good-quality education that will guarantee them a successful future.

Diana Luz' dream is to manage to completely remodel her home.  She will achieve this by strengthening her business, with her husband's help, and also with the support of loans from Fundación Santo Domingo.  She is requesting her first loan from the organization.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy materials for making Christmas cushions for which she already has orders and whose delivery she has delayed.  She will also invest in making a cash purchase of pigs because during the Christmas period this is a key ingredient for all the special meals that people make.  Diana Luz and her husband will take advantage of this good moment for their business called : "Sale and production of pigs and cushions: God's blessing".

loans.use: To buy materials for making Christmas cushions for which she already has orders and has delayed their delivery.  To also invest in making a cash purchase of pigs

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edwin; el tiene 38 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en una institución llamada Seda Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere seguir mejorando en su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edwin is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Edwin is 38 years old, single, and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his work in an institution called "Seda Cusco".  He works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Edwin would like to continue improving his home.  He is requesting this loan for his children's education.

Edwin is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: For his children's education

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Pom S., age 35, is a married woman who has been living in her own small house with other family members in Kompong Thom province. To earn a living, she cultivates a rice crop on her own farmland, which came from her grandparent. 

Pom S. can grow her crop two times a year, in both the rainy season and dry seasons. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. To help be responsible for family, her husband works in construction for a profit. This couple has two small kids. 

Pom S. requests a loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To decorate her house

loans.name: Akbala's Group

texts.en:
The lack of a formal education doesn’t stop our entrepreneurs from getting engaged in business. They believe their skills and life experience are far more relevant than formal education. 

Akbala N., 48, is a member of this group. He’s a resident of the town of Kadamjai in southern Kyrgyzstan. He is divorced and doesn’t have any kids. Akbala operates a repair shop fixing vehicles. He likes his work and is keen to improve it. He wants to start a new life though his perseverance and ambition. Akbala is an eager beaver and strives for a better standard of living. He also helps his aged mother financially. Machinery has always been Akbala’s strong passion. There were times when he dreamed of getting a technological education and opening his own car producing business. But unfortunately, he didn’t have any opportunities for getting an education. He’s been in this business for just two years and already he's become famous among customers and has waiting lists of them. He’s earning 5000 soms a month, but he says his plans for the business will take more than that. Akbala plans to buy spare parts for cars to improve the quality and speed of his services. He says every model of a car needs a unique part and a special approach. 

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: United Traders Association Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “United Traders Association” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Adama A. is the leader of this group. The 36-year-old is married to a teacher and they have two children. Adama has been a businesswoman for fourteen years now. She sells fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose W. is a married lady who has one child, aged three years. Her business is located at Kongowea estate in Mombasa, Kenya.  Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, including the Indian Ocean's white beaches. She owns a beauty salon in which she sells hair weaves, relaxers and treatments, as well as taking care of women's hair. She has been in this business for the last three years and has managed to give employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable, and that the major challenge she has is debtors who refuse to pay as per agreement. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 25,000 to buy salon equipment to expand her business. She sees herself becoming a beauty consultant inthe future. She describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment
